Quasimorph is a turn-based rogue-like game.

Health Points
Health is one of the key characteristics. When health points (HP) reach zero, the character dies. To restore health, you can use autodocs, first aid kits, heal wounds with high-quality stabilizing materials, or maintaining a good diet. A high-calorie reserve activates natural regeneration (+1 HP per turn), and zero causes atrophy (-1 HP per turn). Activating the character's abilities also spends calories. Do not be surprised that hunger comes so quickly. The heroes you control are clones with a metabolism cranked up to maximum.

Movement
Depending on the chosen method of movement, the player receives a different number of action points (AP) per turn. Stealth movement is slow, gives only one AP, but the player gets a stealth bonus and the ability to not spend AP when interacting with doors, objects, or inventory. Normal movement gives two AP, no penalties or bonuses. Running gives three AP, but while running you cannot interact with doors, objects, and inventory. But you can use weapons. Each method of movement consumes its own number of calories.

Perks
Active perks are triggered automatically when the activation conditions are met. Each ability has its own trigger. After activation, the character receives temporary bonuses and experience, gradually improving that ability. Passive perks are active constantly and also improve if the character performs the actions specified in the perk text: shoots from a certain weapon, moves while overloaded, and so on.

Quasimorphosis
The level of quasimorphosis increases due to the influence of entities that resides in the bramfaturas of the Solar System planets. These entities are called quasimorphs. The higher the quasimorphosis meter, the more aggressive the enemies. As the meter rises, the subtle and physical worlds come into contact, and quasimorphs gain the ability to move into our reality. During their manifestation, they are invulnerable to weapons and do not attack.

Wounds
Successful attacks on a character can not only reduce HP, but also cause wounds. To treat wounds, you must use any items that have wound stabilizing or healing properties. However, even a stabilized wound has a chance of infection, so it is useful to use antibiotics or sorbents. A stabilized wound can open again after some time. In this case, you need to repeat the stabilization procedure. Morphine and first aid kits allow you to close all current wounds and can be used from quick slots even while running. Autodoc heals all wounds at once, except for amputated limbs. Particularly strong substances - morphine, alcohol, cigarettes, and gavvakh - can cause addiction. Each type of addiction has its own penalties. Repeated use of the corresponding substance will reset the progress of the addiction, but will not cure it.

Weapons and Armor
Different types of long-range weapons have different types and consumption of ammunition. Weapons break over time. Study the characteristics of not only weapons, but also ammunition: many of them have special effects. In addition to the usual types of damage, there are composite ones: explosive (blunt and piercing), plasma (cut and fire). The lowest armor value corresponding to the types of damage protects against them. You can always disassemble weapons and armor that are useless to you into spare parts. They can be used to repair the equipment you use. Cloth can be torn into rags which can be used to stabilize wounds, repair clothes and backpacks. Broken weapons cannot be used, broken armor does not increase damage resistance, and the contents of a broken backpack or vest fall out every turn. Accuracy and dodge have upper limits and bonuses for exceeding them. If accuracy becomes greater than 95%, then every 10% above it increases the chance of a critical hit by 1%, after which accuracy decreases to 95%. If dodge becomes greater than 95%, then every 10% above it decreases the chance of getting wounded by 1%, after which dodge decreases to 95%. Armor damage reduction is calculated using a non-linear formula. The higher your armor rating, the less reduction the next armor point will give. You can see by what percentage the armor reduces the damage received in the tooltip by hovering the mouse cursor over your armor ratings at the bottom of the inventory. The same tooltip will show protection against composite damage types. Having sharp weapons in your inventory allows you to amputate limbs. Be careful! Amputation of some body parts is fatal.

Interactive objects
The elevator is a key object on each floor of the station, it takes the player to the next floor. Useful items can be found in medical and weapon boxes. Autodocs allow you to restore health and heal wounds. To use them, you need at least one charge. You can restore the charge by spending energy batteries. The level scanner allows you to get more information on the minimap. It also uses energy batteries to get more data. Doors can not only be opened, but also closed or blocked. Options for interacting with doors are available by pressing the right mouse button, same for information about enemies.

Factions and missions
The strength of a faction is determined by two parameters: Power and Technology. Power affects the missions issued by the faction, namely: the number of enemies, the quality of the dropped items and the reward. Power affects the chance of successfully completing a mission without the player's participation, and is also spent on creating new missions. Technology determines the equipment available to the faction, which they can use and sell, and the number of missions that the faction can issue at one time. These parameters increase over time depending on the stations in the faction's possession and the completed missions. If the faction has not issued a reward for a task in full, then it will accumulate credit that can be used for the next barter. Factions and their characteristics can be viewed in the first tab of the Stock Exchange.

Barter and Free Market
As PMCs are illegal organizations, they are not connected to the system-wide trading network and are not included in the reputation-based economy. However, corporations agree to exchange items with PMCs. Keep in mind that factions will not always accept or sell items at market price, and some items offered by corporations have a fixed value. The items accepted depend on the station where the exchange takes place, and their selection changes over time. Current accepted items can be viewed in the station tooltip, and those sold - in the second barter tab.The game operates on the law of Supply and Demand. Stations use the items they accept to produce goods, and then sell them to other stations. Because of this, the price of barter items can vary greatly. You can view current prices and their dynamics in the second tab of the Stock Exchange. If you have sufficient reputation with the faction, you can directly purchase items from the inventory of stations in the second barter tab. In this case, the first tab will be used to exchange items for faction credit. To exchange without having to visit stations, you can enable Fast Trading in the settings.

Trade break
If your reputation with a faction drops below zero, all your accumulated barter points with that faction will be lost.

Actions
Special conditions in the game include eating, moving, or taking an action. Actions in this case include: rearranging items in your inventory, reloading and throwing weapons and grenades, interacting with interactive objects, and activating pact abilities.

Weapon and Character Range
If the target is outside the weapon's range, its properties will not work, and the damage dealt will be reduced for each tile beyond the optimal range. Character range is the range of vision.

Equipment and Repairs
Weapons and armor wear out over time. If equipment is repaired using spare parts instead of appropriate repair kits, then with each repair, their maximum durability will decrease. Because of this, weapons and armor may become completely unusable.

Shift and Ctrl in inventory
Moving an item while holding Shift will move all items of that type. If you left-click on an item while holding Ctrl, it will be moved to/from the inventory.

Amputations
Amputations are the most severe type of injury. They cannot be cured, only stabilized, temporarily removing the damage received, but not the negative effects. Some parts of the body are connected to each other: the thigh and foot, the shoulder and arm. When the upper body is amputated, the lower, adjacent part is also amputated. Vital parts of the body are the head, chest, body, and stomach. Their amputation leads to instant death.

Where are quasimorphs?
At the start of the game, there are no quasimorphs on Earth, its artificial satellite Tsiolkovsky, as well as on Mars, Phobos and Deimos. In mission types such as Defense, Control, Security quasimorphosis and eccollaps are absent.

Breaking walls
All walls can be broken if enough damage is inflicted.

Puddles
Any liquids (water, blood, fuel, poison) can leave behind puddles. If the new puddle is larger or the same size as the old one, the new one will replace the old one. Spilled fuel can catch fire. Puddles of poison are considered dangerous tiles and dry out over time. If any item other than quest ones or pacts ends up in the poison puddle, it will be destroyed.

Items and Fire
If a floor tile with raw meat catches fire, the meat will become fried. Any other items, except quest items and pacts, will be destroyed.

Add. damaging elements
A weapon with this property, when destroying cover, deals damage to everyone standing next to that cover.

Add. knockback range
Weapons with this property push away the target they hit further than any other.

Amputation due to injury
Weapons with this property have an increased chance of amputation as a wound.

Silencer
Shooting a weapon with a silencer has a chance to not attract the attention of nearby enemies.

Pierce Chance
Ammo with this property have a chance to pass through an obstacle (cover or even an enemy) and hit a target behind it.

Pollution Chance
Ammo with this property have a chance to leave behind a dangerous tile of the corresponding type.

Pain Damage
Weapons with this property increase damage to the pain meter.

Severe fractures
Fracture type wounds inflicted by weapons with this property have increased damage.

Severe bleeding
Bleeding type wounds inflicted by weapons with this property have increased damage.

Attacks nearby
Weapon with this property additionally hit the left and right tiles closest to the player on either side of the target.

Weapon Throwing
If you press LMB on an enemy at a distance while holding Shift and with a melee weapon equipped, the clone will throw the weapon at the target. The maximum range of a such throw is 5 tiles, starting from the clone's tile.

Accurate throw
Throwing a weapon with this property will always hit the target.

Piercing Throw
A weapon with this property, when thrown, can pass through the target and damage targets behind it.

Wound-inflicting pierce through
Weapons with this property inflict a wound if the attack pierces the enemy through. The Pierce Chance can be found in the properties of ammo.

Backup Gun
Weapons with this property increase the critical hit chance by the specified value for weapons in other slots.

Ramp Up Shot
Weapons with this property increase their rate of fire when firing continuously.

Painful Critical Hits
Weapons with this property inflict additional pain on critical hits.

Armor Penetration
Weapons with this property subtract the specified percentage of the target's armor before calculating the damage reduction from the armor.

Field of View
Weapons with this property modify the clone's field of view to the specified value.

Weapons with their own damage type
Some types of weapons (plasma, electric, cold) use the characteristics of not loaded ammo, but their own, thus replacing both the damage type and other characteristics. You can view the replacing characteristics during the mission by hovering the mouse cursor over the ammo icon in the upper left corner.

Deleting Modification Projects
If you reduce all the stats of equipment upgrade projects to base values, then after finishing work on the project, the stats of all equipment already produced under this project will also be reduced to base values, and the project itself will be deleted, thus freeing up the slot.

Population
A station resource responsible for its efficiency. With high/low population, the station produces goods faster/slower. Population grows over time if the necessary resources are available, but can be changed based on the results of a completed mission.

Allow user data (saves, logs, screenshot from the game) to be sent?

The phenomenon in which a creature is torn from the inside and a Quasimorph appears in its place is called an <color=#FFFEC1>eccolapse</color>. On the first turn the newly appeared Quasimorph is invulnerable, it phases between our and their realities. At this moment, it makes no sense to fire at it, it’s better to take a tactically more advantageous position.

Valuable items such as production chips and mercenary mind chips justify the costs of using the shuttle. If you find something like this on a mission, we can evacuate you as part of the standard procedure using the elevator or shuttle.

Injuries are common in combat situations. The first priority is to treat the wound. You can use bandages, splints, or even ordinary rags for that. To obtain a rag, tear up any unnecessary clothing. Autodocs and surgical kits allow you to immediately heal any wound.
Some wounds can become infected. To prevent this, use sorbent or antibiotics.

Your body constantly requires calories for normal functioning. When satiety drops to zero, the atrophy process begins, which continually reduces your health. Simply eat something. Keep in mind that cannibalism is not encouraged but not prohibited, so if you have melee weapons, you can resort to it.
Almost any weapon consumes ammunition and need to be reloaded. Avoid doing this in the midst of battle because you become vulnerable during the reloading process. Try to find cover.
Weapons have a tendency to break with regular and active use. To repair them, you can disassemble other unnecessary weaponry or use a repair kit.

Your backpack has torn. I'll remind you this time but try to keep an eye on the condition of your equipment yourself. Contents will constantly spill out from a torn backpack or rig. To repair it, use any available fabric.

Enemies can also use offensive grenades. Of course, they do it much worse than our operatives, but there are exceptions. To avoid getting hit by shrapnel, it's better to move to a safe distance and find cover.

Since we conduct illegal activities, trade transactions between corporations and participants in the dignitas market are not available to us. But given our influence on the Solar System, corporations are ready to barter with us.

Different stations require different goods, as soon as we bring them and unload them into the station warehouse, the station owners will be happy to exchange them for some of their own items. The course is certainly extortionate, but it's worth it.

The capacity of our mother spacecraft allows us to produce items directly on board. To produce most simple items, we only need a licensed chip.

There are examples in history of how one corporation tried to introduce an additional fee for each item produced, but as a result of the six-day war, the corporation went bankrupt, and all the others refused such monetization.

<color=#FFFEC1>Clones</color> often die on missions, there's nothing to be done about it, but on the other hand, any clone can be reprinted on a <color=#FFFEC1>bioprinter</color>. Plus, we have <color=#FFFEC1>insurance</color> for such cases, which partially compensates for the lost equipment. To do this, find the <color=#FFFEC1>Emergency Case</color> in the Magnum's inventory, right-click on it, and select <color=#FFFEC1>dismantle</color>.

This device is a communication jammer, EW-thing, interfering transmitter, name it. It jams some of the communication channels between you and Magnum. Therefore, we cannot send you station minimaps. If you destroy the jammer, the channels will be free and the minimap will be accessible. So don't hesitate, shoot.
Careful! There are acid puddles next to you. They are difficult to notice but they are extremely dangerous. Avoid them or let them dry.

This is the <color=#FFFEC1>HIS Magnum</color> control screen. From here you can access the list of clone operators and the Cargo Hold (Top right corner of the screen). To go to the spacecraft's compartments click on any compartment marker.

This is a list of weapon modification projects. Here you can select the weapon whose chip you have unlocked and improve its characteristics. Keep in mind that the price of modification is growing exponentially, and the number of projects is limited.

This is a list of armor modification projects. Here you can select the armor whose chip you have unlocked and improve its characteristics. Keep in mind that the price of modification is growing exponentially, and the number of projects is limited.

This is a list of class development projects. Here you can select a class and replace its perks with the perks of any other unlocked class. Keep in mind that the development price increases exponentially depending on the number of perks being replaced, and the number of projects is limited.

The barter module allows you to load a trade shuttle and send it to any body of the Solar System. Select a planet or a satellite, look at the required items by the stations, load them via the “Trade Shuttle” under the list of stations and send the shuttle. In a few days it will return with the items received after the barter.

This is a list of clone development projects. Here you can choose a clone of the operator whose chip you unlocked and improve its characteristics or even change their personal perk. Keep in mind that the price of development is growing exponentially, and the number of projects is limited.
This is a list of operators undergoing training to level up their class perks. The available maximum level for training depends on the unlocked module upgrades.

Bad news, Boss. We have exhausted all our supplies of consciousness chips and no longer have the ability to clone operatives. Our situation is as close as possible to the complete destruction of our company as a structure.

The only solution available to us at the moment... Is to send you on a mission, Boss.

Welcome to the Quasimorph Early Access! Please remember that the game is actively in development, and the current version does not have all the planned features. You can find information about our upcoming plans on the game's page and in the game's main menu.

And don't forget about bug reports! Most likely, we are already working on fixes but you can help by reporting bugs through the dedicated section in the main menu.

Hop into our Discord to discuss the game with us and other players, and receive updates before everyone else.
Do you want to continue training?

Supplies on the spacecraft are running low, so we need to find some new profitable <color=#FFFEC1>contracts</color>. We can start working for anyone and make them the dominant power in the System, or we can try to maintain the status quo for the sake of long term profiting from this apocalypse. We can start by returning the <color=#FFFEC1>AnСom's PCPU</color> from our cargo hold to its rightful owners. Or bring it to someone else. Also, if we can land a mighty blow on <color=#FFFEC1>Tezctlan</color>, there is a chance that he has enemies on <color=#FFFEC1>Venus</color> and they will contact us. It's up to you, <color=#FFFEC1>Boss</color>.
Boss, if you leave the mission, you won't be cloned. Are you sure about your decision?

Good morning, <color=#FFFEC1>Boss</color>. Let's first restore memory after the diapause. During the AnCom mission on Venus, we awakened a quasimorph named <color=#FFFEC1>Tezctlan</color>. Now his quasimorphs are still in our world, which is weird. There's no information in the news that we're involved.. Meanwhile, corporates insist that quasimorphosis is a fabrication and claim that <color=#FFFEC1>Tezctlan</color> is a provocation by <color=#FFFEC1>Civil Resistance</color>. We are now orbiting <color=#FFFEC1>Phobos</color> and have time to recover and figure out what to do next. The supplies on the spacecraft are running low, so we need to find ourselves some new profitable...

<color=#FFFEC1>ATTENTION! ATTENTION!</color> Vector 4, sector 6, northern hemisphere. Five launches detected, rocket engines. Approaching rapidly. Activating countermeasures. <color=#FFFEC1>"Magnum"</color>, grab onto something - it's going to be loud.
It seems to be <color=#FFFEC1>Civil Resistance</color>. We need to clear them out from <color=#FFFEC1>"Magnum"</color>. Our future depends on it.

Let's remember how to move. To navigate, use {0} on the required square or {1} on the keyboard.

In the bottom-left corner of the screen, you'll find your energy reserve, pain threshold counter, health, and movement mode. The Movement mode determines how many action points you have until opponents take their turn.

Make sure no one is behind you, press {2} to look around. In the closet behind you, you'll find standard equipment, use it.

column1:
En la esquina inferior izquierda de la pantalla, encontrarás tu reserva de energía, el contador de umbral de dolor, la salud y el modo de movimiento. El modo de movimiento determina cuántos puntos de acción tienes hasta que los oponentes realicen su turno.

Asegúrate de que no haya nadie detrás de ti, presiona {2} para mirar alrededor. En el armario detrás de ti, encontrarás equipo estándar, úsalo.
column2: Przypomnijmy sobie, jak się poruszać. Aby poruszać się, użyj {0} na odpowiednim kwadracie lub {1} na klawiaturze.

column1:
W lewym dolnym rogu ekranu znajdziesz swoją rezerwę energii, licznik progu bólu, zdrowie i tryb ruchu. Tryb ruchu określa, ile masz punktów akcji, zanim przeciwnicy podejmą swoją turę.

Upewnij się, że za tobą nie ma nikogo, naciśnij {2}, aby rozglądać się. W szafie za tobą znajduje się standardowe wyposażenie, użyj go.
column2: Nasıl hareket edeceğimizi hatırlayalım. Hareket etmek için, gereken karede {0} veya klavyede {1} tuşunu kullanın.

column1:
Ekranın sol alt köşesinde enerji rezervinizi, ağrı eşiği sayacınızı, sağlığı ve hareket modunu bulacaksınız. Hareket modu, rakiplerin sırayla oyun yapmadan önce kaç eylem puanınız olduğunu belirler.

Arkanda kimse olmadığından emin olun, etrafına bakmak için {2} tuşuna basın. Arkandaki dolapta standart ekipman bulunmaktadır, onu kullanın.
column2:
Vamos lembrar como se mover. Para navegar, use {0} no quadrado desejado ou {1} no teclado.

No canto inferior esquerdo da tela, você encontrará sua reserva de energia, contador do limite de dor, saúde e modo de movimento. O modo de movimento determina quantos pontos de ação você tem até que os oponentes joguem.

Certifique-se de que ninguém esteja atrás de você, pressione {2} para olhe ao redor. No armário atrás de você você encontrará equipamentos padrão, use-os.

column1:
屏幕左下角显示有能量储备、疼痛阈值计数表、健康和移动模式。 移动模式 确定在敌人轮到之前你有多少行动点。

确保你身后没有人， 按 {2} 键 四处看看。请使用在你身后橱箱里面的一套标准装备。

column2: Leave the cabin and head to the <color=#FFFEC1>elevator</color>, it's in the room across. We need to eliminate all these bastards.

If you press key {0}, you can get information about the <color=#FFFEC1>mission status</color> or request <color=#FFFEC1>evacuation</color>. <color=#FFFEC1>Evacuation</color> is done via elevator or shuttle. But right now, we have nowhere to retreat...

To move between station levels, use <color=#FFFEC1>elevators</color> or <color=#FFFEC1>stairs</color>. In the elevator control window, all floors connected by the elevator shaft are displayed. Press the floor you need. I strongly recommend starting with the <color=#FFFEC1>Medbay</color>. If we lose the <color=#FFFEC1>bioprinter</color>, there will be serious difficulties in cloning you or other fighters.

This is the <color=#FFFEC1>Medbay</color>, where the <color=#FFFEC1>bioprinter</color> is located. A perfect place to remind you about your health. If your health reaches zero, you will die. If your pain threshold reaches its limit, you will skip a turn. Damage you receive can lead to injuries or limb loss. Keep an eye on that. Take a close look at the health interface by pressing the {0} key.
I'm sending a signal to your computer about a new <color=#FFFEC1>wound</color>; you need to fix it. To do this, press {0} on the medical kit to your right, then select the injured body part.

It seems you've acquired an <color=#FFFEC1>infection</color>. Open your inventory by pressing {0} and use a <color=#FFFEC1>sorbent</color> or <color=#FFFEC1>antibiotic</color>. If the wound is not fixed, the <color=#FFFEC1>infection</color> develops faster.

In extreme cases, you can perform an <color=#FFFEC1>amputation</color>. To do this, select 'amputate' in the context menu of a <color=#FFFEC1>sharp object</color> and choose the <color=#FFFEC1>body part</color>. Note that you can't bandage yourself while in sprint mode.

<color=#FFFEC1>AutoDoc</color> allows you to treat wounds or infections if it has <color=#FFFEC1>charges</color>. You can recharge it with standard <color=#FFFEC1>batteries</color>. Hurry, I've spotted an <color=#FFFEC1>enemy</color> in the room below you. Deal with them.

Great job. Pay attention to the body. Click on it to <color=#FFFEC1>loot</color>. If you want to <color=#FFFEC1>stand on the corpse</color> without inspecting it, use {0} for movement. When you're done here, return to the elevator and descend to the next level. In the top right corner, there's a <color=#FFFEC1>minimap</color> and the current <color=#FFFEC1>mission status</color>. Use these buttons if you forget what's happening.

And here's our <color=#FFFEC1>arsenal</color>. Ammo and melee weapons have different <color=#FFFEC1>damage types</color>, and armor has different <color=#FFFEC1>resistance types</color>. Choose wisely with what and how to attack to win.

Let's make sure your weapon is loaded and ready for battle. To reload your weapon, press {0}. If the ammo is in the tactical vest slot in the middle of the screen, press the corresponding quick-access slot key, and reloading will take fewer turns.

You have two weapon slots. You can quickly switch between them by clicking on the image of the active weapon in the top left or by pressing the {1} button.

column1: Tienes dos <color=#FFFEC1>ranuras para armas</color>. Puedes cambiar rápidamente entre ellas haciendo clic en la imagen del arma activa en la parte superior izquierda o usando la tecla {1}.
column2: Upewnijmy się, że twoja broń jest naładowana i gotowa do walki. Aby naładować broń, naciśnij {0}. Jeśli naboje znajdują się w slocie kamizelki taktycznej pośrodku ekranu, naciśnij odpowiednią klawiszem slotu szybkiego dostępu, a przeładowanie zajmie mniej tur.

column1: Masz dwie <color=#FFFEC1>przestrzenie na broń</color>. Możesz szybko między nimi przełączać, klikając na obrazie aktywnej broni u góry po lewej lub używając klawisza {1}.
column2:
Haydi, silahının şarjlı ve savaşa hazır olduğundan emin olalım. Silahını şarj etmek için {0}'e bas. Mermiler taktik yeleğin yuvasında ise, hızlı erişim yuvasının ilgili tuşuna bas ve şarj daha az tur alır.

İki silah yuvasına sahipsin. Onlar arasında hızlıca geçiş yapabilirsin, sol üstteki etkin silahın resmine tıklayarak veya {1} tuşunu kullanarak.

column1: 2つの<color=#FFFEC1>武器スロット</color>があります。左上のアクティブな武器の画像をクリックするか、キー{1}を使用して素早く切り替えることができます。
column2:
让我们确保你的武器已经装填好，随时可以参与战斗。重新装填武器，请按 {0} 键。如果子弹是在屏幕中央的战术背心槽里，按下相应的快速访问槽键。这样再把武器装填好所需花的回合会少得多。

你有两个武器槽。你可以通过点击左上角的活动武器图像或使用按键 {1} 快速切换它们。

I suggest hiding behind the cover to make it harder for enemies to hit us. To do this, stand on the highlighted square.

The cover can stop a bullet if you're not shooting directly from behind it. If your shooting trajectory intersects the cover, it will be highlighted in red.

column1: Die <color=#FFFEC1>Deckung</color> kann eine Kugel stoppen, wenn du nicht direkt von dahinter schießt. Wenn deine Schussbahn die Deckung kreuzt, wird sie rot markiert.
column2:
Je suggère de se mettre à l'abri derrière la couverture pour que les ennemis aient moins de facilité à nous toucher. Pour ce faire, placez-vous sur la case en surbrillance.

La couverture peut arrêter une balle si vous ne tirez pas directement derrière lui. Si la trajectoire de tir croise l'abri, il sera mis en surbrillance en rouge.

column1: 假如你不直接从<color=#FFFEC1>掩体</color>的后面射击，其可以挡子弹。如果弹道与掩体相交，它将以红亮显示。

column2:
Great. Here's some more useful information. If you ever want to shoot somewhere other than the enemy, hold {0}. Your cursor will change to a crosshair, and the shooting trajectory will be displayed.
We have a fuel barrel for the flamethrower; you can blow it up with a shot... Just don't catch fire yourself. Fire is very dangerous!
To the right of the active weapon is the button to select the <color=#FFFEC1>shooting mode</color>. Hover the cursor over it to see the advantages and disadvantages of each.

Someone threw <color=#FFFEC1>grenades</color> into the Machine Room again; I'll deal with them later. <color=#FFFEC1>Grenades</color> are used from the <color=#FFFEC1>utility belt slots</color>. Activate grenade usage with the corresponding hotkey or pressing {0}. Once you're done here, head to the <color=#FFFEC1>cubecentric engine</color> on the left.

Colnodes have barricaded themselves in the upper compartment. Get ready for a serious battle. Use cover and don't play the hero. We have several stationary turrets and mines. They are used in the same way: from the inventory with {0}. Opening the context menu, you need to select ‘use’. Turret or mine in this case will be installed in the cell next to you - in the direction you are facing. Prepare for defense; we have a little time.

Just in case, the key for skipping a turn is {1}. It might be useful if you need to wait for a few turns.
Destroy them before they blow up the <color=#FFFEC1>Cubecentric Engine!</color> Use everything I've already told you, the goal is to protect the <color=#FFFEC1>‘Magnum’</color>.
Well done, <color=#FFFEC1>Frank</color>. All invaders eliminated, and <color=#FFFEC1>‘Magnum’</color> is no longer under threat. See you at the <color=#FFFEC1>Bridge</color>. Over and out.

We can certainly do as <color=#FFFEC1>Jane</color> said. Contracts are waiting. But as the saying goes: <color=#FFFEC1>'Honor is lost, everything is lost; honor is preserved, everything is preserved.'</color>. We were able to track down the exact locations of the shuttlepods launches - it's <color=#FFFEC1>Rogue City</color>. Most likely, <color=#FFFEC1>Civil Resistance</color> has set up a training center and a transshipment point there. Before we start chasing money, I suggest to stick a red-hot poker in the red's ass.

Great, I'm glad that honor is not an empty word to you, <color=#FFFEC1>Boss</color>. Just in case, I'll remind you about the standard mission preparation interface. On this screen, you choose the operative who will go on the mission, the chip with combat skills that will be integrated into the freshly printed clone, and the equipment that we will issue to the fighter for the mission.

This is the <color=#FFFEC1>bioprinter screen</color>. Here you can choose a fighter to go on a mission. The list includes both those who survived previous missions and those who need to be printed. Each of the fighters has their own parameters and unique <color=#FFFEC1>talent</color>. They have all been through a lot during years of combat in every corner of the <color=#FFFEC1>Solar System</color>.

This is the <color=#FFFEC1>class selection screen</color>. In addition to their own experience, each fighter will benefit from gaining a specific set of skills based on the experience of past military conflicts and digitized experience of special forces. Each <color=#FFFEC1>class</color> has a set of passive abilities and trigger abilities that are activated under certain conditions.

Now you need to <color=#FFFEC1>gather your equipment</color>. Take whatever you deem necessary, but don't forget ammo, food, and medical supplies. Note that if the operative you send dies in battle, all the items will be lost, and <color=#FFFEC1>evacuation</color> is only possible when the <color=#FFFEC1>mission is completed</color> or we find something valuable like a new <color=#FFFEC1>consciousness chip</color>.
Great, if you feel ready, it's time to press the <color=#FFFEC1>Start Mission</color> button.

Our scanners see several ways to solve this problem. First, there is the main <color=#FFFEC1>elevator</color> connecting the <color=#FFFEC1>Cargo Dock</color> to the <color=#FFFEC1>Control Center</color>, but the number of biosignatures at the <color=#FFFEC1>elevator</color> is extremely high. Obviously, there is a quite <color=#FFFEC1>strong security</color> there. Secondly, there is a bypass route through the <color=#FFFEC1>stairs and warehouse level</color>. I would recommend using the second option as our main plan, but if you feel confident, you can act as you think best.

Some room nearby is an <color=#FFFEC1>Elevator</color>. Be careful, the signatures of stationary turrets and heavily armored <color=#FFFEC1>colnodes</color> are clearly tracked there. Whatever kills them can kill you too. You are not special, and equipment tends to run out.

These <color=#FFFEC1>stairs</color> leads to the warehouse premises. We have enhanced the resolution capability of the geoscanner, there's medical supplies and some other equipment there. Use everything, and you will easily reach the <color=#FFFEC1>SD control center</color>.

Finally, you're at the <color=#FFFEC1>SD control center</color>. It's full of <color=#FFFEC1>Civil Resistance</color> fighters. A bioscanner is registering spikes in their endocrine systems - it's madness. Maybe there's a way to bypass them? Pay attention to the technical corridors and ventilation shafts. If you picked up <color=#FFFEC1>heavy weaponry</color> from the warehouse, you shouldn't have many problems. Once you find their <color=#FFFEC1>PCO control computer</color>, just destroy it with whatever's at hand.

Great job. Pilots began maneuver as soon as the geoscanner beeped that the <color=#FFFEC1>Rogue City</color> guns died. Mission accomplished. Request <color=#FFFEC1>evacuation</color> and return to the nearest <color=#FFFEC1>elevator</color>.

In front of you, there is a map of the <color=#FFFEC1>Solar System</color>. Here you can see which <color=#FFFEC1>missions</color> are available in different areas and how much <color=#FFFEC1>time it will take to travel</color> from one point to another. Right now, to deliver the PCPU with quasimorphic research to <color=#FFFEC1>AnCom</color>, we need to go to <color=#FFFEC1>Mars</color>. Boss... One more thing. The system is open to us and full of possibilities. You are under no obligation to return the device to its rightful owner. But I wouldn’t risk getting involved with <color=#FFFEC1>AnCom</color>. And... This is the last piece of advice that I gave you.

Choose the <color=#FFFEC1>Rebus Sky City</color> to visit. It's a <color=#FFFEC1>peaceful station</color>, so there's no need to equip the operative who will go there. Also, when we send clones to perform <color=#FFFEC1>barter</color>, we load all the items into the shuttle, so there's no need to make multiple trips if something is forgotten. When you are ready, take the <color=#FFFEC1>PCPU</color> with the research and send the operative.

Have you brought us our <color=#FFFEC1>intellectual property</color>? Great. Find our representative here at the station and deliver the <color=#FFFEC1>PCPU</color>. To do this, click on the <color=#FFFEC1>pile of boxes</color> next to him. Place the PCPU in the opened inventory window and press the <color=#FFFEC1>“Exchange”</color> button. This is how <color=#FFFEC1>barter</color> works at all peaceful stations where you are allowed to land. When you’re done, return to the shuttle and get out of here.

Good work, <color=#FFFEC1>mercenary</color>. If you need contracts, we regularly distribute them through the <color=#FFFEC1>SBN</color> channels. Work for us and you will become rich. But if you stand in our way, the consequences will be dreadful. I hope we understood each other.

I can't stand these corporates... Boss, what next? It seems like you and Frank have satisfied your sense of justice. We're free now. There's chaos all over the System. Taking advantage of the sudden appearance of quasimorphs, the corporations have reshuffled the market. Stations change owners almost every day. Tezctlan, who seems to favor us for its awakening, is squeezing the corporations on Venus. Civil Resistance has been showing some furious activity around Mars. Maybe we should continue fighting against them if we get paid for it? There's no quasimorphosis there, so it will be easier.

We can start working for anyone and make them the mighty power in the System, or we can try to maintain the status quo for the sake of long-term profit from this apocalypse. Also we can decide that Tezctlan is too big a threat to all humanity. We can start fighting against him, hoping that someone will join us. It's up to you, Boss.

Is that you? I remember you. I've been waiting, hoping that you would show up again. And here you are. You've come close enough to Gannix for my call to reach your mind. But this proximity is not enough for us to make a pact. Do not fear, it will be beneficial for both of us. We have something to offer each other. Do you know why Quasimorphosis occurs in the solid realm? Why the barons come to you? To meet me, go to Venus and simply do your job. Massacre them the way you always do. Murders, cannibalism, people screaming in agony. I will sense the sweet aroma of Gavvakh, and I will know it's you. And I will come to you in person. Then we will discuss the terms of our alliance.

Oh yeah, I'm coming. Agony, the cries of the dying, pain leaving your bodies with the blood - all this in the solid realm looks very different inside Gannix. To us, it is a sweet-voiced choir of ecstasy. Gavvakh flows out of your bodies with blood, torment, and life itself. It streams through your realm and seeps into ours. And we can drink it. Taltnoms crave Gavvakh. Taltnoms want Gavvakh.

Gavvakh gives us power. Once we are satiated with Gavvakh, we can tear through the invisible fabric separating our realm from yours. First, we whisper to you. Then, we tempt you. Then, we change you. And finally, when you have been turned into our servants and Gavvakh is flowing, we can reveal ourselves. We do not lose our immortality. Our death in Kenom is merely an exile back to Gannix.

So when you killed me on Mercury, I did not die. Accept my gift, and we will make a pact. You will become my servant. I will give you the power to resist Tezctlan and protect the solid realm, your realm. Now finish the job you came here for. I will help you.
I granted you the Skull of the Feathered Serpent so that you could make a pact with me. It is already on the way to your Ethereal Ship

Finally! You have kept your end of the bargain. From now on, we are bound by an unbreakable pact. Together, we will destroy Tezctlan. We must do this! Once a freedom fighter, first among equals in the emerald crystal of Gannix, the king has gone mad. He must be stopped. He dreams of the Emerald Empire, wishes to expand it beyond Gannix. But he himself had once fought against an insane tyrant possessed by the same delusions.

I will stay in your realm, on Venus. I will gather the Taltnoms loyal to Liberty and fight the madman here. You must head to Mars. There's a place you call Sinkhole Oasis. It's an ancient battlefield. Long before a human ancestor looked up to the stars in fear, a battle took place there. Tezctlan himself took part in it. He emerged victorious, but there he lost his spear. Itzpapalotl, the symbol of the ruler's fate in the Emerald Kingdom, was forever cast on Mars. If you acquire this spear, it is with its help that you will be able to defeat the madman. For your realm, it is salvation from the monster, for Gannix, it is the path to freedom."

Fool! I am Tezctlan, the emperor of eternal Gannix, the lord of the boundless Emerald Empire, the scourge cutting the thread of fate, the leader of legions flying the banners of eagle, jaguar, boa constrictor, and caiman! I am the one who has experienced worship, I am the one who will take Gagtungr's place, I am the one who is truly worthy to rule the Solar System. I am the punishment sent by the universe. Bow your head, mortal. Submit. Accept your fate. In a realm devoid of the golden light of the Sun, the green radiance of Gannix will bring life and death.

Magnum, listen up. This is the head of security at the Sinkhole Oasis geological station. I'm speaking on behalf of the RealWare Corporation. RealWare is committed to the open market and NCE regulations, unlike you. Your visit to the station is not in our interest. You have nothing to offer us. If you don't change course within the next 30 seconds, the artillery of our planetary defense system will blast your HIS to atoms. The countdown starts. Over and out.

Translating from corporate to human, Boss. There's definitely something beyond the scope of the geological station's work at Sinkhole Oasis. RealWare will only let us in if they trust us enough. We'll have to do some work for them if we really need to get in there."

This is a peaceful visit, weapons are prohibited. However, RealWare trusts us enough to let us wander around the station in search of something interesting. We've switched Magnum's geoscanner to passive mode to avoid drawing unnecessary attention. So, search the old-fashioned way. Maybe there's a poorly guarded emergency exit or something. Lady Xiomara sent us here for a reason. Be careful, remember that you literally shoved your arm into RealWare's mouth.

Yes, this is what we've been looking for. The staircase leads to the inner chambers, and it seems there's no alarm here. We can infiltrate the place relatively unnoticed. However, if you run into any security operatives, they will shoot to kill. Stay cautious and only go down after you're ready for a combat mission.
The owner of the station will do not like if you use this backdoor. You should better stay in the safety zone.

We're utilizing the surprise effect to its fullest. Our techies have hacked into Sinkhole Oasis servers and are overloading its network with information noise. You have some time to figure out what's going on here. Find the spear Lady Xiomara mentioned, and gather any valuable data if possible.

What do you see? When you switched to direct actions, we activated the geoscanner. As soon as we scanned the room you're in, it froze up, outputting data that gave our operator a seizure. What on earth is in there? No wonder RealWare is so diligently filtering access to Sinkhole Oasis. Maybe you need to destroy this bloody thing and retrieve the spear from it.

Well, that was a bad idea. A very bad idea. Firstly, you didn't budge a single atom of this thing with your shot. Secondly, the alarm went off. All armed RealWare security operatives are heading your way. We need some information on this Monolith. Gather it, and we'll get you out.
Excellent, this data should suffice. We didn't get the spear, but we can plan our next moves. Return to the elevator; we'll figure out a way to get you out. Let's hope for the best.
We managed to come up with some excuses, but RealWare still suspects us. Our reputation has been compromised.

The data we acquired suggests that this entire Monolith is nothing but a phased feature. But first of all, this event occurred about a billion years ago, and secondly, it completely defies the laws of our universe. We're not the first to try breaking it. RealWare has tried every weapon available to them, including a controlled nuclear blast. The result has always been the same - no result. Looks like we have nothing...

Exactly. You understand NOTHING! This is a priceless find. The Monolith not only phased into our realm from the bramfatura of Mars, but at the time of phasing, it was something entirely different than just a stone. Your problems won't be solved by anyone other than Dr. Eipshwitz. Since I'm now traveling on your spacecraft, can I finally be considered your employee? Let's get closer to mutually beneficial cooperation. NCE. Freedom to contract. Remember?

Well, well... I'll need my Telefaturic Dislocator, several boxes of spare parts and repair kits, and I'll need a lab space on the spacecraft and a lab coat... Ah, no. No coat needed. But a couple of handy assistants are.

Where did I put the Dislocator? You didn't take it back from Mercury? Hm... seems it should still be at Flat Obsidian, in the field camp. We need to evacuate it from there so I can get to work.

I distinctly remember it standing right here! It was stolen! Those filthy colnodian hands think they have the right to touch my property? This is very fragile and infinitely valuable equipment! Search the whole damn station, it's gotta be here somewhere. I need i… I mean, we need it!

What?! Barbarians. Vandals. One, two, three, four, ten, sixty-two. The Dislocator was perfectly dismantled into four parts! Four! Even a colnode with one hand and no thumb can count to four! These idiots have destroyed a masterpiece of human thought! They've pushed all modern science back to the Stone Age! I'll have to start development practically from scratch again. So... I need alloys, microchips, nails... Yeah, maybe four or eight this time? We need to consider our previous experience... Yes... Hm...

Embraced by the mission of the Blood Warriors, from the beginning we know the Realm of Ur, a realm that lies beyond the boundaries of the physical universe. This is our true fatherland. We know Urparp, guardian of the Bright Throne of Gagtungr. To Him we give the glory that comes from our mouth. We also know the created realm. To it we send our curses. We serve the Conqueror Worm, who bestowed the title of Blood Warriors upon us. From the beginning, we remember Him, the father of our spirit, the Ancient Terror for the Manifested Realm. Embraced by the mission of the Blood Warriors, from the beginning we feel Enkidu, rising through us from the bonds of Creation.
Warriors! We were born to die on the battlefield. Our flesh is bound in steel to the will of Lord Urparp! Death to the enemies of the Lord!"

I'm making a cautious assumption that our invasion of Sinkhole Oasis triggered some mechanisms similar to what we've seen on Venus before... I highly doubt, Boss, that what we are doing will benefit us or humanity.

I guess the doctor will be incapable of normal human communication for a while. Anyway, let's try to grab anything even remotely resembling "a true work of art" and get you out of there. Looks like colnode reinforcements have arrived, so we'll have to fight our way back again.

I've seen things you people wouldn't believe… Myriads of Demons on fire off the shell of Ur… I watched ancient rituals that glitter in the dark near the Red and Gold Throne. All those moments will be lost in time, like specks of dust in the Red Desert… Time to die.

I am a god! How can you kill a god? What a magnificent, dizzying innocence! How could you be so naive?! My shackled consciousness is now free, my kingdom is awakening with me. The hour of war is coming, human.
We lost contact with you precisely for... 48.1 minutes. Whatever you've seen or encountered, we need to evacuate you and the spear. Take it and get back to the elevator.

Greetings, mercenary. We have been monitoring your HIS whenever possible. While evaluating your usefulness, we wanted to be able to contact you immediately. The time has come. You might be interested in another short-term contract. The task is simple: reclaim our property once again. You have shown that you are quite good at it. The mission target: <color=#FFFEC1>Oddibjord-3</color> colony on <color=#FFFEC1>Venus</color>. All the details have already been uploaded to the Magnum. You can start whenever you are ready. End of transmission.

Boss, the digital sequences of the contract issued to us by <color=#FFFEC1>AnCom</color> are partially generated or rewritten. If I may say, the contract looks somewhat suspicious. It is likely that the mission is not about reclaiming, but rather seizing someone else’s property. Considering that most of the assets on Venus previously belonged to the <color=#FFFEC1>Fresco</color> corporation, I suspect we are after something from their advanced research. This is a tempting target for many. Thus, we may find ourselves at the center of a conflict among several corporations.

These are <color=#FFFEC1>RealWare</color> operatives, Boss. Signatures are disabled, but everything is clear here. I bet they're looking for the same thing that we are. I'll take a long sip from my "I told you so" mug while I'll be sending this data to AnCom. Let's see their reaction.

We confirm this is a small task force of RealWare Sec fighters. Their corporate transponders are turned off which means they are not covered by NCE. Such episodes among the hexarchs are rare, but this is a good chance to obtain information about the true balance of power in the System.

To facilitate the fulfillment of the contract we dropped two autonomous capsules with resources and promising prototypes from the Unveiled. A great opportunity for you to complete the mission, and for us to conduct field tests. The main goal of the contract does not change. We don't see anything you can't handle.

I detect the signal! You're still alive. The elevator collapsed to the lower level of Oddibjord-3. The device must be <color=#FFFEC1>somewhere nearby</color>. I detect very powerful bursts of quasimorphic activity throughout the entire floor. Looks like you'll have to fight your way out.

Why are violence and sanctity so intertwined? Why is death necessary for life to continue? The master warned that someone would come for the <color=#FFFEC1>Crystal Skull</color>. And he even predicted that it would be the messenger of the one thanks to whom he came to life again in your world. I'm not sorry that you decided to turn your weapons against <color=#FFFEC1>the Emerald Emperor</color>. Your blood will give me new power.

There must be a quasimorphic artifact nearby. Take it and return to the shuttle. This is exactly what we were sent for. <color=#FFFEC1>RealWare</color> reinforcements are arriving to Oddibjord-3, you need to get out of there quickly.

I broadcast on an open channel. You are good for a mercenary. You should have thought about collaborating with RealWare. AnCom are murderers and scammers. It's too late now. The entire sector is under our control, this time you will be eliminated before the task is completed.
Open channel. It's a pleasure doing business with you. Our soldiers have not received such combat experience since the Calypso incident. I hope you're not going to give up. Over and out.

When you'll get to the ground level <color=#FFFEC1>immediately</color> move towards the shuttle. RealWare reinforcements have already taken up defensive positions along the entire perimeter. There are a lot of them there. Pull yourself together and do the best you can.

Attention, <color=#FFFEC1>HIS Unveiled</color> is speaking! «Magnum», we have to inform you that the mission has been <color=#FFFEC1>cancelled</color>. Unfortunately, the contractual obligations will be revoked. We observe a large concentration of the enemy in the mission area. A decision was made to launch a tactical nuclear strike. Goal: protection of intellectual property of AnCom corporation. The costs are considered justified. Your presence in Oddibjord-3 from now on is considered a violation of the AnCom Information Security Protocol. Public Declaration Article 12, Section C, Paragraph 3. Over and out.

Sensors detected the activation of the HIS Unveiled thrusters. This is an AnCom spacecraft in orbit around Venus. The approximation shows reaching the position for dropping the bomb from orbit on Oddibjord-3. They don't have enough time to aim accurately, so you'll be hit only with debris, a shock front, and EMP. Bastards. Run to the shuttle and don't break the damn thing.

Greetings, comrade. You have been active throughout the Solar System lately. It was simply impossible not to notice you. Also we have noticed that you are not averse to working for the benefit of the working people. So let's cooperate! My name is Issachar, I am the commander of the Civil Resistance in the Inner System. And I offer you a job.

My colnodes have infiltrated in the most unexpected assets of the Inner System. Including the orbit of Earth. I've managed to obtain data for faking the SBN transponder. It will allow you to get close to the Heritage station.

Our agent Justas will be waiting for you at the station, take the Red Chip from him. This is a special generative virus, the task of which is to transmit a counter-revolutionary message to all people of the System, and then... to deprive the corporate oppressors of the means of communication. Let's shut the mouths of the enemies of the working class!

We've been spotted. Now all the PMC spacecrafts in the area have received the promise of a huge reward for your elimination. And many have responded kind. The mission is starting to look like our usual work. Find <color=#FFFEC1>Justas</color>, take the <color=#FFFEC1>Red Chip</color>, and make your way to the server.
It seems that <color=#FFFEC1>Justas</color> has been exposed, which is what caused the alarm. This does not affect our mission. Take <color=#FFFEC1>the Chip</color> to unlock the elevator.
The <color=#FFFEC1>Red Chip</color> has to be plugged in the <color=#FFFEC1>mainframe</color>. I hope the Civil Resistance programmers did their job well. The elevator is unlocked, get going.
The alarm is blocking the elevator. We need to <color=#FFFEC1>find Justas</color>, he should have high access.

The SBN has doubled the reward. Of course, our colleagues who were still on the sidelines will not miss such a chance. In addition to them, an operational group of <color=#FFFEC1>SBN Security Service</color> is heading your way. Pull yourself together, it's going to get rough.
One of the squads has been successfully eliminated, but don't relax. I'm picking up another group on sensors.
Oh, that's good. Should be a little easier now. The SBN will probably concentrate their best units in the <color=#FFFEC1>server room</color>.
The mainframe is very close. I'm afraid you'll have to fight your way through crowds of SBN operatives to get out.
The mainframe turned out to be more secured than I expected. You will have to <color=#FFFEC1>protect it</color> until the virus breaks through the defenses.
What the hell! The elevator is blocked again. You won't get out of here until the virus has dealt with the computer.
You need the <color=#FFFEC1>Chip with the virus</color>, don't waste time!

Comrades! It is time to stand up to our oppressors! The corporations will feel the wrath of the working people! We, the workers, are the only ones who sweat and bleed for the good of humanity. The only ones who can turn matter into something. We are the Templars of the proletariat! We give ourselves for the great purpose. For the sake of transforming the world from a state of chaos into a place for people to live! Without us, there will be no peace for those who oppress us to enjoy!

We fought during the Great Anarchist Revolution on both sides of the barricades. We trudged through the black mud of the Earth, our flesh was torn from our bones by the dust storms of Mars. And all this not for awards or glory. Only for the just cause that each of us believes in. When the states fell, what did the new order give us? Instead of the promised liberation, we were faced with new slavery.

But no one managed to break us! Listen to our message! Kill the nearest manager, seize the shuttle and go to the nearest Civil Resistance station! Do everything in your power. Let the Solar System be engulfed in the sacred fire of counterrevolution!
What pretentious nonsense... But I suppose it's a success. All station systems are unlocked, and we can <color=#FFFEC1>evacuate</color> you according to standard protocol.

The immune response of the SBN Network was stronger than we expected. However, our virus has evolved. People all over the Solar System will now receive our callings. It will take the SBN years to catch it.

And one more thing, comrade. Earth no longer seems like an invulnerable sacred cow to anyone. The fires of a new war are about to flare in its orbit. Thank you.
You continue to serve me. This is the right choice. New gifts that will give me new knowledge about the solid realm. The ruler of the Emerald Empire will remember you.

You awakened me, you believed in me. You gave me information about my enemies in the solid realm. You have earned my attention. But you are but a mortal, leading other mortals into battles. You must prove yourself worthy of taking a place in the ranks of the <color=#FFFEC1>Emerald Empire</color> army. The Great and Accepted Poison Knight <color=#FFFEC1>Ilhutl</color>, one of my servants, is now on Venus. He will be waiting for you in the <color=#FFFEC1>Feathered Temple</color>. Defeat him, and I will make a pact with you. You will become one of the commanders of the Emerald Empire and gain power commensurate with my generosity.

It doesn't matter how many clones you send here. I will drink gavvakh from each one. The warriors of <color=#FFFEC1>Gannix</color> will witness our battle. You will not serve the <color=#FFFEC1>Master</color>!

I ordered you to defeat Ilhutl. Ilhutl is not defeated. Fight until you do it truly.

And to make it more interesting for me to watch, I allow my warriors to fight on Ilhutl's side.
That is not dead which can eternal lie, fool.
Do you think Tezctlan sent you to prove your strength? You are merely a sacrifice for <color=#FFFEC1>me</color>.
People's dreams of power are such fertile soil for the seeds of suffering.
You cannot defeat me. Your world was ready for my coming. It accepted me as it once accepted my Master.
I hope, clone, your Boss <color=#FFFEC1>will send me another one</color>.

I detected a huge energy surge. Analyzing...

There are five of such monoliths in the Feathered Temple. Well, four already. It looks like they are the ones that are keeping Ilhutl in the physical world.
Sensors are registering a drop in quasimorphic energy. Now we can complete the mission. <color=#FFFEC1>Find and destroy Ilhutl</color>.

You have proven that you have skill and dignity. I will decide the future of Ilhutl myself.

The Pact of Eternal Service to the Emerald Empire has already been sent to your spacecraft. Serve me faithfully, and your eyes will reflect a green glow. Disappoint me, and you will envy the dead.

What is this? New information about AnCom? This is always interesting. You made the right choice to bring the data to us. There is no better arbiter of the ancap system than RealWare. We will contact you if your services are needed.

Greetings, mercenary! Some time ago, you gave us some very interesting information about AnCom. I believe that you chose us for a reason. RealWare is the only corporation that guards the interests of the ancap system. We are its true defenders.

It turns out that AnCom has made great strides in quasimorphic research. According to information from the PCPU, we are not even talking about decades of research there. To delve so deeply into quasimorphosis, one would have to start long before the Great Anarchic Revolution. Now I understand why Doctor Manning is considered a genius. He had a very good start.

We gave you the data to hack a PCPU. Perform any Espionage mission for AnCom, hack their device, and we'll get into their closed network. Let's find out what AnCom really is.

Good job! The hacked PCPU is transmitting data to us from the closed AnCom network. It will take several months to sort out the data. But we already see a direct threat to order in the Solar System. AnCom is trying to hack the algorithm of the RealWare Corporation combat AI. Our combat AI.

We don’t yet know why and how they want to use it, but we can’t allow it. The AnCom analytical center, which collects information about the AI, is located at the Humankinds's Hope Citadel on the Pallas asteroid. We offer you a contract: get to the station’s data center and activate the EMP-Scorcher there. We've transfered it to your spacecraft. And check how it works at the same time.

AnCom's property will not be harmed, and if they try to accuse someone of damaging the data, they will have to say what kind of data it was. They will not do that.

The station is very old. Most levels are connected by stairs. Elevators can help you shorten the way to the data center, but rest assured, <color=#FFFEC1>AnCom</color> will take care of the elevator exits first.
This is AnCom speaking. We demand that the clone be recalled immediately, otherwise we will be forced to take <color=#FFFEC1>emergency measures</color>. The demand will not be repeated.
Attention station personnel! <color=#FFFEC1>Morphoprotection<color=#FFFEC1> is disabled. Everyone, apply counter-quasimorphic measures.
Turns out it's not as easy as we thought. You should hurry!
Wait, you don't have the <color=#FFFEC1>EMP-Scorcher</color>! Without it, we can't disable the station's systems. You need to go back and find the device, or the mission will fail.
Great, you're here. Set up the <color=#FFFEC1>EMP-Scorcher</color> near the computers.

<color=#FFFEC1>EMP-Scorcher</color> was activated. Looks like all the computers on the station are now dead. If AnCom doesn't have backups, we've pretty much knocked them back. Mission accomplished. Get out of there... and your equipment is fried, too, <color=#FFFEC1>map is inaccessible</color>. You'll have to go in blind.

Some time ago, you've handed over an AnCom Corporation PCPU, filled to the brim with quasimorphic research to us. Studying it helped fill in some gaps in the chain of events that led to the emergence of Tezctlan. Let's not try to keep a poker face. We know what's going on on Venus and beyond.

Believe me, AnCom bears a huge share of the responsibility for what's happening. In fact, they deceived you. That's why we turned to you. We believe that you can be trusted with the mission against AnCom.

Are you familiar with Dr. Manning? He had an assistant, Dr. Gendiosa. We really need to talk to her. After the events at Frantseva-7 station near Saturn, she is hiding in the Schwerin city on Geist. We are not sure that our agents will be able to complete the mission, so we ask you to get to Gendiosa, convince the doctor to go with you, and bring her to us.
We are here. So far, everything is calm. Find the <color=#FFFEC1>doctor</color> and return without unnecessary adventures.

Hey, hey, people! Residents of LL Sector! I speak on behalf of the Pirate Union, to whom your wonderful city provides convenient docking. A cockroach has just entered your sector. I will send a mark to your PCPUs. For its murder, I promise you such a reward that you will definitely not have to think about work for the next year.

Good hunting!
That was said over the station's public address system, did I hear right? Okay, the job is getting tougher. Boss, did you arm the operative properly?
<color=#FFFEC1>Manning</color> warned me that sooner or later you would show up. I've already packed my things, let's go.
Everyone in Schwerin has grabbed their weapons and are moving towards you. This is a <color=#FFFEC1>failure</color>, we are leaving.

<color=#FFFEC1>Station Security</color> finally noticed that half of the station is going nuts. They sent operatives to LL Sector. Let me check the order now... Yeah, kill everyone indiscriminately, turn the sector into a demilitarized zone. <color=#FFFEC1>Get out</color> of here quickly, don't forget <color=#FFFEC1>the professor</color>.
You've arrived. I'm unlocking the private dock, the pilot has already turned on the engines.
We can't evacuate you <color=#FFFEC1>without the target</color>. Bring her over.

This is Unchained Belt speaking. Accept the transmission...

I see you've got a knack for ruining relationships with the bigwigs of the corporate world. Ever since that cute little beastie threw a party on Venus, you've done a lot to make the ancap system look at you with suspicion. Yes, we know about Tezctlan. We know it's not a fake. We have eyes in the Inner System, too.

In short, we need a contractor like you. For certain reasons, we don't want to take direct actions against corporations that have an active interest in the Belt. After all, we all share these rocks together. It's not time to upset the delicate balance yet, but it's a nice thing to tweak a few things. Your target is CoreWard MG. You'll attack and capture their HIS Woodpecker in orbit around Vesta, and then send it to orbit around Interamnia. Of course, the ship will have to be refueled first. This is not a problem if you provide our guys with access to the engine level.

For you, a well-paid job, for us - a new valuable asset. And for the Belt - a small increase in tension instead of a full-fledged war. Is there any reason to refuse such a contract?

Ici le Unchained Belt. Accepte la transmission...

Je vois que tu as un certain talent pour te brouiller avec les pontes du monde corporatif. Depuis que cette petite bête mignonne a fait la fête sur Vénus, tu as fait beaucoup pour que le système ancap te regarde avec suspicion. Oui, nous savons pour Tezctlan. Nous savons que ce n'est pas un faux. Nous avons aussi des yeux dans le Système Intérieur.

En résumé, nous avons besoin d'un contractant comme toi. Pour certaines raisons, nous ne voulons pas prendre de mesures directes contre les entreprises qui ont un intérêt actif dans la Ceinture. Après tout, nous partageons tous ces rochers ensemble. Ce n'est pas encore le moment de bouleverser l'équilibre délicat, mais c'est agréable de pouvoir ajuster quelques détails. Ta cible est CoreWard MG. Tu attaqueras et captureras leur HIS Woodpecker en orbite autour de Vesta, puis tu l'enverras en orbite autour d'Interamnia. Bien sûr, le vaisseau devra être ravitaillé d'abord. Ce n'est pas un problème si tu fournis à nos gars un accès au niveau des moteurs.

Pour toi, un travail bien payé, pour nous – un nouvel atout précieux. Et pour la Ceinture – une petite augmentation de la tension au lieu d'une guerre totale. Y a-t-il une raison de refuser un tel contrat?

Habla el Unchained Belt. Acepta la transmisión...

Veo que tienes una habilidad especial para arruinar relaciones con los grandes magnates del mundo corporativo. Desde que esa pequeña bestia celebró una fiesta en Venus, has hecho mucho para que el sistema ancap te mire con sospecha. Sí, sabemos sobre Tezctlan. Sabemos que no es un engaño. También tenemos ojos en el Sistema Interno.

En resumen, necesitamos a un contratista como tú. Por ciertas razones, no queremos tomar medidas directas contra las corporaciones que tienen un interés activo en el Cinturón. Después de todo, todos compartimos estos asteroides. No es el momento de alterar el delicado equilibrio aún, pero sería bueno ajustar algunas cosas. Tu objetivo es CoreWard MG. Atacarás y capturarás su HIS Woodpecker en órbita alrededor de Vesta, y luego lo enviarás a órbita alrededor de Interamnia. Por supuesto, la nave tendrá que ser repostada primero. Esto no es un problema si proporcionas acceso a nuestros chicos al nivel del motor.

Para ti, un trabajo bien remunerado; para nosotros, un nuevo activo valioso. Y para el Cinturón, un pequeño aumento de la tensión en lugar de una guerra a gran escala. ¿Hay alguna razón para rechazar tal contrato?

A truck from the <color=#FFFEC1>Dilthey</color> corporation is moving nearby at a relatively low speed. I don't know what they want, but if they detect a fuel shuttle, they can transmit this information to the <color=#FFFEC1>HIS Woodpecker</color>. Dilthey are some good Samaritans.

You can mop up the entire spacecraft, but the bird <color=#FFFEC1>won't fly</color> while the quantum fuel tanks are <color=#FFFEC1>empty</color> and the armory's security system is <color=#FFFEC1>working</color>. First, clear out these floors.
Eliminate anyone who might prevent us from taking control of the spacecraft. After that, we'll take the bird to its new nest.
There is nothing else stopping us. Head to <color=#FFFEC1>Interamnia</color>.

You need to disable the <color=#FFFEC1>security system</color> in the armory. The <color=#FFFEC1>CoreWard MG</color> security team has blocked the spacecraft's control system. Find the mainframe and deal with it... as best you can.
Security system disabled. Spacecraft control unlocked.
Receiving encrypted signal from the <color=#FFFEC1>fuel shuttle</color>. They will be ready as soon as you <color=#FFFEC1>clear this level</color>.

We're heading to the fuel lock. It'll take a while to refuel. The boss asked me to thank you for your part in the <color=#FFFEC1>Unchained Belt</color> case if you make it this far. We've got a few guys here who are eager to fight. We'll drop them on your floor.
Protect the engines while the refueling is going.
First you need to destroy the <color=#FFFEC1>mainframe in the Arsenal</color>.
Attention! The sale of HIS Woodpecker to <color=#FFFEC1>Dilthey Corporation</color> has been completed. CoreWard MG disclaims liability for the asset.

Attention! We ask all unauthorized personnel to leave HIS Woodpecker, it is the private property of the <color=#FFFEC1>Dilthey</color> Corporation. The corporation's <color=#FFFEC1>security officers</color> will be transported here from the nearby cargo spacecraft Nikolaus Otto to ensure the asset's safety.
We don't care how you planned to build relations with <color=#FFFEC1>Dilthey</color>. The contract must be fulfilled in any case. There is not much time left until the end of the refueling.

The pirate tanker has undocked. Make your way to the command floor. Remember that <color=#FFFEC1>Dilthey</color> truck that flew past? It dropped off a whole bunch of <color=#FFFEC1>armed combatants</color>. Good luck.
You can make a phase bomb. It may be used as an usual grenade, but Eipschwitz did this for something completely different.
The map shows the locations of the objects you need to protect. Go there and wait for the guests.
Great job. Move on to the next object.
Prepare to defend, I have detected enemy signatures. Do not let the customer's property be destroyed.
You must go down, find the ritual site, and protect it. Try not to disappoint our employers.
You're almost there. Hurry, the attackers are close.
You're almost there. You need to find the ritual site as soon as possible and stop it!
The VIP is waiting for you near the shuttle. Escort them to the marked location.
An escape pod has been dispatched and should land somewhere nearby.
Error! Failed to generate level. Please, send a report through the Main Menu.
Do you want to leave your obligations under the PMC contract?
You will lose your save. Continue?
The operator equipment has not been selected! Do you want to start a mission?
All class progress will be lost. Do you want to change the operator class?
The pact with the Quasimorph will be impossible to break in the usual way, it will remain in effect even after the death of the operative.
The pact with the Quasimorph will be terminated, this action cannot be undone.
Access is denied. The information is classified.
You should not have come here. Shartamakhum contemplates. Shartamakhum is waiting. Shartamakhum is preparing for war. Prepare for eternal lamentation in my womb, Gavvakh!
Finally! Master, do you hear? I used mortal blood and answered the call! Mortal, prepare to become a part of my power!
You simply have to accept that your demons are a part of you. You have to accept them as your friends.
Duggur... You opened it... I have arrived... When I consume your power, please do not cry. Tears are but a futile waste of good suffering.
Every war has its demons. Your war now has me!
A glorious slaughter for a glorious warrior!
You came here for a challenge? We'll challenge you. It'll last until you break. And you will break.
You... shouldn't have... disturbed me... I had dreams... how beautiful they were... you know what the price of my awakening is!

You came to this place of confinement yourself. You were not called. You were not expected. But still, I have prepared something special for you. First, eternal agony will begin, and a moment later - your eternal pleas for mercy.
Error! Failed to load game. Error code:
Error! Failed to save the game, no disk space. Error code:
Error! Failed to save the game. Error code:
Error! Failed to load level file. Error code:
Production of the {0} will require the following items:
There are some items on the ground, are you sure to leave station?
The history of humanity is written in tears and blood.
Liars, tyrants, idealists - they all tried to bring happiness on the edge of a sword.
We waited for liberation from the shackles of fate and were ready to go through the Last Judgment for it.
Not for the glorious death for the Eternal Kingdom, Love, or the Lord, but for a way to step off the path of suffering.
But when the Apocalypse came, we shrugged our shoulders and started profiting from it as usual.
The creatures lurking in the depths of space didn't seem scarier than our own world.
Armed with the hope that the darkest hour comes before dawn, we try to survive until the first rays of the Sun...
Bleed is a very dangerous state. It's recommended to care about it.
Wow, you can see the Orion Arm from here
Actions performed by broken limbs cause tremendous pain
Actions performed by broken limbs cause tremendous pain
Stomach Damage due to damage from eating
The progression of the infection leads to serious illnesses
The result of a poisonous substance entering the body
Enhance Q-morphos events and cause hallucinations
Seems like one more is not a crime tho
A constant urge to unwind with a cigarette
Result of exposure of the body to ionizing radiation
Follow safety rules when working with electricity
Intoxication with ethyl alcohol leads to a dissipation of attention, slower reactions, and decreased coordination of movements.
With every consecutive shot the rate of fire increases.

In the 2150s, terraforming equipment was delivered to Mercury. Surprisingly quickly, it was possible to saturate the atmosphere with oxygen and nitrogen, and remove toxic gases. However, life on the surface of Mercury is impossible, no one had hoped for it. Automatic stations operate on the surface.

And yet, people are present on the planet. Inside mountain ranges and deep enough underground, it was possible to create underground colonies, isolated from the temperature conditions of the surface.

A planet with conditions sufficient for life underground.
Start of exploration: 2110s.
Main contributors to terraforming: none, it's spontaneous.

At the end of the 21st century, the entire power of several corporations was directed at the intensive terraforming of the planet. The following were undertaken: bombardment with ice blocks, infection of the soil with GM bacteria, sowing GM seeds, and then the settlement of GM animals (mainly insects and spiders). The terraforming process on Venus lasted 70 years, and people did not control it at every stage. For example, the upper layers of the atmosphere became a toxic greenhouse under which jungles grew, and poisonous swamps still encircle the planet along the equator.

Despite all this, Venus is now the most habitable planet after Earth.

Terraformed planet covered in GMO jungles.
Start of exploration: 2080s.
Major contributor to terraforming: Fresco.

Earth is an ecological and agricultural paradise for humankind. According to SBN, the Earth is inhabited by 4 billion people. After the construction of the Intercity on Mars and New Seattle on the Moon, the planet is under The Interdict Regulation. An information barrier has also been installed. All data is routed through the ISS Station AES. Apparently, the SBN checks outgoing data from Earth. For this reason, not everyone believes the stories about paradise.

The Interdict Regulation: Only employees of those corporations that own property here are allowed to visit Earth.

The cradle of humanity, closed to the public.
The Interdict regulation: active.
Ecological status: stable.

A satellite of the Earth where helium-3 is mined and used to produce G-3 quantum fluid — fuel for cubecentric engines. The Moon has a sealed metropolis New Seattle, which houses the headquarters and other buildings of a huge number of corporations. The Source complex deserves special mention, as it houses servers with the current text of the NCE and other documents that can be called the constitution of the ancap system.

In a sense, New Seattle, a giant sparkling city under a dome covered with lunar soil to protect against radiation, is the heart of the ancap system. According to the inhabitants of the Moon,Earth is a boring old planet. But in the steel, plastic, and glass structures of New Seattle life is in full swing, driven by the thirst for profit and the desire for freedom.

The natural satellite of Earth, inhabited by people in colonies sheltered from radiation.
Main contributors to development: PlanetBridge, Grasshopper Technologies.
Largest and only city: New Seattle.

An artificial satellite of the Moon. It rotates in a geostationary orbit and is constantly above Mare Imbrium. The satellite is named after Richard Buckminster Fuller — an outstanding architect, designer, engineer, inventor, philosopher, mathematician, writer, and poet. And, most importantly, a hopeless utopian whose ideas had no chance of being realized under the oppression of states. The liberation granted to people by the Great Anarchist Revolution made it possible to implement many of Fuller's ideas. This artificial satellite of five station modules linked together by engineering structures is a genius's dream come true.

When the Sun rises over Mare Imbrium, Fuller reflects its light, as if speaking on behalf of humanity: "We are moving forward! We are building the future!"

An artificial satellite of Moon, space city complex.
Altitude above Moon: 400 Mm.
Year of creation: 2145.
Creators: Dilthey, Grasshopper Technologies.

Mars was supposed to be terraformed before Venus, but the solar wind quickly blew away any atmosphere from Mars. All human efforts were reduced to maintaining the surface in the state of a cold desert with islands of GMO tundra closer to the equator. Acceptable oxygen levels and the ability to live without spacesuits still motivate people to explore Mars. Scattered across the surface are individual corporate bases, reminiscent of boomtowns from the Wild West. The only large city on the planet is Intercity.

It was built before the Great Anarchist Revolution (GAR). It was badly damaged and has not yet been fully restored. Intercity is a cold slum, with the occasional corporate building rising like beacons in an ocean of poverty.

A terraformed planet covered with an unfriendly cold desert.
Start of exploration: 2040s.
Main contributions to terraforming: RealWare, CoreWard MG, and minor contributions from the old states of Earth.
