Doom of Anunnaki;Song of Enlil;Punishment of Gilgamesh;Seal of Nergal;Shadow of Kur;Gate of Eridu;Wrath of Enki;Call of Ereshkigal;Eye of Shummuramat;Serpents of Anzu;Burden of Izmu;War of Gudsah;Presence of Zahra;Deformation of Matur;Dream of Pshutu;Box of Aiyar;Cry of Veltahur ;Aklo's Glove;Sheid's Poison;Om-Uru's Melody
Evacuation denied. Until the mission objective is completed, we can't evacuate you.
The space around the location is stormy. Evacuation is not possible at this time.
Find the elevator and get upstairs, we'll pick you up there.
Find a shuttle and come back, the Magnum's ready to pick you up.
Good job. Go back to the elevator, we'll pick you up.
Good work. Get back to the shuttle, we'll pick you up.
Well, better luck next time. At least we saved the biomaterial.
This is a valuable item, getting it pays off by restarting the shuttle. Great job, get back to the spacecraft.
Clear all floors of Magnum of invaders.
It's over. The Magnum has sustained minor damage. Basically, it won't affect the functionality of the equipment and crew, so we can go where we want and do what we want. The system is open to us.

Keep in mind that we're not getting paid for this. Taking a contract would have been a better idea. <color=#FFFEC1>Civil Resistance</color> has set up a field camp in <color=#FFFEC1>Rogue City</color>. Training complexes, as well as some kind of medical facilities or laboratories. It's unclear. Sometimes messages flash in the <color=#FFFEC1>SBN</color> that terrorists are accumulating rare and valuable items. Weapons and equipment for their 'liberation struggle'. Maybe we can justify the time spent here if we're lucky. So let's get even, but let's do it with benefit. Get to their anti-space defense complex and destroy it. After that, the pilots will direct <color=#FFFEC1>‘Magnum’</color> to the cargo dock in <color=#FFFEC1>Rogue City</color> and we will start loading everything that's lying there.
The Rogue City Station's autonomous missile defense server must be destroyed.
The Civil Resistance Colnodes attempted to attack our mobile headquarters. We have successfully fought back and must now counterattack their training center.
Destroy Rogue City Station's missile defense control center.
The missile defense control center has been successfully destroyed. We can evacuate.

We not only took all the valuables, but also patched up the holes from the boarding shuttles. In <color=#FFFEC1>Rogue City</color> we had everything we needed for that. Boss, we also found a <color=#FFFEC1>PCPU with a database</color> belonging to the <color=#FFFEC1>AnCom</color> corporation. There is a lot of information about <color=#FFFEC1>quasimorphosis</color> research. They are willing to generously compensate for our expenses in return for such valuable intellectual property. But of course, we made a copy of all the data from their device. Their agent is ready to meet us in <color=#FFFEC1>Rebus Sky City</color> in orbit of <color=#FFFEC1>Mars</color>.
<color=#FFFEC1>Task:</color> Meet with the agent, retrieve the <color=#FFFEC1>Red Chip</color> and plug it in the station's mainframe.

Details: The Civil Resistance, represented by Issachar, offers us to carry out information sabotage on the Solar System scale. We need to connect the Red Chip and infect the global communication system with a generative virus that will destroy it.

Additional information: Issachar, the CR coordinator in the Inner System, told us about the Red Chip - a device with which the rebels are going to disable communication channels throughout the Solar System. All we need is a powerful server to which most of the Network nodes are connected. Such a server exists and is located in orbit around Earth. Agent Justas will be waiting for us at the site to hand over the Red Chip.

Near-Earth orbit is a demilitarized zone. Corporations do not wage war there by agreement. The CR and pirates do not do so, as they fear brutal vengeance. An attack on the Heritage Communications Station could upset the fragile balance in the System. Our actions will kindle a flame that will be difficult to extinguish. We will help the cause of liberation of the working people, and there will be more work for us.

We need to take the Red Chip from the agent at the station, then seize the main communications computer and upload the received virus to it.

<color=#FFFEC1>Issachar</color> didn't lie. The <color=#FFFEC1>transponders</color> installed on the shuttle worked. The station took us for their own. <color=#FFFEC1>Heritage</color> operates in semi-automatic mode. Easy job! Find a contact in the docks, take the virus from him, and upload it to the server on the <color=#FFFEC1>lower</color> floor of the station.
Find <color=#FFFEC1>Justas</color>, take the <color=#FFFEC1>Red Chip</color>, and plug it in the mainframe.
Virus is in the network. Evacuation is authorized.

Well, the System will be in <color=#FFFEC1>chaos</color> for a while. Maybe it's for the best. Hard to believe in the good intentions of the <color=#FFFEC1>Civil Resistance</color>. But here's the good news: we won't have less work. Get some rest, we'll be back in business soon.
<color=#FFFEC1>Task:</color> Defeat <color=#FFFEC1>Ilhutl</color>, the Great and Accepted Knight of Gannix, in combat.

Details: Tezctlan has turned the Feathered Temple into a base for the Emerald Empire's guard. The Poisonous Knight Ilhutl awaits us there. Tezctlan is ready to make a special pact with a mortal who can defeat Ilhutl.

Additional information: Tezctlan is trying to gain a foothold in two worlds at once. After visiting Earth, he felt cramped in the bramfatura of Venus, limited by the laws of the quasimorphic world. With the help of gavvakh, which his loyal servants obtain on the battlefields of the physical world, Tezctlan and his servants create a new Empire beyond the boundaries between realities.

We have attracted the attention of Tezctlan. He is ready to make a unique contract with us, according to which you, Boss, will become one of the hierarchs of the Emerald Empire.

However, the Master needs proof. And not of loyalty, but of strength. We must defeat Ilhutl, the Poison Knight, champion of the Gannix guard.
Killing a single quasimorph? Sounds easy. Good luck, though.
<color=#FFFEC1>Ilhutl</color> must be defeated. Tezctlan ordered it.
Ilhutl is defeated. This time for good.

The quasimorphs delivered the Skull to the spacecraft while the battle raged below. Did he believe in Ilhutl that little, or that much in us, Boss?

Magnum and the crew are ready to fight, wherever you send us. Emerald Empire? Well then. Let's go.
<color=#FFFEC1>Task:</color> Activate the <color=#FFFEC1>EMP-Scorcher</color> in the station's data center.

Details: AnCom is planning operations using the RealWare combat AI. This asset is not for sale, so RealWare suspects AnCom of theft. Our task: destroy all AnCom data on the combat AI.

Additional Information: Humankinds's Hope Citadel was the headquarters of the Hive Corporation. It could well have claimed the role of hexarch, but it ceased to exist in the mid-22nd century. It is not surprising that AnCom decided to organize field research here. On the one hand, Citadel is considered a fairly useless asset, on the other hand, the station is well protected.

The latter means that there is no single-shaft elevators. Most likely, you will have to deal with a confusing system of stairs and long galleries, in which AnCom will have time to organize a defense.

You won't believe it, but the mission may be easier than we thought. The geoscanner detected an <color=#FFFEC1>unusual field</color> around the station. AnCom installed morphoprotectors, so the Citadel should not have <color=#FFFEC1>quasimorphosis</color>. Get into the data center, activate the <color=#FFFEC1>EMP-Scorcher</color>, and we'll be ready to pick you up.
You need to get to the <color=#FFFEC1>station data center</color> and activate the <color=#FFFEC1>EMP-Scorcher</color>.
<color=#FFFEC1>Mission accomplished</color>, the data center is now a pile of junk.

Even <color=#FFFEC1>Hexarchs</color> are ready to be at each other's throats and plunge their hands into other people's business. It seems that there is more and more work for us. <color=#FFFEC1>RealWare reward</color> has been delivered.
<color=#FFFEC1>Task:</color> Reach Dr. Gendiosa and return with her to the shuttle.

Details: Agents of SBN have found out where the assistant of the missing Dr. Manning is hiding. She must be brought to Magnum and handed over to SBN.

Additional information: Schwerin is a port that is extremely poorly controlled by its owners. The asset brings in income from rent and docking fees. Trying to organize at least a semblance of order here with the help of your own security service is economically unprofitable. A convenient place to disappear.

Dr. Gendiosa is hiding in one of the residential blocks, waiting for something to happen. The report from the SBN agents does not indicate that she has met anyone.

We hope that it will be a simple walk from the port to the residential complex and back, but this time accompanied by Gendiosa. SBN will pick her up immediately after she gets to Magnum.

It's nice to work with the rich and famous. <color=#FFFEC1>SBN</color> has reserved a private dock for us. It will have access to the central elevator system. <color=#FFFEC1>Schwerin</color> is heavy layered, but we will send you straight to the <color=#FFFEC1>Gendiosa floor</color>, LL Sector. Not a nice area, but not a slum either. <color=#FFFEC1>Find her</color> and return to the dock.
Take Dr. <color=#FFFEC1>Gendiosa</color> to the dock where our shuttle is waiting.
Important witness for <color=#FFFEC1>SBN</color> successfully delivered. We can add it to our resume.

<color=#FFFEC1>SBN took Dr. Gendiosa</color>. They treated her very well, I am surprised. It seems that she is a really valuable witness. In addition to the usual reward, the SBN operative reported that the ambush was organized by <color=#FFFEC1>Dr. Manning</color>. This was his way of protecting his lab assistant.
<color=#FFFEC1>Task:</color> Take control of <color=#FFFEC1>HIS Woodpecker</color> and fly it to the temporary pirate base.

Details: Pirates from the Unchained Belt want to get their hands on a powerful weapon: a Heavy Interplanetary Spacecraft. We must steal for them the HIS Woodpecker, which CoreWard MG uses as a base of operations in the Main Belt. But first it has to be refueled, and the agents of the Unchained Belt will help us with this.

Additional information: The HIS Woodpecker in orbit around Vesta has long been used by CoreWard MG as a stationary checkpoint in the Main Belt. The pirates have found out that its cubecentric engines are fully functional. If the spacecraft is filled with G-3 quantum fuel, it will easily leave orbit.

The shuttle has been detected, so prepare for a fierce defense against the CoreWard MG security. In addition, we have a new problem: a security system has been installed at the armory level. A signal has been sent from there to block the spacecraft's controls. You will have to get there and disable the block. The pirate tanker is already nearby.
We need to shut down the arsenal, refuel the <color=#FFFEC1>HIS Woodpecker</color>, and fly it to Interamnia.
Now this is a new pirate spacecraft.

We managed to ruin relations not only with <color=#FFFEC1>CoreWard MG</color>, but also with <color=#FFFEC1>Dilthey</color>. The SBN is thick with their protest notes, and the Unchained Belt reports that they just picked up a spacecraft abandoned by a vile <color=#FFFEC1>PMC</color>. Let's hope the reward was worth it.

Details: In the Oddibjord-3 colony under a huge geodesic dome there is a large laboratory complex that belonged to Fresco Corporation. The goal is to find and evacuate the device that the guys from AnCom want to get. The colony is destroyed as a result of continuous fighting on the surface of Venus since the appearance of Tezctlan. Now the quasimorphs loyal to him have captured the geodesic and will protect it no matter who appears there.

Additional Info: Hexarchy, the information union of six major corporations, has increased censorship. Of course, they deny the very existence of censorship. This vocabulary is something from the distant state past. However, it is easy to censor and deny anything when you control the largest routers in the System. The actions of the hexarchs are associated with the appearance of Tezctlan on Venus. It will be easier for hard workers and middle managers to work if they do not know about the monsters that prowl around them. Because of our active participation in events we know something. The former assets of the destroyed concern Fresco on Venus became a battlefield between various forces and factions. The intensity of quasimorphic events on Venus is extremely high. Messages about it are coming from all the planets and satellites of the Solar System.

And then our old customer appears again - AnCom. We were extremely lucky to find that compact data bank at the Civil Resistance base. It seems that AnCom is hiding success in advanced experiments with quasimorphosis carried out behind the backs of the other hexarchs. HIS Unveiled, owned by AnCom, has been in the orbit of Venus for a while and is clearly engaged in a comprehensive study of its surface. And now they have shared something with us.

As we thought, accusing the Civil Resistance of fabricating quasimorphic activity on Venus is a lie. It seems that Tezctlan is trying to drag its “court” into our world: the quasimorphs of its bramfatura. There are reports of successful phasing of huge structures. But people like us have the opportunity to raise prices and start getting real pleasure.

Our scanners can't trace the device, it is likely located somewhere in the underground levels. Look for the elevator down. The geodesic is partially destroyed, so we will drop you right on the territory of the colony. I'm noticing some other signals, but they're not quasimorphs. I think these are some poorly armed marauders: former <color=#FFFEC1>Fresco</color> Sec officers, fugitive PMCs, pirates who broke into the Inner System, and so on. Shouldn't be any problems.
You need to pick up the AnCom device if it really is <color=#FFFEC1>their</color> device. You will have to search all over <color=#FFFEC1>Oddibjord-3</color>.
We've got the device. What is it this time? <color=#FFFEC1>Crystal Skull</color>? I'm not sure we should have gotten involved in this.

We have not yet informed <color=#FFFEC1>AnCom</color> that we managed to pull out the <color=#FFFEC1>Crystal Skull</color>. It makes sense to re-think who exactly we should continue to cooperate with. Apparently <color=#FFFEC1>AnCom</color>, <color=#FFFEC1>RealWare</color>, and even <color=#FFFEC1>Tezctlan</color> are all very interested in obtaining the recovered device... Or artifact? Doesn't matter. You choose who we will work for next, <color=#FFFEC1>Boss</color>.

Details: Xiomara informed us that in the Sinkhole Oasis, a research colony on Mars, we can find an extremely valuable quasimorphic artifact. According to her, we can destroy Tezctlan with its help. If everything is as she says, this weapon will be our trump card in the big game that has begun in the System.

Additional Info: Thanks to Xiomara, we have learned a lot about bramfatura and quasimorphosis. Xiomara is the Duchess of Gannix, the bramfatura of Venus, who is now at war with her kind. About 1000 years ago, Tezctlan became a hylonaut. This means he went to Earth, and such quasimorphs are no longer capable of escaping our native planet independently. Our analysts report that this happened around the 13th-14th centuries CE. When Tezctlan disappeared from Gannix, Xiomara took power there. With Tezctlan's return, the situation changed for her. Following Dr. Eipschwitz's lead, we drove her and her loyal knights, the Order of Feathered Masks, back to Gannix.

During one of our missions on Venus, Xiomara contacted us again. We made a deal and started receiving tasks from her. It helped the Feathered Masks survive in their fight against Tezctlan. It seems to be effectively curbing his activities.

Now she claims that in the Sinkhole Oasis, a geological research colony on Mars, we can find Tezctlan's spear. When we try to find out how it got there, the duchess vaguely mentions an ancient attack on Mars and the murder of its king. Our analysts speculate that this somehow relates to the absence of quasimorphosis on Mars. In any case, before unlocking all the secrets of the Sinkhole Oasis, we will have to deal with those who currently own it.

The station is broadcasting something strange. Some prayers, chants, music... Human speech in... ancient Sumerian? That doesn't sound like RealWare. The station must be under attack. That's fortunate. In the chaos, we can get the shuttle a little closer than we planned. Attack the Sinkhole Oasis and make your way to the Monolith. Our task is to destroy it and finally obtain Tezctlan's spear.
The spear that killed Urparp is still with him.

Good news: we now have the spear. The bad news: Mars and the satellites, until now completely free of quasimorphic influence, are now ahead of even Gannix on Venus. This is simultaneously a problem for us, the corporations, and even Tezctlan. They and Urparp haven't exactly had the friendliest of relationships. I'd like to ask Xiomara questions, but that's for you to decide, Boss. What's done is done. Mission accomplished.
Task: Prepare the site for loading the Telefaturic Dislocator.

Details: Doctor Eipschwitz, whose head we keep in the storage compartment of the Magnum, informed us that at the Fresco Corporation's base, Flat Obsidian, there's the Telephature Dislocator: a device capable of transporting people into the bramfaturas of planets. We need to ensure the security of the device and load it onto the Shuttle.

Additional Info: On the Flat Obsidian base, there were structures to accommodate the PMC Tifton and a phased Venusian temple. Our analysts were puzzled over how a temple from Venus could end up on Mercury. It turned out that Eipschwitz is a great connoisseur of quasimorphosis. He talks about some "ancient roads" and much more. We'll investigate this further. It was there that we first encountered Xiomara and eliminated her following Eipschwitz's lead.

After what happened to Fresco, the base became completely unusable. However, Eipschwitz reports that there's another completely secret laboratory site. Hidden among the rocks, the Telephaturic Dislocator stands right on the surface of Mercury. We just need to land the shuttle nearby, make sure everything is quiet, and retrieve the device.

The Telephaturic Dislocator consumes a lot of energy (that's why Mercury was chosen, an inexhaustible source of heat) to open gates that allow physical objects to transition into the bramfaturas of planets.
Sensors show human marks. Without signatures. It could be equipped by PMC or someone else. Be prepared for contact.
The Telephaturiс Dislocator is somewhere here. We must retrieve it to the Magnum no matter what.
Now you should take important parts and evacuate

Eipschwitz is still catatonic. We hooked him up to a virtual simulation and, by repeating his actions, assembled some kind of device. The doctor called it "the ultimate solution to the damn terrorists and quasimorphs." It's obviously a bomb, mass producing it requires some sophisticated components, but if we can get them we can get production on stream. I suppose with a bomb like this we could try to raid the Sinkhole Oasis and destroy the Monolith after all. It doesn't sound like a very convincing plan, Boss, but it's the best we've got.

Task: Reach the media center of the Unveiled spacecraft and transmit a propaganda broadcast to SBN.

Details: We must board the HIS Unveiled. Once on board, we need to break through AnCom's security service to reach the media center. Using AnCom's digital infrastructure, we will transmit the message of the Civil Resistance to the people of the Solar System.

Additional Info: Citizen mercenaries, it's time to stick bayonets on your rifles. Silence, you speakers! Comrade Liberator, you have the floor.

Our cooperation with the Civil Resistance has led to increased trust and strengthened camaraderie. Now, we face an important and responsible task. The AnCom Corporation is the dark horse in the Hexarchy. There should be six of the wealthiest corporations in the system, right? AnCom has never made such an impression. Nevertheless, they have always been in the spotlight. Now, we suspect that the anarchy in the Solar System is a deception. In reality, we live under the rule of corporate bureaucracy of the Hexarchy. Perhaps AnCom is the secret governing body of this corrupt system?

We will launch a sudden attack on the HIS Unveiled, which has been suspiciously orbiting Venus for a long time. We will reach the media center of the spacecraft, connect to SBN using AnCom's infrastructure, and send a message to the people of the System that will spark a rebellion.
We'll drop you off two levels away from the media center. The shuttle has been detected, and significant AnCom security forces are gathering where we'll eject you. Be prepared for intense contact.
The message from the Civil Resistance needs to be transmitted from the spacecraft's media center.
Everything is ready for evacuation. AnCom security did not touch our shuttle. I hate to say it, but they might have known how it would all play out even before we started the operation.
Boss, we can continue working with the guys... with the guy from the Civil Resistance. Together, we may come up with a more precise target for our next strike.

Task: Destroy the network infrastructure in RealWare's building "Candle."

Details: We must reach the routing equipment on the technical floor of the largest lunar arcology. If we destroy everything there, communication within the Inner System will be completely disrupted.

Additional Info: Together with Tezctlan, we are ready to attack where corporations do not expect it. There is an arcology on the Moon, founded by the largest and wealthiest corporation, RealWare. The network equipment is located on the technical floor. It handles the routing of information throughout the Inner System. Tetzclan demands that we break through there and launch a neurovirus into the system. It will not only burn everything in its path but also overload the nodes maintaining the session. Corporations will be blinded for a long time, and SBN might suffer significant losses in just a few seconds.

If this strike is carried out in the name of Tezctlan, we will undoubtedly gain the opportunity to lead his legions in future conquests.

Tezctlan once already destroyed the Martian bramfatura. He killed its tyrant, who brought terror to the world of quasimorphs. Soon, he will restore his power and venture beyond Venus. For now, we will be the edge of his spear.
We'll drop you off on the arcology's rooftop. Naturally, there will be resistance. Good news: it's just two levels from the rooftop to the technical floor.
You need to reach the central router and load the neurovirus into it. You have it with you.
Something incredible is happening. We are changing the future of the System.
You are a good warrior. You take on tasks without question and see them through to the end. Continue to serve faithfully, and one day, you will lead one of my legions.

Task: Kill Tezctlan.

Details: Beneath the war-ravaged colony of Oddibjord-3 on Venus lies the phased temple. Xiomara informs us that Tezctlan is there.

Additional Info: Xiomara speaks of Tezctlan as a cowardly king. He once fled his kingdom to Earth. Ganix had not seen him for a thousand years. Only a few months ago, the quasimorphs of Venus felt his return. The Fresco corporation's transport spacecraft brought a fragment of an ancient temple wall from the city of Aztlan on Earth to the planet. Tetzclan slept inside, depicted by a primitive image of himself. After that, Dr. Eipshwitz found a way to infiltrate the ancient king's dreams and learned the method of awakening from him. Fresco decided to take this step to save their corporation from destruction.

The only reason Tetzclan did not immediately seize power was Xiomara. However, we dealt with her. Dr. Eipshwitz led us on a false trail, leading to where Fresco held her captive. That's where we killed her. Or, we thought we did. After that, she found us.

Now we owe her a debt. And she asks us to repay it by getting rid of Tetzclan. The analytical department says the contract we have with Xiomara is fair in light of what has happened. Contracts, deals. All the evil in the world comes from contracts.

We'll drop you off on the streets of Oddibjord-3. Look for the entrance to the underground level, and from there, make your way to the phased temple. I can't help you any further, boss. How did we end up where we are now?
You need to kill Tezctlan. He is in the phased temple underground.
Tezctlan is not in Gannix. Neither he nor his ghost. Leave Venus immediately!
Boss, what happened? Our sensors are off the charts!

Details: %BENEFICIARY_NAME% is actively increasing its influence in the Solar System. It uses the chaos of the new redistribution of property for sabotage, murder, espionage against competitors, the Unchained Belt and the Civil Resistance. %STATION_NAME% is the target of so-called "direct actions". This is where we come into the game.

A simple task: you will board on, then you should kill everyone who is able to hold a weapon, and then you should leave before this place becomes another branch of hell. Representatives of the customer will accept the object without us. %VICTIM_NAME% is already sending out protest notes through official channels and contracts for the protection of %STATION_NAME% through channels for PMCs.

Oh, I almost forgot. Clearing a station for capture offers a solid reward. And a trusting relationship with %BENEFICIARY_NAME% won't hurt at all.

10 seconds until landing. As soon as the <color=#FFFEC1>Security Service or PMC</color> guarding %STATION_NAME% realize that the battle is lost, they will retreat or lay down their arms. It is enough to <color=#FFFEC1>destroy 50% of the combatants</color>. If you think that you have enough strength and resources, you can explore this place. Apart from the capture, nothing else is included in the contract, that is, the customer will accept %STATION_NAME% in any condition. Welcome to the world of healthy and fair competition.

Employees of %VICTIM_NAME% have already digitally signed the declaration of sale of the asset to %BENEFICIARY_NAME%. We elegantly handled the acquisition deal. The customer was satisfied, and the reward has already been transferred to Magnum.
<color=#FFFEC1>Task:</color> Find and eliminate the scientist of %VICTIM_NAME%.

<color=#FFFEC1>Details:</color> Fair competition is the key to rapid progress in science. How is this described in <color=#FFFEC1>NCE</color>? Lagging behind competitors will inevitably force the entrepreneur to multiply its efforts in order to maintain its position in the Market. So let's multiply. From the analysis of the SBN traffic, it became clear that %BENEFICIARY_NAME% is interested in the <color=#FFFEC1>scientist</color>, currently working at %STATION_NAME%. Not in the scientist itself, but in obstructing their work. Apparently, %VICTIM_NAME% is planning some kind of breakthrough. If it happens, %BENEFICIARY_NAME% will lose its position in the market. We are expected to act cleanly and quickly: boarding, search, <color=#FFFEC1>elimination of target</color>, then evacuation.

The target's signature is visible on the sensors. It won't be difficult to identify them - look for <color=#FFFEC1>white robe</color> and a smart face. This breed of people clings to traditions so much that they don’t even need an ancap - they would be happy even with a caste system. We will land the shuttle at a location in %STATION_NAME% where the defense systems allow it. Move from level to level until you reach the target. Resistance is expected: local <color=#FFFEC1>Security Service or PMC</color> are already occupying combat posts. Exploring %STATION_NAME% is not included in the task list, but if you see something interesting, it is not prohibited by the contract.
New day, new routine job. Your target: <color=#FFFEC1>scientist</color>, probably working on something extremely useful for all humanity.

Market balance has been restored. Now everyone is on an equal footing again. This is why we love <color=#FFFEC1>egalitarian capitalism</color>. %BENEFICIARY_NAME% sent us a valuable package so that we could conduct field tests. There are some of its new products. The cargo is already on board of Magnum.
<color=#FFFEC1>Task:</color> Find and eliminate a high-ranking manager of %VICTIM_NAME%.

Details: Fair competition is what made anarcho-capitalism the fairest system humanity has ever known. In the SBN has appeared the interesting information for PMCs. The fact is that now an ambitious project manager from %VICTIM_NAME% is working at %STATION_NAME%. Very soon the value of this place may skyrocket. Of course, this does not suit competitors at all. It seems that %BENEFICIARY_NAME% is interested in throwing %VICTIM_NAME% somewhere outside the Internal System.

%STATION_NAME% can, for example, be bought. Any good deal requires strong negotiating positions. We will prepare such position for the customer. The elimination of an experienced manager will be a good step towards ensuring that the current owner of %STATION_NAME%, %VICTIM_NAME%, look at it as an unprofitable asset.

We were given the target's personal signature. Good news: they are located at %STATION_NAME%. The shuttle will land wherever it can, and then your work will begin. Moderate resistance is expected from the Security Service of %VICTIM_NAME% or the PMCs working for it. <color=#FFFEC1>Eliminate the target and return</color>. Try not to get too distracted exploring %STATION_NAME%, it's not our priority.
Search and destroy is business as usual. Your target: <color=#FFFEC1>manager</color>, usually not a combatant, but they are expected to fight back.

In a couple of days we expect an announcement on the sale of %STATION_NAME% on the System Exchange. The job is done, all that remains is to try out the contents of the package that %BENEFICIARY_NAME% gave us as a reward. It's already on Magnum.

Details: %VICTIM_NAME% has integrated %STATION_NAME% into its structure. Thanks to this asset, it managed to gain a strong foothold in the planetary market. %BENEFICIARY_NAME% has been in a fierce bidding war for this asset recently. As long as %STATION_NAME% makes a profit, %VICTIM_NAME% will not want to get rid of it.

If you strike at communication system of %STATION_NAME%, this will complicate its work with the rest of %VICTIM_NAME% structural elements. Then the owner will think about selling it.

Analysis of information from the SBN shows: this is exactly what %BENEFICIARY_NAME% would like.

The location of the communication center is marked on your map. Don’t be surprised that it’s so far from you - we had to maneuver. The security of %STATION_NAME% has already been raised by alarm. Nothing unusual: local Security Service. Maybe a PMC. Let me remind you that the task is not to collect everything valuable in this place. The <color=#FFFEC1>task is to destroy the transmitter</color>.
We need to find and destroy the transmitter. This is a <color=#FFFEC1>satellite dish</color> pointed into space. There is a mark on your map.

%STATION_NAME% has been removed from infrastructure of %VICTIM_NAME%. At least for some time. %BENEFICIARY_NAME% is grateful to us that we correctly understood its hints in the SBN. It transferred valuable cargo to Magnum.
<color=#FFFEC1>Task:</color> Destroy the cargo of %VICTIM_NAME% prepared for shipment from %STATION_NAME%.

Details: Our analysts monitor messages in the SBN in order to understand who needs our services. And something interesting is happening at %STATION_NAME%.

Recently, %BENEFICIARY_NAME% experienced an unpleasant incident at one of its assets. Our colleagues worked there. Apparently the customer was %VICTIM_NAME%. The work is done, it has already prepared cargo to be sent to the contractor.

If we destroy the package before it is transferred, we not only will we take revenge for %BENEFICIARY_NAME%, but we will also greatly ruin the lives of our competitors. So we are doing a good job: we support the anarcho-capitalist regime, we interfere with competitors, and most importantly, we work for remuneration.

We have <color=#FFFEC1>marked</color> the location of the cargo on your map. The cargo is hidden quite securely in the depths of %STATION_NAME%. Such parcels are a common reward for <color=#FFFEC1>PMCs</color>, and corporations try not to advertise their collection and dispatch. We need to <color=#FFFEC1>find and destroy the cargo</color>. You are allowed to be distracted from the main task only if you find something really important.
You need to find and destroy the cargo prepared for sending to the PMC. This is a <color=#FFFEC1>mountain of boxes</color>. You yourself have seen these many times in the cargo hold of Magnum.
Great job, <color=#FFFEC1>Boss</color>. %BENEFICIARY_NAME% prepared and sent valuable cargo to Magnum as a reward. How many layers of irony are there?
<color=#FFFEC1>Task:</color> Pick up the corporate the <color=#FFFEC1>PCPU</color> from %STATION_NAME% and evacuate with it.

Details: Recently, %STATION_NAME% has been the main center of operations for %VICTIM_NAME%. A lot of market manipulation coming from here is directed against their competitor - %BENEFICIARY_NAME%. SBN is filled with mutual accusations and revelations. In this situation, %BENEFICIARY_NAME% would do well to know about the plans of %VICTIM_NAME%.

We should board %STATION_NAME%, find a corporate portable computer personal unit (the PCPU ) and take it with us. The interested party will definitely exchange it for something useful.

The sensors found one the <color=#FFFEC1>PCPU</color> that stuffed with data. However, the guards of %STATION_NAME% are already on their battle stations. We'll try to get you as close to the target as possible. <color=#FFFEC1>Take the device and come back</color>. Only distract yourself with something else if the risk is worth the reward.
<color=#FFFEC1>Task:</color> Pick up the corporate the <color=#FFFEC1>PCPU</color> from %STATION_NAME% and evacuate with it.

%VICTIM_NAME% is forced to change all operational plans. It <color=#FFFEC1>suspects</color> who the customer might be. If it decides to take revenge, we can accept <color=#FFFEC1>a contract</color> from it as well. The customer's representative %BENEFICIARY_NAME% took the PCPU and gave us the reward, it is already on the spacecraft.
<color=#FFFEC1>Task:</color> Pick up a <color=#FFFEC1>prototype</color> of a new invention at %STATION_NAME% and evacuate with it.

Details: Analysts were able to calculate an interesting pattern in the information flow of %VICTIM_NAME%. It takes any attention away from %STATION_NAME%. This means there is work for us.

Corporations often publish open research in the SBN: minor summaries, analysis results, some scientific discoveries. This is called fulfilling one's duty to humanity.

%BENEFICIARY_NAME% draws general attention to the fact that %STATION_NAME% is most likely developing something new. An obvious signal for PMCs to start acting.

%STATION_NAME% has an unusual signature. 99.9% probability that this is %BENEFICIARY_NAME% <color=#FFFEC1>prototype</color> that the customer needs. We'll drop you off as close to your target as possible. Find a way through the security, <color=#FFFEC1>take the device and return</color>. If you decide to look for something unusual at %STATION_NAME%, make sure it's worth the risk.
<color=#FFFEC1>Task:</color> Pick up the prototype of a new invention at %STATION_NAME% and evacuate with it.

We gave the representative of %BENEFICIARY_NAME% a prototype, and he gave us something that the corporation would like to test in the field. We exchange the worst for the bad, of course, but this is honest work.

Details: %VICTIM_NAME% is actively increasing its influence in the Solar System. It uses the chaos of the new redistribution of property for sabotage, murder, espionage against competitors, the Unchained Belt and the Civil Resistance. %STATION_NAME% is now the target of so-called "direct actions" on its part. Yes, we are talking about a takeover.

The current owner of the station, %BENEFICIARY_NAME%, is already sending out protests through official channels. And contracts to ensure the safety of the station are unofficial. Let's work!

Simple task: we land and destroy all the attackers until they stop trying to take the object by storm. Let's hold the station, and gratitude to %BENEFICIARY_NAME% will be very significant.

It is necessary to <color=#FFFEC1>take a defensive position</color> and force the attackers to retreat. We should not expect that our opponents will be the security %VICTIM_NAME%. Such problems are solved only by <color=#FFFEC1>PMCs</color>. We shouldn't worry about any collateral damage. We have one <color=#FFFEC1>mission</color>: to ensure that %STATION_NAME% remains the property of %BENEFICIARY_NAME% when the dust settles and the smoke clears.

%BENEFICIARY_NAME% retained control of %STATION_NAME%. Direct actions proved to be a losing strategy for %VICTIM_NAME%. This means that it will now move on to murder, espionage, and sabotage. %BENEFICIARY_NAME% is already spreading information about its unprecedented success in the fight against piracy. %STATION_NAME% is now ready to be liberated by corporates. Well, if anyone wants to do this, we're always here. The employer sent us the due cargo.
<color=#FFFEC1>Task:</color> Pick up the pirate crew's <color=#FFFEC1>PCPU</color> at %STATION_NAME% and evacuate with it.

Details: %STATION_NAME% is held by pirates. The assets of %BENEFICIARY_NAME% were attacked several times by these public enemies. Now %BENEFICIARY_NAME% really wants to know about their movements.

If %STATION_NAME% serves as a base of operations for the pirates, then the necessary data will definitely be there. You will need to pick up the portable computer personal unit (the PCPU) from the pirate crew, and then return with it to Magnum.

The pirates have turned %STATION_NAME% into a real garbage dump, but they protect it well. It won't be possible to land you near the target. Sensors show that the pirates are taking up defensive positions. The espionage operation to steal the <color=#FFFEC1>PCPU</color>, not yet begun, turned into a war. The good news: we've spotted the right device. It is marked on your map. Good luck.
<color=#FFFEC1>Task:</color> Pick up the pirate crew's <color=#FFFEC1>PCPU</color> at %STATION_NAME% and evacuate with it.

%BENEFICIARY_NAME% is already studying the <color=#FFFEC1>PCPU</color> we obtained. It might want to take over %STATION_NAME%. Or maybe it will sell the data to the highest bidder. We'll watch. The reward has already been delivered to Magnum.

Details: %VICTIM_NAME% is actively increasing its influence in the Solar System. Public enemies are using the chaos of the new redistribution of property for sabotage, murder, and espionage against system corporations.

%STATION_NAME% is subject to an attempt to seize it. If %VICTIM_NAME% succeeds, the asset will be removed from the market for a long time. The current owner of the station, %BENEFICIARY_NAME%, is already in full swing sending out calls to fight terrorism and contracts to ensure the security of the station. A good reason to earn extra money.

We'll land in the place specified by the customer and eliminate all the attackers until they stop trying to take the object by storm. Let's hold the station - the gratitude of %BENEFICIARY_NAME% will be very significant.

It is necessary to take a defensive position and hold out until the attackers give up trying to storm the station. All the rabble belonging to %VICTIM_NAME% are heading here.

Collateral damage should not worry us. We have one mission: that %STATION_NAME% remains the property of %BENEFICIARY_NAME% when the dust settles and the smoke clears.

%BENEFICIARY_NAME% retained control of %STATION_NAME%. %VICTIM_NAME% did not have enough strength for a direct capture. This means that it will now move on to more traditional terrorist actions. There will be work for us here soon. In the meantime, Magnum received a cargo from %BENEFICIARY_NAME% as gratitude for the work.
<color=#FFFEC1>Task:</color> Escort the manager of %BENEFICIARY_NAME% to the safe location.

Details: An ambitious project manager for %BENEFICIARY_NAME% works at %STATION_NAME%. He is taking effective measures against the public enemies in this part of the Solar System. Of course, this does not suit %VICTIM_NAME% at all.

The Security Service of %BENEFICIARY_NAME% has received information that these public enemies ordered the murder of the manager. We can take the contract for their protection. Not the most rewarding job, but it's a good way to improve your relationship with %BENEFICIARY_NAME%.

The target signature provided to us by %BENEFICIARY_NAME% is clearly visible. The location is marked on your map. <color=#FFFEC1>Escort</color> the valuable staff to the specified location at %STATION_NAME%. Move from level to level until you are safe. The attackers are <color=#FFFEC1>rabble</color> from all the outskirts of the System. Exploring %STATION_NAME% is not included in the task list, but act according to the circumstances.
Escort is a routine job. Your task: escort the manager to the <color=#FFFEC1>safe location</color> specified by the Security Service of %BENEFICIARY_NAME%.
As a reward for retaining a valuable employee, %BENEFICIARY_NAME% sent us a package. Let's hope the manager whose life we ​​saved today will be generous. The cargo is already on board Magnum.

Details: %BENEFICIARY_NAME% has firmly integrated %STATION_NAME% into its structure. %VICTIM_NAME% has been operating around this station for some time. Apparently it needs %STATION_NAME% to establish a base of operations here.

Public enemies are planning an attack on the communication system of %STATION_NAME%. %VICTIM_NAME% is ready to attack at any moment.

Our task is to protect the equipment of %BENEFICIARY_NAME%.

The location of the communication center is marked on your map. Sabotage groups will infiltrate %STATION_NAME% as they overcome the anti-space defenses. Eliminate them, <color=#FFFEC1>don't let them destroy the communication dish</color>.
You need to <color=#FFFEC1>protect the transmitter</color>. It is a satellite dish aimed into space. There is a mark on your map.
%STATION_NAME% continues to generate profits for %BENEFICIARY_NAME%. It is extremely grateful to us for our work. The valuable cargo has already been transferred to Magnum.

Details: Analysts were able to calculate an interesting pattern in the information flow regarding the activities of %BENEFICIARY_NAME%. Agents of %VICTIM_NAME% found out that some prototype was being developed at %STATION_NAME%. Most likely they will try to take it over because they want to close the technological gap with the corporations.

If we want to improve the attitude of %BENEFICIARY_NAME% towards us, we need to protect the prototype.

Our opponents are rabble from the outskirts of the Solar System. The HIS of %VICTIM_NAME% is hovering nearby, it is irradiating %STATION_NAME% with a geoscanner. Rough work, but it has probably detected a new signature from the experimental prototype.

We need to land on the station and eliminate all infiltration teams. Be distracted by profiting from your employers' things only if it doesn't interfere with your main job.

Representatives of %BENEFICIARY_NAME% thank us for protecting the prototype. Gratitude is more like an advertising brochure about how a new product will help all of humanity. The point, of course, is not this, but the rate of profit. Therefore, our reward should not be small.

<color=#FFFEC1>Boss</color>, %VICTIM_NAME% is attacking %STATION_NAME%, regardless of losses. %BENEFICIARY_NAME% is requesting assistance. If we respond, we will need to <color=#FFFEC1>provide the attackers with a decent greeting</color> until corporate reinforcements arrive.
%VICTIM_NAME% throws squad after squad into battle. You need to <color=#FFFEC1>hold out</color> until the forces of %BENEFICIARY_NAME% arrive.
%BENEFICIARY_NAME% will have to deal with the mess that the public enemies caused at %STATION_NAME% for a long time. The reward is already on Magnum.

Details: Quasimorphosis is gradually ceasing to be a mystery. The Hexarchy is trying to maintain the appearance of control: everything unusual is presented as provocations of the Civil Resistance. %BENEFICIARY_NAME% sent a notification via the SBN that it was going to conduct an orphan asset inspection. In other words, it is ready to attract PMC to take %STATION_NAME% away from the quasimorphs. After our victory, it will declare what happened as its contribution to the restoration of order in the System. Let it say what it wants, the main thing is that it will have to invest heavily in us.

Here's what you need to do: walk around %STATION_NAME% and kill as many quasimorphs as possible. Somehow, %VICTIM_NAME% was able to train quasimorphs to linger in physical reality for a long time.

When we leave this place, the smart guys of %BENEFICIARY_NAME% will arrive and put %STATION_NAME% in order.

We don't know why exactly these quasimorphs remain in our reality. As a rule, the quasimorphosis subsides soon after the violence stops. But %VICTIM_NAME% has learned to overcome this limitation. You'll have to work manually.

After disembarking, methodically move forward through %STATION_NAME% and shoot everything that moves. Keep your eyes open and try to be prepared for any turn of events. Good luck.
As expected, %BENEFICIARY_NAME% claimed %STATION_NAME% as its property. What happened there is a corporate secret. We got what we were due: the cargo from %BENEFICIARY_NAME% is already on Magnum.

Details: %BENEFICIARY_NAME% has launched activities around %STATION_NAME%. It wants to get this asset, but, judging by the analysis of data from the SBN, not yet ready for direct actions. The corporatists can be understood: %STATION_NAME% is in the clutches of %VICTIM_NAME%, which has openly challenged the human world order. These quasimorphs have somehow learned to linger in our reality for a long time. We can test the strength of their defenses.

It is known from %BENEFICIARY_NAME% that a quasimorph of the duke type was spotted at %STATION_NAME%. If we manage to eliminate it, then the forces of %VICTIM_NAME% here will be significantly weakened. Of course, we are not doing this to save humanity. %BENEFICIARY_NAME% indicated that PMC, which takes on this work, will receive a good reward.

The sensors are almost completely blind: we observe unimaginable leaps of quasimorphosis. We'll drop you off wherever we can. <color=#FFFEC1>Kill the Duke</color>. Don't try to be a hero and clear out the entire %STATION_NAME%, it's not in the contract.

%BENEFICIARY_NAME% asked us to provide us with a report on the events that accompanied the completion of tasks. A lot of effort went into preparing it. Perhaps it was more difficult than killing that quasimorph? Let's hope the reward in Magnum's cargo bay was worth the pain.

Details: the Hexarchy reports through the SBN that the proceedings about... unusual eventsin the Solar System continue. However, corporations will not wait for permission, and more and more assets in the Inner System become "orphaned". Nobody admits the existence of quasimorphs. Assets controlled by %VICTIM_NAME% can be appropriated. Thus, %BENEFICIARY_NAME% is very interested in %STATION_NAME%, but it is not ready for direct actions.

According to it, in this place there is a object that looks like a statue or obelisk. Of course, the artifact has a quasimorphic origin. %BENEFICIARY_NAME% calls it reliquary. It is willing to pay handsomely for its destruction.

We believe that these reliquaries are related to the ability of quasimorphs to maintain a long-term presence in physical reality.

This <color=#FFFEC1>reliquary</color>... It just shines on the sensors. I think finding and destroying it is a really good idea. Be extremely careful, %STATION_NAME% is literally crawling with quasimorphs. Focus on the task and don't get distracted by anything. At any moment the situation can only get worse.
<color=#FFFEC1>Task:</color> Find and destroy the <color=#FFFEC1>reliquary</color> - a quasimorphic artifact similar to a statue or obelisk.
%BENEFICIARY_NAME% is extremely grateful for your assistance in... studying %STATION_NAME%. The cargo is already on board Magnum.
<color=#FFFEC1>Task:</color> Pick up the <color=#FFFEC1>igvalite</color> at %STATION_NAME% and evacuate with it.

Details: Despite the suppression of information by the Hexarchy, it is known that %STATION_NAME% is in the hands of %VICTIM_NAME%. %BENEFICIARY_NAME% discovered something interesting there.

A reconnaissance drone sent there picked up the signature of an igvalite, a quasimorphic artifact capable of accumulating gavvakh. It appears that %VICTIM_NAME% is using this station for energy storage. We have work to do.

%BENEFICIARY_NAME% offers a job to infiltrate %STATION_NAME% and pick up the igvalite.

The signature of igvalite has been found, its location is marked on your map. Move through %STATION_NAME% carefully, save your strength. %BENEFICIARY_NAME% is ready to reward well for this rock.

We will try to drop you off as close to the place as possible, but we cannot promise anything: the shuttle pilot reports strange visions.

<color=#FFFEC1>Task:</color> Find <color=#FFFEC1>igvalite</color> - a quasimorphic artifact similar to a mineral, and then return with it to Magnum. Stealing is included in the standard range of our services. The fact that we are operating in the territory of quasimorphs does not change anything.
The meeting with a representative of %BENEFICIARY_NAME% took place. It's a good deal: worthless rock in exchange for valuable cargo.

Details: Due to an information quarantine blocking any reports of quasimorphosis, %BENEFICIARY_NAME% is unable to directly report that %STATION_NAME% is about to be attacked by %VICTIM_NAME% .

Quasimorphs not only know how to linger in physical reality, but also have learned to bypass the SBN filters. They constantly transmit messages to the network. The Hexarchy immediately declares them fakes of the Civil Resistance.

If we want a reward from %BENEFICIARY_NAME%, then we should hurry.

As soon as we get you there, the attack will begin. Sensors show that quasimorphs have already appeared in certain places of %STATION_NAME%. <color=#FFFEC1>Hold out as long as possible</color>, their onslaught will certainly weaken.
The reward from %BENEFICIARY_NAME% is already on Magnum. If we can hold off even %VICTIM_NAME%, does that mean we can destroy them? Or is it just the euphoria of successfully completing a mission?
<color=#FFFEC1>Task:</color> Escort the security officer of %BENEFICIARY_NAME% to the safe location.

<color=#FFFEC1>Details:</color> The headquarters of the security officer of %BENEFICIARY_NAME% is located at %STATION_NAME%. Recently, they have carried out several successful operations against quasimorphs. And now %VICTIM_NAME% is about to attack the station. If we take on this fixed-term contract, we will need to <color=#FFFEC1>bring the Security Service officer to the safe location</color>.

The target signature provided to us by %BENEFICIARY_NAME% is clearly visible. <color=#FFFEC1>Escort</color> the security officer to the specified location at %STATION_NAME%. The attackers are <color=#FFFEC1>quasimorphs</color>, so be extremely careful. Exploring %STATION_NAME% is not included in the task list, but if you see something important, act according to the circumstances.

New day, new quasimorphs. <color=#FFFEC1>Your task</color>: escort the Security Service officer to the safe location. Perhaps it is this person who will later lead the resistance when %VICTIM_NAME% becomes a problem.
As a reward for saving a valuable employee, %BENEFICIARY_NAME% sent us a package so that we could conduct field tests. There are some of its new products. The cargo is already on board Magnum.

<color=#FFFEC1>Details:</color> %VICTIM_NAME% is preparing an attack in this part of the Solar System. %BENEFICIARY_NAME% is trying in any way to retain %STATION_NAME%. The quasimorphs seem to be targeting the <color=#FFFEC1>communications equipment</color>. %BENEFICIARY_NAME% will be extremely grateful to us if we stop them.
<color=#FFFEC1>Quasimorphs</color> of %VICTIM_NAME% are already attacking %STATION_NAME%. Methodically kill them, <color=#FFFEC1>don’t let them break</color> the communication equipment.
<color=#FFFEC1>Task:</color> Protect the communications equipment of %BENEFICIARY_NAME%. It is a satellite dish aimed into space.

The meeting with representatives of %BENEFICIARY_NAME% took place. The reward was transferred to Magnum. We were the only ones who responded when it became clear that the attackers were <color=#FFFEC1>quasimorphs</color>.
<color=#FFFEC1>Task:</color> Eliminate the group of quasimorphs from %VICTIM_NAME% before the <color=#FFFEC1>ritual</color> is completed.

<color=#FFFEC1>Details:</color> Recently, jumps in quasimorphosis have been recorded at %STATION_NAME%. This is not stated directly, but our analysts have long learned to recognize the corresponding hints in the <color=#FFFEC1>SBN</color>. Apparently, this activity attracted %VICTIM_NAME% here. They have captured part of the station and are preparing to hold some kind of <color=#FFFEC1>ritual</color> there. We must not let them finish what they started. %BENEFICIARY_NAME% promises a worthy reward.
It will not be possible to drop you off close to the ritual site. A real war has been going on at %STATION_NAME% for several days. We'll have to hurry. Quasimorphs must be stopped!
<color=#FFFEC1>Task:</color> Eliminate the group of quasimorphs from %VICTIM_NAME% before the <color=#FFFEC1>ritual</color> is completed.

%BENEFICIARY_NAME% has already transferred the reward to Magnum. I can’t shake the feeling that it was watching what was happening at the station and collecting information. Do you feel like an laboratory mouse, <color=#FFFEC1>Boss</color>?
<color=#FFFEC1>Task:</color> Eliminate <color=#FFFEC1>50% of the quasimorphs</color> living on %STATION_NAME%.

Details: Tezctlan is building a new Empire in the Solar System. He says that if Gannix has turned against him, he must build a new Gannix. Therefore, Tezctlan resettles Emerald Court into physical reality.

Now he is looking for anyone who will help him capture %STATION_NAME% in order to turn it into another bastion of the future Emerald Empire. %VICTIM_NAME% holds on to this piece of metal as if it were the greatest of treasures. Let's crush them and maybe the Master will turn his attention to us.

Even if analysts of %VICTIM_NAME% are expecting an attack from <color=#FFFEC1>Tezctlan</color>, the appearance of a trained operative <color=#FFFEC1>PMC</color> here will be a surprise to them. Act according to the situation, but remember that great causes require great cruelty.

<color=#FFFEC1>Tezctlan</color> is pleased with our work. %STATION_NAME% will soon be part of his Emerald Empire. A gift from the Master appeared in Magnum's cargo hold. It's worth testing the artifact in action.
<color=#FFFEC1>Task:</color> Find and eliminate the security officer of %VICTIM_NAME%.

Details: Tezctlan joined the fight for the Solar System. The fact that the Hexarchy hides his existence plays into our hands. The army of the Emerald Empire can slowly advance through the System.

Now the gaze of the King of Gannix is ​​fixed on %STATION_NAME%. Tezctlan says there is a factor preventing capture. He talks about an energetic and courageous warrior. Our analysts studied the personnel of %VICTIM_NAME% and came to the conclusion that we are talking about an employee of the local security service.

The Master will be pleased if we eliminate this warrior.

%STATION_NAME% security team is using countermeasures, so you have to maneuver. Sensors show that personnel occupy positions according to the combat schedule. Make a massacre, but <color=#FFFEC1>eliminate the target</color>. The will of <color=#FFFEC1>Tezctlan</color> is clearer than ever.
The Master's order is clear: <color=#FFFEC1>eliminate the Security Service employee</color> of %VICTIM_NAME%. Their location is marked on the map.

The Master is pleased with our work. %VICTIM_NAME% is in turmoil, and additional forces have been deployed to %STATION_NAME%. Maybe it's time to hit it somewhere else?

Tezctlan gave us a worthy reward, the artifact has already been delivered to Magnum by his servants.

Details: Tezctlan leads the quasimorphs into battle against humanity. You can join him or lose. One of his dukes conveyed to us a message about the Master's interest in %STATION_NAME%. In this place there is a powerful device that allows you to pick up mysterious voices from space. Tezctlan wants it destroyed before he sends his servants to take over the station.

Our analysts have studied this asset of %VICTIM_NAME%. Apparently, we are talking about a normal communication system. If we get to the transmitter and destroy it, the Master's pleasure will know no bounds.

We will try to throw you closer to the <color=#FFFEC1>transmitter</color>. It won't be easy: sensors show that the security of %VICTIM_NAME% is ready to attack. The good news is that the communication center is also clearly visible, and I marked it on your map. Show them what war is. Remind them who paved the way for corporations to freedom.
You need to <color=#FFFEC1>find and destroy the transmitter</color>. It is a satellite dish aimed into space. There is a mark on your map.

%STATION_NAME% is now completely blinded and stunned. We have created great difficulties for %VICTIM_NAME%. <color=#FFFEC1>Tezctlan</color> is satisfied with our work. He probably considers the transmitter to be something like an altar through which the gods speak to people... In any case, he transmitted something special from his arsenal to Magnum.
<color=#FFFEC1>Task:</color> Get to the ritual site and protect it.

Details: Tezctlan, who lived for centuries on Earth, learned how his quasimorphic servants maintain contact with physical reality. But this requires an influx of gavvakh, reliquaries, and regular rituals that extract energy from the bramfaturas of the planets.

The Master feels that at %STATION_NAME% the influence of the bramfatura has reached its peak. It's time for the ritual. However, %VICTIM_NAME%, which controls the station, stands in the way.

Tezctlan calls on all available forces to ensure that the Duke can perform the sacred ceremony. We have to hold the defense until the ritual is completed.

<color=#FFFEC1>Tezctlan</color> cannot wait, the ritual must be completed at any cost. %STATION_NAME% is under the control of %VICTIM_NAME%, and it will not retreat without a fight. Make your way to the ritual site and <color=#FFFEC1>hold your position</color> until it is completed. This is the will of the Master.
<color=#FFFEC1>Task:</color> Get to the ritual site and protect it.

Good job, the Master is extremely pleased. The <color=#FFFEC1>ritual</color> was completed successfully, the Emerald Empire can operate in this part of the Solar System and beyond. The servants of <color=#FFFEC1>Tezctlan</color> handed the reward to Magnum.

Details: %BENEFICIARY_NAME% firmly holds %STATION_NAME%. Its bastion in physical reality is evidence that the Solar System is returning under the control of its ancient masters. However, people have not yet understood which side to take.

%BENEFICIARY_NAME% wants us to defend %STATION_NAME% from the attack of %VICTIM_NAME%. It needs a bright event to advertise in the SBN. Of course, the corporation will not say that it seized the asset from the quasimorphs, it will lie about the Civil Resistance. Our task: to make sure that it won't get what it wants.

The attackers have already penetrated the perimeter of %STATION_NAME%. We have not yet understood whether it is <color=#FFFEC1>Security Service</color> or <color=#FFFEC1>PMC</color>. But it shouldn't make much difference to you. We'll drop you off in the main strike zone. As soon as you find your feet, <color=#FFFEC1>take up defensive position</color>. Sooner or later the attackers will retreat, you just need to hold out for enough time.

%STATION_NAME% was and remains a symbol that the order of the Solar System has changed forever. The <color=#FFFEC1>Hexarchy</color> will not be able to hide the truth forever. Lying will not help them when %BENEFICIARY_NAME% strikes back. A valuable gift from it arrived on Magnum, which will greatly help us in the future.
<color=#FFFEC1>Task:</color> Escort the Duke of %BENEFICIARY_NAME% to the safe location.

Details: %VICTIM_NAME% has launched activities around %STATION_NAME%. However, the station is in the hands of %BENEFICIARY_NAME%. The rightful owners of the Solar System will not give up so easily. And %VICTIM_NAME% understands this. It seems that it is preparing an action to eliminate the Duke of %BENEFICIARY_NAME%.

The quasimorphs call on their faithful servants to fulfill their sacred duty. If we want to strengthen our relationship with %BENEFICIARY_NAME%, we must take on the role of the Duke's personal guard. We need to escort it to the safe location on the station and protect it from attacks by fighters of %VICTIM_NAME%.

%BENEFICIARY_NAME% has called us for a specific purpose: <color=#FFFEC1>escort the Duke to safety</color> at %STATION_NAME%. Corporations send their best fighters into battle against quasimorphs, so save your strength.
<color=#FFFEC1>Task:</color> Escort the Duke of %BENEFICIARY_NAME% to the safe location.

The envoys of %BENEFICIARY_NAME% conveyed to us the praise of the <color=#FFFEC1>Duke</color> and called for the expansion of allied relations. If we work for the future winner now, we will take a worthy place in the future new hierarchy of the Solar System.

<color=#FFFEC1>Details:</color> %BENEFICIARY_NAME% has long held %STATION_NAME%. Presumably, the station is built into some kind of system that allows quasimorphs to stay in physical reality. %VICTIM_NAME% found out about this and decided to attack. Its target is the <color=#FFFEC1>reliquary</color>. %BENEFICIARY_NAME% will be grateful to us if we protect it.
Mercenaries from %VICTIM_NAME% are already attacking %STATION_NAME%. You need to <color=#FFFEC1>protect the reliquary</color>. Eliminate the attackers before they destroy the artifact.
<color=#FFFEC1>Task:</color> You need to <color=#FFFEC1>protect the reliquary</color> - a quasimorphic artifact similar to a statue or obelisk.
The meeting with quasimorphs from %BENEFICIARY_NAME% took place. The cargo has been received. <color=#FFFEC1>Creepy</color> creatures, but I think I'm starting to get used to them.

Details: %VICTIM_NAME% conducts operations related to %STATION_NAME%. The object has long been in the hands of %BENEFICIARY_NAME%.

We have recognized the signature of an igvalite emanating from the station. It is a quasimorphic artifact capable of accumulating gavvakh. It seems that %BENEFICIARY_NAME% is using this place to store energy.

We can get here before the attackers and eliminate the infiltration teams of %VICTIM_NAME%. If we do this, the future owners of the Solar System will be extremely generous.

Several infiltration teams from %VICTIM_NAME% have already infiltrated %STATION_NAME%. You need to find them all and <color=#FFFEC1>eliminate</color> before they take over the <color=#FFFEC1>igvalite</color>. Quasimorphs are ready to give a really good reward for this rock. I hope we chose the right side, <color=#FFFEC1>Boss</color>.
The meeting with quasimorphs from %BENEFICIARY_NAME% took place. This is a good deal: a rock that is useless to us in exchange for something that actually works.

Details: Tezctlan says that if Gannix has turned against him, he must build a new Gannix. Therefore, his Emerald Court is gradually moving to our world.

Now he is looking for anyone who will help him capture %STATION_NAME%, another bastion of his endless Empire.

%VICTIM_NAME% holds on to this metal piece of matter as if it were the greatest of treasures. Let us crush them, and perhaps the Master will find a task worthy of our talents.

Even if the staff at %STATION_NAME% were expecting an attack from <color=#FFFEC1>Tezctlan</color>, the appearance of a trained <color=#FFFEC1>PMC</color> operative here would be a surprise to them. Act according to the situation, be careful.
<color=#FFFEC1>Tezctlan</color> is pleased with our work. %STATION_NAME% now resembles Pandemonium. A gift from the Master appeared in Magnum's cargo hold. We should try this artifact in action.

<color=#FFFEC1>Details:</color> <color=#FFFEC1>Tezctlan</color> joined the fight for the Solar System. He perceives all people as an annoying obstacle to building an Empire. Now the piercing gaze of <color=#FFFEC1>the King of Gannix</color> is directed towards %STATION_NAME%, which is in the hands of %VICTIM_NAME%. <color=#FFFEC1>Tezctlan</color> says that there is a factor there that prevents the capture of this place. He speaks of "a great warrior defending a place of power." Our analysts studied the station and came to the conclusion that we are talking about the commander of the station’s defense. The Master will be extremely pleased if we eliminate this warrior.

The shuttle will land wherever it can. %VICTIM_NAME% is using countermeasures on %STATION_NAME%, so we have to maneuver. Sensors show that personnel occupy positions according to the combat schedule. Carry out a massacre, but get to the <color=#FFFEC1>commander</color> of these psychos. The will of <color=#FFFEC1>Tezctlan</color> is clearer than ever.

The Master is pleased with our work. %VICTIM_NAME% is in turmoil; additional forces have been deployed to %STATION_NAME%. Maybe it's time to hit it somewhere else?

Tezctlan gave us a worthy reward, the artifact has already been delivered to Magnum by his servants.

Details: Tezctlan leads the quasimorphs into battle against humanity. You can join him or lose. His dukes convey they master's interest in %STATION_NAME%. %VICTIM_NAME% placed there what the quasimorphs called an Altar of Knowledge. Tezctlan wants this device destroyed before he sends his servants to capture %STATION_NAME%.

Our analysts have studied %STATION_NAME%. We are talking about some computer, which %VICTIM_NAME% uses for an unknown purpose. If we destroy it, the Master's pleasure will know no bounds.

We will try to throw you closer to the <color=#FFFEC1>computer</color>. It won't be easy: sensors show that the station's defenders are already preparing for an attack. The good news is that the location of the computer at %STATION_NAME% is also clearly visible, and I have marked it on your map. Did they choose to be public enemies? Show them the consequences of such a decision.

Without a server, %VICTIM_NAME% has no chance of holding %STATION_NAME%. Somehow <color=#FFFEC1>Tezctlan</color> gradually learns about the sensitive infrastructure of the people. The Master is incredibly satisfied with our work. He transferred something special from his arsenal to Magnum.
<color=#FFFEC1>Task:</color> Get to the ritual site and protect it.

Details: Enemies of Tezctlan, which are much more dangerous than people, have appeared in the Solar System. Those who do not understand that the time of the Red and Gold Empire of the Sun has passed. Only one empire has a future: the Emerald Empire.

%STATION_NAME% is in the hands of the rebel %VICTIM_NAME%. These upstarts must be expelled from physical reality forever, which will become an inexhaustible source of gavvakh only for Tezctlan, the true master of the Solar System.

We don't know how some quasimorphs remain in our reality, while the majority are always attracted by their bramfaturas. I want to say that %STATION_NAME% is simply teeming with warriors of %VICTIM_NAME%. Sensors show that they are aware of the attack and are waiting for your arrival.

Proceed methodically, do not take unnecessary risks. Kill enough and the survivors will run. Upon completion of the mission, as soon as you leave the facility, Tezctlan will send his duke.

Servants of <color=#FFFEC1>Tezctlan</color> are settling in at %STATION_NAME%. Soon <color=#FFFEC1>Tezctlan</color> will become the master of the Solar System. He transferred something extremely valuable to Magnum.

<color=#FFFEC1>Details:</color> %VICTIM_NAME% captured %STATION_NAME%. <color=#FFFEC1>Tezctlan</color> wants the rebels to be taught a lesson. At the moment, the <color=#FFFEC1>Duke</color> is preparing quasimorphs for an attack on the objects of the Emerald Empire. Its <color=#FFFEC1>death</color> will please the King of Gannix.

We'll drop you off wherever we can. <color=#FFFEC1>Kill the Duke</color>. Don't try to be a hero and clear out the entire %STATION_NAME%. Don't take unnecessary risks, save your strength. I send the target location to your map. Good luck.
<color=#FFFEC1>Tezctlan</color> showed pleasure when he learned about the results of our work. His gift for our obedience awaits us in Magnum’s cargo hold.

Details: Tezctlan lifted the veil of mystery about why the quasimorphs of the Bramfatura of Venus are able to remain in physical reality for a long time.

In the past, the King of Gannix learned to bind his energy to a physical object that serves as an object of worship - a reliquary. And somehow %VICTIM_NAME% stole the secret from the Master. At %STATION_NAME% there is a reliquary that gives them the ability to linger in our world.

We will give pleasure to Tezctlan if we destroy this quasimorphic artifact.

What the sensors show is impossible to believe. This <color=#FFFEC1>reliquary</color>... it just shines! %STATION_NAME% is literally swarming with quasimorphs. Show %VICTIM_NAME% how people fight. Let's prove our usefulness to <color=#FFFEC1>Tezctlan</color>.

<color=#FFFEC1>Task:</color> Pick up the <color=#FFFEC1>igvalite</color> at %STATION_NAME% and evacuate with it.

Details: %VICTIM_NAME% firmly holds %STATION_NAME%. This angers Tezctlan. He wants to torture future slaves.

The servants of the King of Gannix told us that there is an igvalite at %STATION_NAME%. A special entity that is similar to a mineral. The Igvalite is capable of accumulating gavvakh - the energy that powers quasimorphs.

If we want to serve the future owner of the Solar System, we must get this mineral for him.

The signature of igvalite has been found, its location is marked on the map. We'll try to drop you off as close to the location as possible, but we can't promise anything: the shuttle pilot is already reporting strange visions.

Move through %STATION_NAME% carefully, save your strength. %VICTIM_NAME% will certainly defend igvalite with special zeal.

Both groups of quasimorphs not only know how to linger in physical reality, but have also learned to bypass the SBN filters and constantly transmit messages to the network. Each faction considers itself the true master of the Solar System.

An attack on the station can begin at any moment, and if we want to improve relations with %BENEFICIARY_NAME%, then we should hurry.

As soon as we get you there, the attack will begin. Sensors show that hostile quasimorphs have already appeared in certain areas of %STATION_NAME%. <color=#FFFEC1>Hold out as long as possible</color>, their onslaught will certainly weaken.
The reward from %BENEFICIARY_NAME% is already on Magnum. If we can hold off even %VICTIM_NAME%, does that mean we can destroy them? And is it worth doing this for the sake of other quasimorphs?
