%BENEFICIARY_NAME% has called us for a specific <color=#FFFEC1>task</color>: to escort the Duke to safety at %STATION_NAME%. You should easily deal with the militants of %VICTIM_NAME%.
<color=#FFFEC1>Task:</color> Escort the Duke of %BENEFICIARY_NAME% to the safe location.

The envoys of %BENEFICIARY_NAME% conveyed to us the praise of the <color=#FFFEC1>Duke</color> and called for the expansion of allied relations. If we work for the future winner now, we will take a worthy place in the future new hierarchy of the Solar System.

Details: %VICTIM_NAME% conducts operations related to %STATION_NAME%. The object has long been in the hands of %BENEFICIARY_NAME%.

We have recognized the signature of an igvalite emanating from the station. It is a quasimorphic artifact capable of accumulating gavvakh. It seems that %BENEFICIARY_NAME% is using this place to store energy.

We can get here before the attackers and eliminate the infiltration teams of %VICTIM_NAME%. If we do this, the future owners of the Solar System will be extremely generous.

Several infiltration teams from %VICTIM_NAME% have already infiltrated %STATION_NAME%. You need to find them and eliminate them before they take over the igvalite. The quasimorphs are ready to give out a really good reward for this rock.

I hope we chose the right side, Boss.
The meeting with quasimorphs from %BENEFICIARY_NAME% took place. This is a good deal: a rock that is useless to us in exchange for something that actually works.

Boss, %VICTIM_NAME% is attacking %STATION_NAME%, regardless of losses. Looks like the outcasts really need something at this station. %BENEFICIARY_NAME% calls on its loyal servants to help. The quasimorphs would like to keep the station for themselves.

If we respond to the call for help, we will need to provide the attackers with a worthy meeting: hold back their attacks until reinforcements from %BENEFICIARY_NAME% will arrive.
%VICTIM_NAME% throws squad after squad into battle. You need to <color=#FFFEC1>hold out</color> until the forces of %BENEFICIARY_NAME% arrive.
%BENEFICIARY_NAME% retains full control of %STATION_NAME%. Our quasimorphic allies (or masters?) thanked us and sent valuable cargo to Magnum.

Details: %VICTIM_NAME% does not understand what it is doing. Gagtungr sleeps in the inaccessible bramfatura of the Sun. He did not give sanctions for the construction of new empires. The world of Bramfatur must continue to exist, and Feathered Masks will contribute to this.

%STATION_NAME% is in the hands of %VICTIM_NAME%. These upstarts must be forever expelled from physical reality, whose task is to be the reverse side of the real world and serve as a source of gavvakh.

We don't know how some quasimorphs remain in our reality, while the majority are always attracted by their bramfaturas. I want to say that %STATION_NAME% is simply teeming with warriors of %VICTIM_NAME%. Sensors show that they are aware of the attack and are waiting for your arrival.

Proceed methodically, do not take unnecessary risks. Kill enough and the survivors will run. Upon completion of the mission, as soon as you leave the facility, Xiomara will send her duke.

Servants of <color=#FFFEC1>Xiomara</color> are settling in at %STATION_NAME%. <color=#FFFEC1>Feathered Masks</color> are pleased with our success. They transferred something extremely valuable to Magnum.

<color=#FFFEC1>Details:</color> Quasimorphs have captured %STATION_NAME%. <color=#FFFEC1>Xiomara</color> wants her enemies to be taught a lesson. <color=#FFFEC1>The Duke</color> of %VICTIM_NAME% is currently located in this location. They prepare quasimorphs to attack the bases of the <color=#FFFEC1>Feathered Masks</color>. Their <color=#FFFEC1>elimination</color> is a good way to please <color=#FFFEC1>Xiomara</color>.

We'll drop you off wherever we can. <color=#FFFEC1>Kill the Duke</color>. Don't try to be a hero and clear out the entire %STATION_NAME%. Don't take unnecessary risks, save your strength. I send the target location to your map. Good luck.
<color=#FFFEC1>Xiomara</color> is pleased with the result of our work. A gift for our obedience awaits in the Magnum's cargo hold.

Details: Xiomara has lifted the veil of mystery about why the quasimorphs of Feathered Masks are able to remain in physical reality for a long time. They have learned to bind their energy to a special reliquary, which serves as another object of worship.

It seems that somehow the quasimorphs of %VICTIM_NAME% have taken possession of this secret and can remain in our world . There is a reliquary at %STATION_NAME% that gives them this ability. We can help Feathered Masks if we destroy this quasimorphic artifact.

What the sensors show is impossible to believe. This <color=#FFFEC1>reliquary</color>... it just shines! %STATION_NAME% is literally swarming with quasimorphs. Show %VICTIM_NAME% how people fight. Let's prove our usefulness to <color=#FFFEC1>Xiomare</color>.
<color=#FFFEC1>Task:</color> find and destroy the <color=#FFFEC1>reliquary</color> - a quasimorphic artifact similar to a statue or obelisk.

The quasimorphs of %VICTIM_NAME% at %STATION_NAME% resemble bees in a disturbed hive. The time will soon come to strike again here. <color=#FFFEC1>Feathered Masks</color> are extremely pleased with our work. We received one of the artifacts as a gift from <color=#FFFEC1>Xiomara</color>.
<color=#FFFEC1>Task:</color> Pick up the <color=#FFFEC1>igvalite</color> at %STATION_NAME% and evacuate with it.

Details: %VICTIM_NAME% firmly holds %STATION_NAME%. Xiomara senses the presence of an extremely important thing there, which will help her in the fight for the Solar System.

The Warriors of the Feathered Masks told us that there is an igvalite on %STATION_NAME% - a mineral-like entity. It is able to accumulate gavvakh - energy that powers quasimorphs. If we want to serve Xiomara, we must get her this igvalite.

The signature of igvalite has been found, its location is marked on the map. We'll try to drop you off as close to the location as possible, but we can't promise anything: the shuttle pilot is already reporting strange visions.

Move through %STATION_NAME% carefully, save your strength. %VICTIM_NAME% will certainly defend igvalite with special zeal.
<color=#FFFEC1>Task:</color> Pick up the <color=#FFFEC1>igvalite</color> at %STATION_NAME% and evacuate with it.
The meeting with the warriors of <color=#FFFEC1>Feathered Masks</color> took place. We gave them the <color=#FFFEC1>igvalite</color>, they gave us a gift from <color=#FFFEC1>Xiomara</color>.

Details: %BENEFICIARY_NAME% needs our services. Their %STATION_NAME% is being attacked by %VICTIM_NAME%. Both groups of quasimorphs not only know how to linger in physical reality, but have also learned to bypass the SBN filters and constantly transmit messages to the network. Each faction considers itself the true master of the Solar System.

An attack on the station can begin at any moment, and if we want to improve relations with %BENEFICIARY_NAME%, then we should hurry.

As soon as we get you there, the attack will begin. Sensors show that hostile quasimorphs have already appeared in certain areas of %STATION_NAME%. <color=#FFFEC1>Hold out as long as possible</color>, their onslaught will certainly weaken.
The reward from %BENEFICIARY_NAME% is already on Magnum. If we can hold off even %VICTIM_NAME%, does that mean we can destroy them? And is it worth doing this for the sake of other quasimorphs?
<color=#FFFEC1>Task:</color> Escort the Duke of %BENEFICIARY_NAME% to the safe location.

Details: %VICTIM_NAME% is preparing to attack %STATION_NAME%. However, it has been turned into a real fortress by %BENEFICIARY_NAME%. The rightful owners of the Solar System will not give up so easily. And %VICTIM_NAME% understands this. It seems it is planning to eliminate the Duke of %BENEFICIARY_NAME%.

The Quasimorphs call on their loyal servants to fulfill their sacred duty. If we want to strengthen relations with %BENEFICIARY_NAME%, we must take on the role of the Duke's personal guard.

We need to escort it to the safe location on the station and protect it from attacks by %VICTIM_NAME%.
%BENEFICIARY_NAME% has called us for a specific purpose: <color=#FFFEC1>escort the Duke</color> to safety at %STATION_NAME%. Quasimorphs will send the best warriors into battle, so be careful.
<color=#FFFEC1>Task:</color> Escort the Duke of %BENEFICIARY_NAME% to the safe location.

The envoys of %BENEFICIARY_NAME% conveyed to us the praise of the <color=#FFFEC1>Duke</color> and called for the expansion of allied relations. If we work for the future winner now, we will take a worthy place in the future new hierarchy of the Solar System.

<color=#FFFEC1>Details:</color> %BENEFICIARY_NAME% has long held %STATION_NAME%. Presumably, the station is built into some kind of system that allows quasimorphs to stay in physical reality. %VICTIM_NAME% has long been waging war against its quasimorphic enemies and is ready to attack %STATION_NAME%. Its target is the <color=#FFFEC1>reliquary</color>. %BENEFICIARY_NAME% will be grateful to us if we protect it.
%VICTIM_NAME% is already attacking %STATION_NAME%. You need to <color=#FFFEC1>protect the reliquary</color>. Eliminate the attackers before they destroy the artifact.
<color=#FFFEC1>Task:</color> You need to <color=#FFFEC1>protect the reliquary</color> - a quasimorphic artifact similar to a statue or obelisk.
The meeting with quasimorphs from %BENEFICIARY_NAME% took place. The cargo has been received. <color=#FFFEC1>Creepy</color> creatures, but I think I'm starting to get used to them.
<color=#FFFEC1>Task:</color> Eliminate all groups of quasimorphs who came for the <color=#FFFEC1>igvalite</color>.

Details: %BENEFICIARY_NAME% has held %STATION_NAME% for a long time. However, it is now under attack from %VICTIM_NAME%.

We have recognized the signature of an Igvalite coming from the station. It is a quasimorphic artifact capable of accumulating gavvakh. It seems that %BENEFICIARY_NAME% is using this place to store energy.

We can eliminate the groups of quasimorphs of %VICTIM_NAME% who have come for the igvalite. Let's do this, and the reward from the new owners of the Solar System will be extremely high.

Several groups of quasimorphs from %VICTIM_NAME% have already infiltrated %STATION_NAME%. You need to find them and eliminate them before they take over igvalite. %BENEFICIARY_NAME% is ready to give out a really good reward for this rock.

How did we even get into this, Boss?
<color=#FFFEC1>Task:</color> Eliminate all groups of quasimorphs who came for the <color=#FFFEC1>igvalite</color>.
The meeting with quasimorphs from %BENEFICIARY_NAME% took place. This is a good deal: a rock that is useless to us in exchange for something that actually works.

Details: Corporations are not only a source of loot for pirates, but also eternal enemies. The chaos that has arisen in the Solar System can be used to show corporations that they are not the only masters here.

Apparently, %VICTIM_NAME% has weakened its control over %STATION_NAME%. The pirates are ready to take control of the station. However, here and now they do not have the strength for a direct, organized attack. Do you have something personal for %VICTIM_NAME%, Boss? The pirates will not remain in debt.

So, we need to eliminate everyone who is able to hold a weapon and evacuate before this place becomes another branch of hell. The pirate crew, under whose control %STATION_NAME% will be transferred, will appear when we leave the facility.

%STATION_NAME% is at your complete disposal. Act methodically, the enemy is clear to you - this is its own security service or PMCs hired by the capitalists %VICTIM_NAME%. Once their losses become too great, they will leave this place. Keep your eyes open so you don't find yourself without the necessary supplies at a critical moment.

%VICTIM_NAME% raised a howl in the <color=#FFFEC1>SBN</color> on the topic of terrorism and non-compliance with laws. All you need to do is take a closer look at your property! By the way, the pirates delivered the cargo due to us for our participation in the attack. It's already aboard Magnum.
<color=#FFFEC1>Task:</color> Find and eliminate a high-ranking manager of %VICTIM_NAME%.

Details: People from the Unchained Belt contacted us. Space pirates report that %VICTIM_NAME% is distressed by a series of successful attacks on its spacecrafts and stations. The manager sent to deal with the situation plans an attack on objects occupied by pirates throughout the System. Now they are at %STATION_NAME%.

We can help the pirates stay here by eliminating this person. At the same time, we will test the strength of the defense of %VICTIM_NAME%. The warehouses of the Unchained Belt are full of loot, and we're sure to get something valuable.

Good news: the target is located at %STATION_NAME%. The shuttle will land wherever it can. And then your work will begin. Moderate resistance is expected from the Security Service of %VICTIM_NAME% or the PMCs working for them. There's no difference, is there? <color=#FFFEC1>If you eliminate the target, come back</color>. Try not to get too distracted exploring %STATION_NAME%, it's not our priority.
<color=#FFFEC1>Task:</color> Find and eliminate a high-ranking manager of %VICTIM_NAME%.

%VICTIM_NAME% has launched an information campaign about the need to completely eradicate piracy in the System. When and if they want to strike with retaliation, why don't we take on that job too?

The pirate crew delivered a reward to Magnum. Interesting people. Sometimes I wonder if someone in the Unchained Belt might be interested in the resume of a smart tactical dispatcher?

Details: %VICTIM_NAME% has firmly integrated %STATION_NAME% into its structure. Thanks to this asset, they managed to gain a strong foothold in the planetary market. Pirates have been eyeing this station for a long time: it would be an excellent base for organizing daring attacks in this part of the System.

There is a reliable way to prepare the space station for an invasion. If we strike at the communication system of %STATION_NAME%, which ensures its operation with the rest of the structural elements of %VICTIM_NAME%, then the owner will be forced to loosen its grip.

If we strike precisely the Unchained Belt will thank us generously.

The location of the communication center is marked on your map. Don’t be surprised that it’s so far from you - we had to maneuver. The security of %STATION_NAME% has already been raised by alarm. Nothing unusual: local Security Service. Maybe a PMC. Let me remind you that the task is not to collect everything valuable in this place. The <color=#FFFEC1>task is to destroy the transmitter</color>.
You need to <color=#FFFEC1>find and destroy the transmitter</color>. It is a satellite dish aimed into space. There is a mark on your map.
%STATION_NAME% has been excluded from %VICTIM_NAME% structure for some time. The pirates transferred valuable cargo to Magnum.
<color=#FFFEC1>Task:</color> Pick up the prototype of a new invention at %STATION_NAME% and evacuate with it.

Details: All pirate crews are associated with the Unchained Belt. It is not clear whether they have any kind of ideology or if this is some kind of trade union for all gentlemen of fortune. In any case, the Unchained Belt - seriously and for a long time. Now they are expanding their assets and even starting their own production.

Space pirates have found out that at %STATION_NAME%, engineers from %VICTIM_NAME% are creating a prototype of new equipment. If they manage to steal the prototype, the Belt will try to play on an equal footing with the corporations.

%STATION_NAME% has an unusual signature. There is a 99.9% chance that this is the prototype the <color=#FFFEC1>pirates</color> need. We'll drop you off as close to your target as possible. Make your way through the security, <color=#FFFEC1>take the device and return</color>. If you decide to look for something unusual at %STATION_NAME%, make sure it's worth the risk.
<color=#FFFEC1>Task:</color> Pick up the prototype of the invention and return with it to Magnum.
One of the <color=#FFFEC1>Unchained Belt</color> agents took the prototype. In return, they left some of the loot from the corporations. We exchange the worst for the bad.

<color=#FFFEC1>Boss</color>, the pirate crew has contacted us. Offers to take part in a vulgar robbery. They want valuables that %VICTIM_NAME% holds at %STATION_NAME%, but they cannot afford a direct attack right now. But we can. If we agree, we will need to <color=#FFFEC1>find the specified objects</color> on each floor of the station and evacuate with them.
Welcome to the world of pirates! Walk through each floor of the station, collect the marked items and escape with the loot.
<color=#FFFEC1>Task:</color> On each floor of %STATION_NAME%, pick up valuable items, then evacuate.

%VICTIM_NAME% will have to deal with the mess we created at %STATION_NAME% for a long time. The pirates took the junk and handed over some of their toys. Do you have a feeling that this was not just a robbery? We were used, <color=#FFFEC1>Boss</color>?

Details: Today we will take the side of a criminal organization. Let's not let the corporates take control of %STATION_NAME%. %VICTIM_NAME% actively posts messages in the SBN about the inadmissibility of this asset’s continued presence in the hands of pirates. This is a signal for us.

Our task: take a defensive position and eliminate corporate mercenaries until they give up trying to storm the station. The belt promises to reward our efforts well.

%STATION_NAME% is at your complete disposal. Most of the equipment here is stuff taken from corporations. If you take something for yourself, the pirates won't mind. The main thing is to <color=#FFFEC1>hold out</color> long enough, and the corporate fighters will retreat.
%VICTIM_NAME% is conducting a massive information campaign to save its reputation after a failed attack on %STATION_NAME%. The reward from the grateful pirates is already on board Magnum.
<color=#FFFEC1>Task:</color> Escort the captain of the pirate crew to the safe location.

<color=#FFFEC1>Details:</color> The <color=#FFFEC1>Unchained Belt</color> has long held %STATION_NAME% in its hands. This place has been turned into a natural hangout. The pirates have attracted the attention of %VICTIM_NAME%. An operation is being prepared to eliminate a successful pirate captain - a pain in the corporate ass. We can help The <color=#FFFEC1>Unchained Belt</color> if we escort the captain to the safe location at %STATION_NAME%.

You need to escort the pirate captain to the specified location. Nothing complicated. Move from level to level until you are safe. Exploring %STATION_NAME% is not included in the task list, but if you see something interesting, act according to the circumstances.
<color=#FFFEC1>Task:</color> Escort the captain of the pirate crew to the safe location.

I think many in the System have heard that %VICTIM_NAME% is not capable of performing even the simple job of eliminating the pirate captain. I wouldn’t be surprised if a new order arrives soon against the same corporation.
<color=#FFFEC1>Task:</color> Protect the pirate crew's supply warehouse.

Details: The Unchained Belt has seriously strengthened at %STATION_NAME%. It carried out several successful raids from here. But the last robbery attack on %VICTIM_NAME% was a mistake. Its analysts tracked the pirates to %STATION_NAME%. Gentlemen of fortune are preparing for defense.

We must prevent corporate henchmen from destroying the supplies collected here. If we help the Unchained Belt, we will receive not only respect, but also some of the salvaged equipment.

The location of the pirate warehouse has been transferred to your map. Sabotage groups will infiltrate %STATION_NAME% as they overcome the anti-space defenses. <color=#FFFEC1>Eliminate everyone, protect the warehouse</color>.
<color=#FFFEC1>Task:</color> Protect the pirate crew's supply warehouse.

%VICTIM_NAME% is already spreading information about its unprecedented success in the fight against piracy. Of course, without evidence. I think the <color=#FFFEC1>Unchained Belt</color> will win sooner or later. The ancap system needs to feed less on its own propaganda.

<color=#FFFEC1>Details:</color> %STATION_NAME% is the main center of operations for one daring pirate crew. Agents of the <color=#FFFEC1>Unchained Belt</color> learned that %VICTIM_NAME% plans to obtain information from %STATION_NAME%. The target is the <color=#FFFEC1>PCPU</color> pirate crew. If we want to make a profitable deal with the successful bandits, we must eliminate all the corporate infiltration teams.
The pirate %STATION_NAME% is in chaos, but the anti-space defenses are working as they should. Only a portion of the corporation's fighters will break through. Find them and eliminate them.
%VICTIM_NAME% is forced to look for another way to learn about the plans of the pirates in this part of the Solar System. I think that events around %STATION_NAME% are only gaining momentum.

Details: After %VICTIM_NAME% appeared in the Solar System, the space pirates did not think long. If something can become prey for the Unchained Belt, it will become it. The pirates want to recruit us to capture %STATION_NAME% in order to use it as a base of operations in this part of the Solar System.

Here's what we need to do: walk through %STATION_NAME% and destroy it as as many quasimorphs as possible. These creatures act on behalf of %VICTIM_NAME% and it is unknown how they learned to linger in physical reality for a long time.

We don't know why exactly these quasimorphs remain in our reality. As a rule, the quasimorphosis subsides soon after the violence stops. But %VICTIM_NAME% has learned to overcome this limitation. You'll have to work manually.

After disembarking, methodically move forward through %STATION_NAME% and shoot everything that moves. Keep your eyes open and try to be prepared for any turn of events. Good luck.

A pirate crew arrived at %STATION_NAME%, to which the council of commanders of the <color=#FFFEC1>Unchained Belt</color> transferred control. Looks like the pirates are here to stay. We got what we were due: the cargo is already on Magnum.

Details: The Unchained Belt has had its eye on %STATION_NAME% for a long time. The pirates would like to make it their base in this part of the Solar System. The station is now in the hands of %VICTIM_NAME%. If they manage to capture it, the corporatists will not even notice that %STATION_NAME% is now in the hands of the pirate crew.

Only the pirates found out that the station is home to a quasimorph of the Duke class and began searching for a contractor to eliminate this monster. This is where we come into play.

We observe unimaginable leaps of quasimorphosis. We'll drop you off wherever we can. Your task: <color=#FFFEC1>kill the Duke</color>. Don’t try to be a hero and clear out the entire %STATION_NAME%, we have a clear task with clear conditions.

The pirates asked us for quite a long time about the structure of %STATION_NAME% and what we discovered there. Obviously, they can decide to capture it at any moment. The reward is already in the Magnum's cargo hold.
<color=#FFFEC1>Task:</color> Pick up the <color=#FFFEC1>igvalite</color> at %STATION_NAME% and evacuate with it.

Details: The Unchained Belt is planning operations related to %STATION_NAME%. Despite the suppression of information by the Hexarchy, it is known that this place is in the hands of %VICTIM_NAME%. The pirates discovered something interesting there.

They caught the signature of an igvalite - a quasimorphic artifact capable of accumulating gavvakh. It appears that the quasimorphs use this location to store energy. There is work for us. The pirate liaison offers to infiltrate %STATION_NAME% and pick up the igvalite.

The signature of igvalite has been found, its location is marked on the map. We'll try to drop you off as close to the location as possible, but we can't promise anything: the shuttle pilot is already reporting strange visions.

Move through %STATION_NAME% carefully, save your strength. %VICTIM_NAME% will certainly defend igvalite with special zeal.
<color=#FFFEC1>Task:</color> Pick up the <color=#FFFEC1>igvalite</color> at %STATION_NAME% and evacuate with it.
The meeting with the pirate crew took place. They almost tried to bite this quasimorphic rock. Valuable cargo from them is on Magnum.

<color=#FFFEC1>Boss</color>, the pirate crew has contacted us. They offer to take part in a robbery, but we are not talking about a raid on a corporate warehouse. They want valuables from %VICTIM_NAME% at %STATION_NAME%. If we agree, we will need to <color=#FFFEC1>find the specified objects</color> on each floor of the station and evacuate with them. After this, %VICTIM_NAME% will remember us for a long time. They always remember.
Walk through each floor of %STATION_NAME%, find the marked items and escape with the loot.
<color=#FFFEC1>Task:</color> On each floor of %STATION_NAME%, pick up valuable items, then evacuate.
The pirates realized that even quasimorphs could be defeated. They gave us some of their toys. Do you feel like we were being used in the dark, <color=#FFFEC1>Boss</color>?

Details: Due to the public enemy status, the pirates cannot directly report that %STATION_NAME% is about to be attacked by %VICTIM_NAME%.

Our analysts discovered this information with the help of the quasimorphs themselves. They have learned to bypass the SBN filters and constantly transmit messages to the network. The Hexarchy immediately declares them fakes.

If we want to support the beleaguered pirate crew, then we should hurry.

As soon as we get you there, the attack will begin. Sensors show that quasimorphs have already appeared in certain places of %STATION_NAME%. <color=#FFFEC1>Hold out</color> for a while, and their onslaught will weaken. It seems that they are not omnipotent either.

The reward from the pirates is already on Magnum. %STATION_NAME% will serve the <color=#FFFEC1>Unchained Belt</color> for some time to come. But people, whatever they may be, are still better than quasimorphs. Right?
<color=#FFFEC1>Task:</color> Escort the pirate captain to the safe location.

<color=#FFFEC1>Details:</color> At %STATION_NAME% one of the headquarters of the <color=#FFFEC1>Unchained Belt</color> is located. The pirate captain in command here has carried out several successful operations against the quasimorphs. And now %VICTIM_NAME% is going to attack the station. If we take on this urgent contract, we will need to <color=#FFFEC1>escort</color> the captain to the safe location.

<color=#FFFEC1>Escort</color> the captain to the specified location at %STATION_NAME%. Move from level to level until you are safe. Exploring %STATION_NAME% is not included in the task list, but if you see something interesting, act according to the circumstances.
Another day, another mission against the quasimorphs. <color=#FFFEC1>Your task</color>: escort the pirate captain to safety.
The pirates sent us a valuable package as a reward for saving their man. The cargo is already on board Magnum.

<color=#FFFEC1>Details:</color> Pirates have seriously gained a foothold at %STATION_NAME%. From here they carried out several successful operations against %VICTIM_NAME%. However, the monsters gathered for a counterattack. Their target will be the station's server equipment. If we want to receive a reward from the pirates, we need to <color=#FFFEC1>prevent the quasimorphs from destroying the computer</color>.
The server location is marked on your map. The quasimorphs are already at %STATION_NAME%. Eliminate them all. The <color=#FFFEC1>equipment must survive</color>.
The pirates realized that %VICTIM_NAME% was not all-powerful. Sooner or later, pirates will begin their raids on quasimorphic objects.
<color=#FFFEC1>Task:</color> Eliminate the group of quasimorphs from %VICTIM_NAME% before the <color=#FFFEC1>ritual</color> is completed.

<color=#FFFEC1>Details:</color> Lately, surges in quasimorphosis have been felt at %STATION_NAME%. The captain of the pirate crew told us about this. He asks for help. Apparently, this bramfatura activity attracted %VICTIM_NAME%. They have captured part of the station and are preparing to hold some kind of <color=#FFFEC1>ritual</color> there. You need to get to them and eliminate them before they complete the ritual. The pirates promise a worthy reward for your help.

It won't be possible to drop you off any closer. A real war has been going on at %STATION_NAME% for several days. We'll have to hurry. <color=#FFFEC1>Stop the quasimorphs before the ritual ends</color>.
<color=#FFFEC1>Task:</color> Eliminate the group of quasimorphs from %VICTIM_NAME% before the <color=#FFFEC1>ritual</color> is completed.
The pirates have already transferred the reward to Magnum. I like these guys: for them both quasimorphs and corporations are a source of loot.

Details: The Unchained Belt uses the chaos of the new redistribution of property. Pirates throughout the System began sabotage, murder, and espionage. %STATION_NAME% is now the target of so-called "direct actions". That is, capture.

Simple task: we go in, kill everyone who is capable of holding weapons, and leave before this place becomes another branch of hell. The Civil Resistance has already sent colnodes to protect %STATION_NAME%.

By the way, I almost forgot. Capturing a station always pays well. And a trusting relationship with the Unchained Belt will not hurt us at all.

10 seconds until landing. As soon as the colnodes guarding %STATION_NAME% realize that the battle is lost, they will retreat or lay down their arms. It is enough to destroy 50% of the combatants.

Keep your eyes open! If you understand that you have enough strength and resources, you can explore this place. Apart from the capture, nothing else is included in the contract, that is, the customer will accept %STATION_NAME% in any condition. Pirates don't get to choose.
The <color=#FFFEC1>Civil Resistance</color> has lost a convenient station for organizing raids. The pirates have already delivered our reward to Magnum.

Details: Capitalist anarchy reigns in the Solar System, controlled by NCE. However, groups that are not part of the ancap system live in real hell.

Now %STATION_NAME% is in the hands of the Civil Resistance. Agents of the Unchained Belt managed to find out that one of the commanders of the CR colnodes was located here. The pirates are asking us to rid the System of a dangerous fanatic.

The elimination of an experienced colnode will send a message to the rebels that it is better not to mess with pirates.

The target is marked on your map: they are among the personnel of %STATION_NAME%. The shuttle will land wherever it can. The colnodes will put up fierce resistance. <color=#FFFEC1>Eliminate the fanatic and return</color>. Try not to get too distracted exploring %STATION_NAME%, it's not our priority.
Search and destroy is a routine job. <color=#FFFEC1>Your target</color>: a colnode commander. They will shoot back, so be careful.
Another fanatic destroyed. The pirate who delivered the reward to Magnum said that they would be glad not to fight against the rebels, but they asked for it.
<color=#FFFEC1>Task:</color> Destroy the resource warehouse of the <color=#FFFEC1>Civil Resistance</color> at %STATION_NAME%.

Details: Unfortunately, it is not only corporations that prevent gentlemen of fortune from making money. Fanatics of the Civil Resistance still believe in some ideals and a mythical state.

Currently, at %STATION_NAME%, the colnodes have created a resource warehouse. The liaison of the Unchained Belt offers to destroy it in order to stir up this anthill. The pirates are quietly planning to kidnap several colnodes and try to bring them to their senses.

We have marked the location of the warehouse on your map. Don't expect to be dropped off too close. The warehouse is safely hidden in the depths of %STATION_NAME%. <color=#FFFEC1>Find and destroy a mountain of boxes</color>. You are allowed to be distracted from the main task only if you have found something really important.

<color=#FFFEC1>Task:</color> Find and destroy the warehouse of the <color=#FFFEC1>Civil Resistance</color>. It is a mountain of boxes. You yourself have seen them many times in the cargo hold of Magnum.
Great job, <color=#FFFEC1>Boss</color>. The pirate crew overseeing the operation prepared and sent valuable cargo to Magnum.
<color=#FFFEC1>Task:</color> Take the Civil Resistance PCPU from %STATION_NAME% and evacuate with it.

<color=#FFFEC1>Details:</color> Recently, %STATION_NAME% has been the main center of operations for the <color=#FFFEC1>Civil Resistance</color>. Many raids organized from here were carried out against pirate crews. Therefore, the <color=#FFFEC1>Unchained Belt</color> would do well to know about the plans of the colnodes. This can be organized: we infiltrate %STATION_NAME%, find the <color=#FFFEC1>PCPU</color>, and the pirates will be forced to exchange the data for something valuable.

The sensors found the <color=#FFFEC1>PCPU</color>. However, the alarms at %STATION_NAME% have already been raised. <color=#FFFEC1>Take the device and come back</color>. Only be distracted by something if absolutely necessary.
<color=#FFFEC1>Task:</color> Take the Civil Resistance PCPU from %STATION_NAME% and evacuate with it.

The Civil Resistance is forced to change all operational plans at %STATION_NAME%. They suspect that the organizer of the attack is the Unchained Belt. If the colnodes decide to take revenge, it will be possible to accept a contract from them as well.

The commander of the pirate crew took the PCPU and gave us the reward, it is already on the spacecraft.

Sometimes pirates are not averse to making money not only at the expense of corporations. Agents of the <color=#FFFEC1>Unchained Belt</color> have learned that there are <color=#FFFEC1>valuable items</color> at %STATION_NAME%. They would be useful for pirates to intensify their activities in this region of the Solar System. The fanatics from the <color=#FFFEC1>Civil Resistance</color> clearly have no use for them. We can show the pirates what an exemplary robbery raid is.
<color=#FFFEC1>Task</color>: find and pick up valuable items on each floor of the station. Smash and destroy everything you want, but take the goods. After that, evacuate.
<color=#FFFEC1>Task:</color> On each floor of %STATION_NAME%, pick up valuable items, then evacuate.

The <color=#FFFEC1>Civil Resistance</color> will be dealing with the mess we created at %STATION_NAME% for a long time. The pirates took the goods and gave us something very valuable, probably stolen from one of the corporations.

Details: the Civil Resistance is actively interfering with pirates throughout the Solar System. They seem like they should only be a problem for corporations, but the Unchained Belt is also suffering. %STATION_NAME% is now the target of so-called "direct actions" by terrorists. Yes, we are talking about capture. Pirate crews from the station send announcements of a reward for participation in the defense of %STATION_NAME%.

Simple task: we land in the place specified by the customer and eliminate all the colnodes. Let's hold the station, and the gratitude of the Unchained Belt will be very significant.

It is necessary to <color=#FFFEC1>take a defensive position</color> and hold out long enough for the attackers to understand that this time they will not succeed. We have one mission: to ensure that %STATION_NAME% remains in the hands of pirates when the dust settles and the smoke clears.

The pirates retained control of %STATION_NAME%. Direct actions proved to be a losing strategy for the <color=#FFFEC1>Civil Resistance</color>. This means that they will now move on to murder, espionage and sabotage. There will be work for us here soon. In the meantime, Magnum received a cargo from the <color=#FFFEC1>Unchained Belt</color>.
<color=#FFFEC1>Task:</color> Escort the captain of the pirate crew to the safe location.

Details: %STATION_NAME% has long been in the hands of pirates. An experienced pirate commander uses it to systematically spoil everyone who interferes with the Unchained Belt. This does not suit both the corporation and the Civil Resistance.

The rebels placed a contract for PMC to eliminate the station commander %STATION_NAME%. We can take a contract from the pirates to protect them. If we need to improve our relationship with the Unchained Belt, there is no better way.

The target's location is marked on your map. <color=#FFFEC1>Escort</color> the pirate commander to the specified location on %STATION_NAME%. Move from level to level until you are safe. The attackers are the <color=#FFFEC1>Civil Resistance</color> colnodes. Exploring %STATION_NAME% is not included in the task list, but if you see something interesting, act according to the circumstances.
Escort is a routine job. <color=#FFFEC1>Your task</color>: escort the commander to the safe location specified by the pirates.
The <color=#FFFEC1>Unchained Belt</color> is grateful for the rescue of the experienced captain. The pirates who were loading the reward onto Magnum seemed like good guys to me.

<color=#FFFEC1>Details:</color> the <color=#FFFEC1>Unchained Belt</color> and the <color=#FFFEC1>Civil Resistance</color> hate each other as much as corporations. Mutual accusations between these groups are the essence of politics in the <color=#FFFEC1>Main Belt</color>. So, the pirate crew from %STATION_NAME% asks us to help <color=#FFFEC1>protect the resource warehouse</color>. The colnodes are trying to destroy it, sparing no effort and time.

We have marked the location of the warehouse on your map. Sabotage groups will infiltrate %STATION_NAME% as they overcome the anti-space defenses. Eliminate them and <color=#FFFEC1>do not let the warehouse be destroyed</color>.
You need to <color=#FFFEC1>protect the pirate warehouse</color>. It is a mountain of boxes. You yourself have seen them many times in the cargo hold of Magnum.
Great job, <color=#FFFEC1>Boss</color>. The pirates prepared and sent valuable cargo to Magnum as a reward.

Details: %STATION_NAME% is the main center of operations of the Unchained Belt against the Civil Resistance. The pirates learned that the rebels had located this place and were preparing a spy operation.

The target of the colnodes would be the PCPU with important data. If the device is stolen, the pirates will have to redo all operational and strategic plans.

If we want to receive a reward for this contract, we must eliminate all the rebel infiltration teams that will come for the PCPU.

HIS of the Civil Resistance hovered nearby. Surely they already know where the PCPU is located. It is necessary to prevent infiltration of %STATION_NAME% by destroying all groups of colnodes.

Pirates are usually not too concerned about the safety of property: they do not hope to hold the station for long. Therefore, they won’t notice the loss of a couple of things, but it’s better not to be distracted from the main task.

The <color=#FFFEC1>Civil Resistance</color> is forced to look for another way to find out about the pirates' plans. We have already received our reward, but it seems that events around this station are only gaining momentum.

The <color=#FFFEC1>Civil Resistance</color> attacks %STATION_NAME%, regardless of losses. The pirate crew that holds the defense there is asking for help. If we respond, we will need to provide the colnodes with a worthy meeting: hold off their attacks until reinforcements from the <color=#FFFEC1>Unchained Belt</color> arrive. It seems that the rebels really need something at this station, and they will attack as long as there is even a slight chance of success. <color=#FFFEC1>Our task</color>: hold out long enough.
%VICTIM_NAME% throws squad after squad into battle. You need to hold out until the forces of the <color=#FFFEC1>Unchained Belt</color> arrive.
The pirates will have to deal with the mess that the colnodes created at %STATION_NAME% for a long time. We also took part in this, but received a reward.

Details: After %VICTIM_NAME% appeared in the Solar System, the space pirates did not think long. If something can become prey for the Unchained Belt, it will become it. The pirates want to recruit us to capture %STATION_NAME% in order to use it as a base of operations in this part of the Solar System.

Here's what we need to do: walk through %STATION_NAME% and destroy it as as many quasimorphs as possible. These creatures act on behalf of %VICTIM_NAME% and it is unknown how they learned to linger in physical reality for a long time.

We don't know why exactly these quasimorphs remain in our reality. As a rule, the quasimorphosis subsides soon after the violence stops. But %VICTIM_NAME% has learned to overcome this limitation. You'll have to work manually.

After disembarking, methodically move forward through %STATION_NAME% and shoot everything that moves. Keep your eyes open and try to be prepared for any turn of events. Good luck.

A pirate crew arrived at %STATION_NAME%, to which the council of commanders of the <color=#FFFEC1>Unchained Belt</color> transferred control. Looks like the pirates are here to stay. We got what we were due: the cargo is already on Magnum.

Details: The Unchained Belt has had its eye on %STATION_NAME% for a long time. The pirates would like to make it their base in this part of the Solar System. The station is now in the hands of %VICTIM_NAME%. If they manage to capture it, the corporatists will not even notice that %STATION_NAME% is now in the hands of the pirate crew.

Only the pirates found out that the station is home to a quasimorph of the Duke class and began searching for a contractor to eliminate this monster. This is where we come into play.

We observe unimaginable leaps of quasimorphosis. We'll drop you off wherever we can. Your task: <color=#FFFEC1>kill the Duke</color>. Don’t try to be a hero and clear out the entire %STATION_NAME%, we have a clear task with clear conditions.

The pirates asked us for quite a long time about the structure of %STATION_NAME% and what we discovered there. Obviously, they can decide to capture it at any moment. The reward is already in the Magnum's cargo hold.
<color=#FFFEC1>Task:</color> Pick up the <color=#FFFEC1>igvalite</color> at %STATION_NAME% and evacuate with it.

Details: The Unchained Belt is planning operations related to %STATION_NAME%. Despite the suppression of information by the Hexarchy, it is known that this place is in the hands of %VICTIM_NAME%. The pirates discovered something interesting there.

They caught the signature of an igvalite - a quasimorphic artifact capable of accumulating gavvakh. It appears that the quasimorphs use this location to store energy. There is work for us. The pirate liaison offers to infiltrate %STATION_NAME% and pick up the igvalite.

The signature of the igvalite has been found, its location is marked on the map. We'll try to drop you off as close to the location as possible, but we can't promise anything: the shuttle pilot is already reporting strange visions.

Move through %STATION_NAME% carefully, save your strength. %VICTIM_NAME% will certainly defend the igvalite with special zeal.
<color=#FFFEC1>Task:</color> Pick up the <color=#FFFEC1>igvalite</color> at %STATION_NAME% and evacuate with it.
The meeting with the pirate crew took place. They almost tried to bite this quasimorphic rock. Valuable cargo from them is on Magnum.

<color=#FFFEC1>Boss</color>, the pirate crew has contacted us. They offer to take part in a robbery, but we are not talking about a raid on a corporate warehouse. They want valuables from %VICTIM_NAME% at %STATION_NAME%. If we agree, we will need to <color=#FFFEC1>find the specified objects</color> on each floor of the station and evacuate with them. After this, %VICTIM_NAME% will remember us for a long time. They always remember.
Walk through each floor of %STATION_NAME%, find the marked items and escape with the loot.
<color=#FFFEC1>Task:</color> On each floor of %STATION_NAME%, pick up valuable items, then evacuate.
The pirates realized that even quasimorphs could be defeated. They gave us some of their toys. Do you feel like we were being used in the dark, <color=#FFFEC1>Boss</color>?

Details: Due to the public enemy status, the pirates cannot directly report that %STATION_NAME% is about to be attacked by %VICTIM_NAME%.

Our analysts discovered this information with the help of the quasimorphs themselves. They have learned to bypass the SBN filters and constantly transmit messages to the network. The Hexarchy immediately declares them fakes.

If we want to support the beleaguered pirate crew, then we should hurry.

As soon as we get you there, the attack will begin. Sensors show that quasimorphs have already appeared in certain places of %STATION_NAME%. <color=#FFFEC1>Hold out</color> for a while, and their onslaught will weaken. It seems that they are not omnipotent either.

The reward from the pirates is already on Magnum. %STATION_NAME% will serve the <color=#FFFEC1>Unchained Belt</color> for some time to come. But people, whatever they may be, are still better than quasimorphs. Right?
<color=#FFFEC1>Task:</color> Escort the pirate captain to the safe location.

<color=#FFFEC1>Details:</color> At %STATION_NAME% one of the headquarters of the <color=#FFFEC1>Unchained Belt</color> is located. The pirate captain in command here has carried out several successful operations against the quasimorphs. And now %VICTIM_NAME% is going to attack the station. If we take on this urgent contract, we will need to <color=#FFFEC1>escort</color> the captain to the safe location.

<color=#FFFEC1>Escort</color> the captain to the specified location at %STATION_NAME%. Move from level to level until you are safe. Exploring %STATION_NAME% is not included in the task list, but if you see something interesting, act according to the circumstances.
Another day, another mission against the quasimorphs. <color=#FFFEC1>Your task</color>: escort the pirate captain to safety.
The pirates sent us a valuable package as a reward for saving their man. The cargo is already on board Magnum.

<color=#FFFEC1>Details:</color> Pirates have seriously gained a foothold at %STATION_NAME%. From here they carried out several successful operations against %VICTIM_NAME%. However, the monsters gathered for a counterattack. Their target will be the station's server equipment. If we want to receive a reward from the pirates, we need to <color=#FFFEC1>prevent the quasimorphs from destroying the computer</color>.
The server location is marked on your map. The quasimorphs are already at %STATION_NAME%. Eliminate them all. The <color=#FFFEC1>equipment must survive</color>.
The pirates realized that %VICTIM_NAME% was not all-powerful. Sooner or later, pirates will begin their raids on quasimorphic objects.
<color=#FFFEC1>Task:</color> Eliminate the group of quasimorphs from %VICTIM_NAME% before the <color=#FFFEC1>ritual</color> is completed.

<color=#FFFEC1>Details:</color> Lately, surges in quasimorphosis have been felt at %STATION_NAME%. The captain of the pirate crew told us about this. He asks for help. Apparently, this bramfatura activity attracted %VICTIM_NAME%. They have captured part of the station and are preparing to hold some kind of <color=#FFFEC1>ritual</color> there. You need to get to them and eliminate them before they complete the ritual. The pirates promise a worthy reward for your help.

It won't be possible to drop you off any closer. A real war has been going on at %STATION_NAME% for several days. We'll have to hurry. <color=#FFFEC1>Stop the quasimorphs before the ritual ends</color>.
<color=#FFFEC1>Task:</color> Eliminate the group of quasimorphs from %VICTIM_NAME% before the <color=#FFFEC1>ritual</color> is completed.
The pirates have already transferred the reward to Magnum. I like these guys: for them both quasimorphs and corporations are a source of loot.

Details: After %VICTIM_NAME% appeared in the Solar System, the space pirates did not think long. If something can become prey for the Unchained Belt, it will become it. The pirates want to recruit us to capture %STATION_NAME% in order to use it as a base of operations in this part of the Solar System.

Here's what we need to do: walk through %STATION_NAME% and destroy it as as many quasimorphs as possible. These creatures act on behalf of %VICTIM_NAME% and it is unknown how they learned to linger in physical reality for a long time.

We don't know why exactly these quasimorphs remain in our reality. As a rule, the quasimorphosis subsides soon after the violence stops. But %VICTIM_NAME% has learned to overcome this limitation. You'll have to work manually.

After this, %VICTIM_NAME% will remember us for a long time. They always remember.
Walk through each floor of %STATION_NAME%, find the marked items and escape with the loot.

The reward from the pirates is already on Magnum. %STATION_NAME% will serve the <color=#FFFEC1>Unchained Belt</color> for some time to come. But people, whatever they may be, are still better than quasimorphs. Right?

The pirate captain in command here has carried out several successful operations against the quasimorphs. And now %VICTIM_NAME% is going to attack the station. If we take on this urgent contract, we will need to <color=#FFFEC1>escort</color> the captain to the safe location.

<color=#FFFEC1>Escort</color> the captain to the specified location at %STATION_NAME%. Move from level to level until you are safe. Exploring %STATION_NAME% is not included in the task list, but if you see something interesting, act according to the circumstances.
Another day, another mission against the quasimorphs. <color=#FFFEC1>Your task</color>: escort the pirate captain to safety.
The pirates sent us a valuable package as a reward for saving their man. The cargo is already on board Magnum.

<color=#FFFEC1>Details:</color> Pirates have seriously gained a foothold at %STATION_NAME%. From here they carried out several successful operations against %VICTIM_NAME%. However, the monsters gathered for a counterattack. Their target will be the station's server equipment. If we want to receive a reward from the pirates, we need to <color=#FFFEC1>prevent the quasimorphs from destroying the computer</color>.

The pirates realized that %VICTIM_NAME% was not all-powerful. Sooner or later, pirates will begin their raids on quasimorphic objects.
<color=#FFFEC1>Task:</color> Eliminate the group of quasimorphs from %VICTIM_NAME% before the <color=#FFFEC1>ritual</color> is completed.

<color=#FFFEC1>Details:</color> Lately, surges in quasimorphosis have been felt at %STATION_NAME%. The captain of the pirate crew told us about this. He asks for help. Apparently, this bramfatura activity attracted %VICTIM_NAME%. They have captured part of the station and are preparing to hold some kind of <color=#FFFEC1>ritual</color> there. You need to get to them and eliminate them before they complete the ritual. The pirates promise a worthy reward for your help.

It won't be possible to drop you off any closer. A real war has been going on at %STATION_NAME% for several days. We'll have to hurry. <color=#FFFEC1>Stop the quasimorphs before the ritual ends</color>.
<color=#FFFEC1>Task:</color> Eliminate the group of quasimorphs from %VICTIM_NAME% before the <color=#FFFEC1>ritual</color> is completed.
The pirates have already transferred the reward to Magnum. I like these guys: for them both quasimorphs and corporations are a source of loot.

Details: The Shedu's Thousand appeared here to return the Solar System to Gagtungr. It is necessary to ensure that people give up attempts at resistance by the time the Overlord awakens.

Now the warriors of Urparp are looking for anyone who will capture %STATION_NAME% for them in order to turn this place into another bastion of the future Golden Empire.

%VICTIM_NAME% holds on to this metal piece of matter as if it were the greatest of treasures. Let's crush them, and Gagtungr will turn his attention to us.

Even if analysts of %VICTIM_NAME% are expecting an attack from the <color=#FFFEC1>Shedu's Thousand</color>, the appearance of a trained operative <color=#FFFEC1>PMC</color> here will be a surprise to them. Act according to the situation, but remember that great causes require great cruelty.

The Shedu's Thousand are satisfied with our work. %STATION_NAME% will soon be turned into another fortress of the revived Golden Empire.

A gift from the army of Gagtungr appeared in Magnum's cargo hold. We should try this artifact in action.
<color=#FFFEC1>Task:</color> Find and eliminate the security officer of %VICTIM_NAME%.

Details: The Shedu's Thousand joined the fight for the Solar System. The RealWare soldiers who swore allegiance to Urparp gave him sufficient strength.

The Hexarchy is trying to hide quasimorphosis from people. This only plays into our hands. Gagtungr's army can slowly advance through the System.

Now the attention of the soldiers of the Golden Empire is focused on %STATION_NAME%. Operatives of the Shedu's Thousand say that there is a factor there that prevents the capture of this place. They talk about Security Officer of %VICTIM_NAME%, who carried out several successful operations against quasimorphs.

Urparp will be extremely pleased if we will eliminate the threat.

The shuttle will land wherever it can. %STATION_NAME% security team is using countermeasures, so we have to maneuver. Personnel occupy positions according to the combat schedule. Carry out a massacre, but eliminate the <color=#FFFEC1>Security Service employee</color>. Let's prove to the <color=#FFFEC1>Shedu's Thousand</color> that we are worthy to serve.
<color=#FFFEC1>Task:</color> Eliminate the security officer of %VICTIM_NAME%. their location is marked on your map.

The <color=#FFFEC1>Shedu's Thousand</color> is satisfied with our work. %VICTIM_NAME% is in turmoil, and additional forces are being deployed to %STATION_NAME%. Maybe it's time to hit it somewhere else? The faithful servants of <color=#FFFEC1>Gagtungr</color> gave us a worthy reward. The artifact is already on Magnum.

Details: The Shedu's Thousand want to prepare the Solar System for the awakening of Gagtungr, their master. You can join the future Golden Empire now or lose.

One of the operatives of the Shedu's Thousand sent us a message about interest in %STATION_NAME%. The powerful transmitter of %VICTIM_NAME% is located in this location.

If we get to the communication device and destroy it, Gagtungr will turn on us attention when he wakes up.

We'll try to throw you closer to the <color=#FFFEC1>transmitter</color>, but you'll have to walk part of the way on your own. It won't be easy: according to sensors, the security of %VICTIM_NAME% is ready for an attack. The good news is that the communication center is clearly visible, and I marked it on your map. Show them what war is, remind them who paved the way for corporations to freedom.
You need to <color=#FFFEC1>find and destroy the transmitter</color>. It is a satellite dish aimed into space. There is a mark on your map.

%STATION_NAME% is now completely blinded and stunned. We have created great difficulties for %VICTIM_NAME%. The <color=#FFFEC1>Shedu's Thousand</color> is satisfied with our work. They plan to take over this station in the near future. The reward is already on Magnum.
<color=#FFFEC1>Task:</color> Get to the ritual site and protect it.

Details: Warriors of the Shedu's Thousand know how the quasimorphic servants of Gagtungr maintain contact with physical reality. But this requires constant effort. An influx of gavvakh, reliquaries, and regular rituals that extract energy from the bramfaturas of the planets are needed.

Urparp senses that the influence of the bramfatura has reached its peak at %STATION_NAME%. It's time for the ritual. However, %VICTIM_NAME%, which controls the station, stands in the way.

The Shedu's Thousand calls on all available forces to ensure the Duke has the opportunity to perform the sacred ceremony. We have to hold the defense until the ritual is completed.

The army of <color=#FFFEC1>Gagtungr</color> cannot remain idle, the ritual must be completed at any cost. %STATION_NAME% is under the control of %VICTIM_NAME%, and it will not retreat without a fight. <color=#FFFEC1>Your task</color>: make your way to the ritual site and hold the position until the end. No matter what goes wrong, you have to hold out.
<color=#FFFEC1>Task:</color> Get to the ritual site and protect it.

Good job, the <color=#FFFEC1>Shedu's Thousand</color> is extremely pleased. The ritual was completed successfully. The army of <color=#FFFEC1>Gagtungr</color> can operate in this part of the Solar System and beyond. They handed the reward to Magnum.

Details: %BENEFICIARY_NAME% firmly holds %STATION_NAME%. This bastion of theirs in physical reality is evidence that the Solar System is returning under the control of its ancient masters. However, people have not yet understood which side to take.

%BENEFICIARY_NAME% wants us to defend %STATION_NAME% from the attack by %VICTIM_NAME%. It needs a bright event to advertise in the SBN. Of course, the corporation will not say that it seized the asset from the quasimorphs, it will lie about the Civil Resistance. Our task: to make sure that it won't get what it wants.

The attackers have already penetrated the perimeter of %STATION_NAME%. We have not yet understood whether it is <color=#FFFEC1>Security Service</color> or <color=#FFFEC1>PMC</color>. But it shouldn't make much difference to you. We'll drop you off in the main strike zone. As soon as you find your feet, <color=#FFFEC1>take up defensive position</color>. Sooner or later the attackers will retreat, you just need to hold out for enough time.

%STATION_NAME% was and remains a symbol that the order of the Solar System has changed forever. The <color=#FFFEC1>Hexarchy</color> will not be able to hide the truth forever. Lying will not help them when %BENEFICIARY_NAME% strikes back. A valuable gift from it arrived on Magnum, which will greatly help us in the future.
<color=#FFFEC1>Task:</color> Escort the Duke of %BENEFICIARY_NAME% to the safe location.

Details: %VICTIM_NAME% has launched activities around %STATION_NAME%. However, the station is in the hands of %BENEFICIARY_NAME%. The rightful owners of the Solar System will not give up so easily. And %VICTIM_NAME% understands this. It seems that it is preparing an action to eliminate the Duke of %BENEFICIARY_NAME%.

The quasimorphs call on their faithful servants to fulfill their sacred duty. If we want to strengthen our relationship with %BENEFICIARY_NAME%, we must take on the role of the Duke's personal guard. We need to escort it to the safe location on the station and protect it from attacks by fighters of %VICTIM_NAME%.

%BENEFICIARY_NAME% has called us for a specific purpose: <color=#FFFEC1>escort the Duke to safety</color> at %STATION_NAME%. Corporations send their best fighters into battle against quasimorphs, so save your strength.
<color=#FFFEC1>Task:</color> Escort the Duke of %BENEFICIARY_NAME% to the safe location.

The envoys of %BENEFICIARY_NAME% conveyed to us the praise of the <color=#FFFEC1>Duke</color> and called for the expansion of allied relations. If we work for the future winner now, we will take a worthy place in the future new hierarchy of the Solar System.

<color=#FFFEC1>Details:</color> %BENEFICIARY_NAME% has long held %STATION_NAME%. Presumably, the station is built into some kind of system that allows quasimorphs to stay in physical reality. %VICTIM_NAME% found out about this and decided to attack. Its target is the <color=#FFFEC1>reliquary</color>. %BENEFICIARY_NAME% will be grateful to us if we protect it.
Mercenaries from %VICTIM_NAME% are already attacking %STATION_NAME%. You need to <color=#FFFEC1>protect the reliquary</color>. Eliminate the attackers before they destroy the artifact.
<color=#FFFEC1>Task:</color> You need to <color=#FFFEC1>protect the reliquary</color> - a quasimorphic artifact similar to a statue or obelisk.
The meeting with quasimorphs from %BENEFICIARY_NAME% took place. The cargo has been received. <color=#FFFEC1>Creepy</color> creatures, but I think I'm starting to get used to them.

Details: %VICTIM_NAME% conducts operations related to %STATION_NAME%. The object has long been in the hands of %BENEFICIARY_NAME%.

We have recognized the signature of an igvalite emanating from the station. It is a quasimorphic artifact capable of accumulating gavvakh. It seems that %BENEFICIARY_NAME% is using this place to store energy.

We can get here before the attackers and eliminate the infiltration teams of %VICTIM_NAME%. If we do this, the future owners of the Solar System will be extremely generous.

Several infiltration teams from %VICTIM_NAME% have already infiltrated %STATION_NAME%. You need to find them and eliminate them before they take over the igvalite. %BENEFICIARY_NAME% is ready to give out a really good reward for this rock.

I hope we chose the right side, Boss.
The meeting with quasimorphs from %BENEFICIARY_NAME% took place. This is a good deal: a rock that is useless to us in exchange for something that actually works.

Details: The Shedu's Thousand appeared here to return the Solar System to Gagtungr. Now the warriors of Urparp are looking for anyone who will capture %STATION_NAME% for them in order to turn this place into another bastion of the future Golden Empire. It is in the hands of %VICTIM_NAME%. These upstarts must be expelled from physical reality forever.

We will crush them, and Gagtungr will turn his attention to us.

We don't know how some quasimorphs remain in our reality, while the majority are always attracted by their bramfaturas. I want to say that %STATION_NAME% is simply teeming with warriors of %VICTIM_NAME%. Sensors show that they are aware of the attack and are waiting for your arrival.

Proceed methodically, do not take unnecessary risks. Kill enough and the survivors will run. At the end of the mission, as soon as you leave the facility, the Shedu's Thousand will send its duke.

Soldiers of the <color=#FFFEC1>Shedu's Thousand</color> settle in %STATION_NAME%. They are pleased with our success. Soon <color=#FFFEC1>Gagtungr</color> will awaken and turn his benevolent gaze on us. Something extremely valuable has already been transferred to Magnum.

Details: %VICTIM_NAME% captured %STATION_NAME%. The Shedu's Thousand wants to teach these rebels a lesson. The will of Gagtungr must be fulfilled. The Duke of %VICTIM_NAME% is currently located in this location. It is preparing quasimorphs to attack the stations captured by the Shedu's Thousand.

We eliminate the Duke, and Gagtungr will treat his new servants favorably, when he wakes up.

We'll drop you off wherever we can. <color=#FFFEC1>Kill the Duke</color>. Don't try to be a hero and clear out the entire %STATION_NAME%. Don't take unnecessary risks, save your strength. I send the target location to your map. Good luck.
The <color=#FFFEC1>Shedu's Thousand</color> were satisfied. Their gift for our obedience awaits us in the Magnum’s cargo hold.

Details: Soldiers of the Shedu's Thousand have lifted the curtain on how quasimorphs linger in physical reality. They learned to bind their energy to a special reliquary that serves as another object of worship. And somehow %VICTIM_NAME% also came into possession of this secret.

At the station they control, %STATION_NAME%, there is a reliquary that gives them the ability to remain in our world. We can show the Shedu's Thousand our importance if we destroy this artifact.

What the sensors show is impossible to believe. This <color=#FFFEC1>reliquary</color>... it just shines! %STATION_NAME% is literally swarming with quasimorphs. Show %VICTIM_NAME% how people fight. Let's prove our usefulness to <color=#FFFEC1>Gagtungr</color>.
<color=#FFFEC1>Task:</color> find and destroy the <color=#FFFEC1>reliquary</color> - a quasimorphic artifact similar to a statue or obelisk.

The quasimorphs of %VICTIM_NAME% at %STATION_NAME% resemble bees in a disturbed hive. The time will soon come to strike here again.

The Shedu's Thousand is extremely pleased with our work. We received a valuable gift from her for our work.
<color=#FFFEC1>Task:</color> Pick up the <color=#FFFEC1>igvalite</color> at %STATION_NAME% and evacuate with it.

<color=#FFFEC1>Details:</color> %VICTIM_NAME% firmly holds %STATION_NAME%. Operatives of The <color=#FFFEC1>Shedu's Thousand</color> told us that at %STATION_NAME% there is an <color=#FFFEC1>igvalite</color> - a special mineral-like entity. The <color=#FFFEC1>Igvalite</color> is capable of accumulating gavvakh - energy that powers quasimorphs. If we want to serve the army of <color=#FFFEC1>Gagtungr</color>, we must get this mineral for it.

The signature of the igvalite has been found, its location is marked on the map. We'll try to drop you off as close to the location as possible, but we can't promise anything: the shuttle pilot is already reporting strange visions.

Move through %STATION_NAME% carefully, save your strength. %VICTIM_NAME% will certainly defend the igvalite with special zeal.
<color=#FFFEC1>Task:</color> Pick up <color=#FFFEC1>igvalite</color> at %STATION_NAME% and evacuate with it.
The meeting with the operatives of the <color=#FFFEC1>Shedu's Thousand</color> took place. We gave them the <color=#FFFEC1>igvalite</color>, they gave us a worthy reward.

Details: %BENEFICIARY_NAME% needs our services. Their %STATION_NAME% is being attacked by %VICTIM_NAME%. Both groups of quasimorphs not only know how to linger in physical reality, but have also learned to bypass the SBN filters and constantly transmit messages to the network. Each faction considers itself the true master of the Solar System.

An attack on the station can begin at any moment, and if we want to improve relations with %BENEFICIARY_NAME%, then we should hurry.

As soon as we get you there, the attack will begin. Sensors show that hostile quasimorphs have already appeared in certain areas of %STATION_NAME%. <color=#FFFEC1>Hold out as long as possible</color>, their onslaught will certainly weaken.
The reward from %BENEFICIARY_NAME% is already on Magnum. If we can hold off even %VICTIM_NAME%, does that mean we can destroy them? And is it worth doing this for the sake of other quasimorphs?
<color=#FFFEC1>Task:</color> Escort the Duke of %BENEFICIARY_NAME% to the safe location.

Details: The Shedu's Thousand brings order to the Solar System for the awakening of Gagtungr. This army is increasingly gaining a foothold in physical reality.

Now the warriors of Urparp are looking for anyone who will help capture %STATION_NAME%, turning it into another bastion of the future Golden Empire.

%VICTIM_NAME% holds on to this metal piece of matter as if it were the greatest of treasures. Let us crush them, and Gagtungr will be favorable to us when he awakens.

Even if the personnel of %STATION_NAME% are expecting an attack from the <color=#FFFEC1>Shedu's Thousand</color>, the appearance of a trained operative <color=#FFFEC1>PMC</color> here will be a surprise to them. Act according to the situation, be careful.

The <color=#FFFEC1>Shedu's Thousand</color> are satisfied with our work. %STATION_NAME% now resembles Pandemonium. A gift from them appeared in Magnum's cargo hold. We should try this artifact in action.

Details: The Shedu's Thousand joined the fight for the Solar System. Now the piercing gaze of Urparp is directed towards %STATION_NAME%, which is owned by %VICTIM_NAME%.

Operatives of the Shedu's Thousand say that there is a factor preventing the capture of this place. Our analysts studied the station and came to the conclusion that they are talking about the commander of the station’s defense. The Shedu's Thousand will be grateful to us if we eliminate them.

The shuttle will land wherever it can. %VICTIM_NAME% is using countermeasures on %STATION_NAME%, so we have to maneuver. Personnel occupy positions according to the combat schedule. Carry out a massacre, but get to the <color=#FFFEC1>commander</color> of these psychos. Finally a war.

The Shedu's Thousand is satisfied with our work. %VICTIM_NAME% is in turmoil; additional forces have been deployed to %STATION_NAME%. Maybe it's time to hit it somewhere else?

The army of Gagtungr gave us a worthy reward, the artifact has already been delivered to Magnum.

Details: The Shedu's Thousand wants to prepare the Solar System for the awakening of Gagtungr. You can join the future Golden Empire or lose.

The army of Gagtungr is showing interest in %STATION_NAME%. %VICTIM_NAME% placed in this place what the quasimorphs called an Altar of Knowledge. The Shedu's Thousand want this device destroyed before they send warriors to capture the facility.

Our analysts have studied %STATION_NAME%. Apparently, we are talking about some kind of computer, which %VICTIM_NAME% is using for an unknown purpose.

Let's hope the heralds of Ur will mention the destruction of the device among our achievements, which will be presented to Gagtungr after awakening.

We will try to throw you closer to the <color=#FFFEC1>computer</color>. It won't be easy: sensors show that the station's defenders are already preparing for an attack. The good news is that the location of the computer at %STATION_NAME% is also clearly visible, and I have marked it on your map. Did they choose to be public enemies? Show them the consequences of such a decision.

Without a server, %VICTIM_NAME% has no chance of holding %STATION_NAME%. The <color=#FFFEC1>Shedu's Thousand</color> are highly aware of the sensitive infrastructure of humans due to the large number of former <color=#FFFEC1>RealWare</color> soldiers in their ranks. They transferred something special from her arsenal to Magnum.
<color=#FFFEC1>Task:</color> Get to the ritual site and protect it.

Details: Warriors of the Shedu's Thousand know how the quasimorphic servants of Gagtungr maintain contact with physical reality. But this requires constant effort. An influx of gavvakh, reliquaries, and regular rituals that extract energy from the bramfaturas of the planets are needed.

Urparp senses that the influence of the bramfatura has reached its peak at %STATION_NAME%. It's time for the ritual. However, %VICTIM_NAME%, which controls the station, stands in the way.

The Shedu's Thousand calls on all available forces to ensure the Duke has the opportunity to perform the sacred ceremony. We have to hold the defense until the ritual is completed.

You know what's at stake. The <color=#FFFEC1>ritual</color> must be completed at any cost. %STATION_NAME% is under the control of %VICTIM_NAME%, and it will not retreat without a fight. <color=#FFFEC1>Your task</color> is to make your way to the ritual site and hold the position until the end.
<color=#FFFEC1>Task:</color> Get to the ritual site and protect it.

Good job, the <color=#FFFEC1>Shedu's Thousand</color> is extremely pleased. The ritual was completed successfully. The army of <color=#FFFEC1>Gagtungr</color> can operate in this part of the Solar System and beyond. They handed the reward to Magnum.

<color=#FFFEC1>Details:</color> %STATION_NAME% is evidence that the appearance of the Solar System has changed forever. But not all people are ready to accept that the awakening of quasimorphs directly affects their fate. The owner of the station, %BENEFICIARY_NAME%, wants us to <color=#FFFEC1>take up its defense</color> from the forces of %VICTIM_NAME%. The outcasts need a bright event, an example to corporations that they, too, are able to influence the balance of power in the System. Let's show them how wrong they are.

The <color=#FFFEC1>Civil Resistance</color> colnodes have already penetrated the perimeter of %STATION_NAME%. We'll drop you off in the main strike zone. <color=#FFFEC1>Hold your defense</color> until the enemies retreat.

%STATION_NAME% is a symbol that the order of the Solar System has changed forever. %VICTIM_NAME% failed to show that humanity is capable of challenging the new masters. We received a valuable artifact from %BENEFICIARY_NAME% in gratitude for our work.

If we respond to the call for help, we will need to provide the attackers with a worthy meeting: hold back their attacks until reinforcements from %BENEFICIARY_NAME% will arrive.

%VICTIM_NAME% throws squad after squad into battle. You need to <color=#FFFEC1>hold out</color> long enough for %BENEFICIARY_NAME% to bring forces to the station that will force the outcasts to make sure that this time they will not succeed.
