Several groups of %VICTIM_NAME% have already infiltrated %STATION_NAME%. You need to find them and eliminate them before they take over the igvalite. %BENEFICIARY_NAME% is ready to give out a really good reward for this stone.

How did we even get into this, Boss?
<color=#FFFEC1>Task:</color> Eliminate all groups of quasimorphs who came for the <color=#FFFEC1>igvalite</color>.
The meeting with %BENEFICIARY_NAME% took place. This is a good deal: a rock that is useless to us in exchange for something that actually works.

Details: The Shedu's Thousand brings order to the Solar System for the awakening of Gagtungr. This army is increasingly anchored in physical reality. Now they are looking for anyone who can help take over %STATION_NAME% and turn it into another bastion of the future Golden Empire.

%VICTIM_NAME% clings to this metal piece of matter as if it were the greatest of treasures. Let's crush them, and Gagtungr will turn his gaze on us when he wakes up.

Even if the personnel of %STATION_NAME% are expecting an attack from the <color=#FFFEC1>Shedu's Thousand</color>, the appearance of a trained operative <color=#FFFEC1>PMC</color> here will be a surprise to them. Act according to the situation, be careful.

The <color=#FFFEC1>Shedu's Thousand</color> are satisfied with our work. %STATION_NAME% now resembles Pandemonium. A gift from them appeared in Magnum's cargo hold. We should try this artifact in action.

Details: The Shedu's Thousand joined the fight for the Solar System. Now the piercing gaze of Urparp is directed towards %STATION_NAME%, which is owned by %VICTIM_NAME%.

Operatives of the Shedu's Thousand say that there is a factor preventing the capture of this place. Our analysts studied the station and came to the conclusion that we are talking about the commander of the station’s defense. The Shedu's Thousand will be grateful to us if we eliminate them.

The shuttle will land wherever it can. %VICTIM_NAME% is using countermeasures on %STATION_NAME%, so we have to maneuver. Personnel occupy positions according to the combat schedule. Carry out a massacre, but get to their <color=#FFFEC1>commander</color>. Finally a war.

The Shedu's Thousand is satisfied with our work. %VICTIM_NAME% is in turmoil; additional forces have been deployed to %STATION_NAME%. Maybe it's time to hit it somewhere else?

The army of Gagtungr gave us a worthy reward, the artifact has already been delivered to Magnum.

Details: The Shedu's Thousand wants to prepare the Solar System for the awakening of Gagtungr. You can join the future Golden Empire or lose.

The army of Gagtungr is showing interest in %STATION_NAME%. %VICTIM_NAME% placed in this place what the quasimorphs called an Altar of Knowledge. The Shedu's Thousand want this device destroyed before they send warriors to capture the facility.

Our analysts have studied %STATION_NAME%. Apparently, we are talking about some kind of computer, which %VICTIM_NAME% is using for an unknown purpose.

Let's hope the heralds of Ur mention destroying the device among our merits, which will be presented to Gagtungr after awakening.

We will try to throw you closer to the <color=#FFFEC1>computer</color>. It won't be easy: sensors show that the station's defenders are already preparing for an attack. The good news is that the location of the computer at %STATION_NAME% is also clearly visible, and I have marked it on your map. Did they choose to be public enemies? Show them the consequences of such a decision.

Without a server, %VICTIM_NAME% has no chance of holding %STATION_NAME%. The <color=#FFFEC1>Shedu's Thousand</color> are highly aware of the sensitive infrastructure of humans due to the large number of former <color=#FFFEC1>RealWare</color> soldiers in their ranks. They transferred something special from her arsenal to Magnum.
<color=#FFFEC1>Task:</color> Get to the ritual site and protect it.

Details: Warriors of the Shedu's Thousand know how the quasimorphic servants of Gagtungr maintain contact with physical reality. But this requires constant effort. An influx of gavvakh, reliquaries, and regular rituals that extract energy from the bramfaturas of the planets are needed.

Urparp senses that the influence of the bramfatura has reached its peak at %STATION_NAME%. It's time for the ritual. However, %VICTIM_NAME%, which controls the station, stands in the way.

The Shedu's Thousand calls on all available forces to ensure the Duke has the opportunity to perform the sacred ceremony. We have to hold the defense until the ritual is completed.

You know what's at stake. The <color=#FFFEC1>ritual</color> must be completed at any cost. %STATION_NAME% is under the control of %VICTIM_NAME%, and it will not retreat without a fight. <color=#FFFEC1>Your task</color> is to make your way to the ritual site and hold the position until the end.
<color=#FFFEC1>Task:</color> Get to the ritual site and protect it.

Good job, the <color=#FFFEC1>Shedu's Thousand</color> are extremely pleased. The ritual was completed successfully. The army of <color=#FFFEC1>Gagtungr</color> can operate in this part of the Solar System and beyond. They transferred the reward to Magnum.

<color=#FFFEC1>Details:</color> %STATION_NAME% is evidence that the appearance of the Solar System has changed forever. But not all people are ready to accept that the awakening of quasimorphs directly affects their fate. The owner of the station, %BENEFICIARY_NAME%, wants us to <color=#FFFEC1>take up its defense</color> from the forces of %VICTIM_NAME%. The outcasts need a bright event, an example to corporations that they, too, are able to influence the balance of power in the System. Let's show them how wrong they are.
Fighters from %VICTIM_NAME% have already penetrated the perimeter of %STATION_NAME%. We'll drop you off in the main strike zone. <color=#FFFEC1>Hold your defense</color> until the enemies retreat.

%STATION_NAME% is a symbol that the order of the Solar System has changed forever. %VICTIM_NAME% failed to show that humanity is capable of challenging the new masters. We received a valuable artifact from %BENEFICIARY_NAME% in gratitude for our work.
<color=#FFFEC1>Task:</color> Escort the Duke of %BENEFICIARY_NAME% to the safe location.

Details: %VICTIM_NAME% has launched activities around %STATION_NAME%. However, the object is in the hands of %BENEFICIARY_NAME%. The rightful owners of the Solar System will not give up so easily. And %VICTIM_NAME% understands this. It seems that it is preparing an action to eliminate the Duke of %BENEFICIARY_NAME%.

The quasimorphs call on their faithful servants to fulfill their sacred duty. If we want to strengthen our relationship with %BENEFICIARY_NAME%, we must take on the role of the Duke's personal guard. We need to escort it to the safe location at the station and protect it from attacks by the rabble of %VICTIM_NAME%.
%BENEFICIARY_NAME% has called us for a specific <color=#FFFEC1>task</color>: to escort the Duke to safety at %STATION_NAME%. You should easily deal with the militants of %VICTIM_NAME%.
<color=#FFFEC1>Task:</color> Escort the Duke of %BENEFICIARY_NAME% to the safe location.

The envoys of %BENEFICIARY_NAME% conveyed to us the praise of the <color=#FFFEC1>Duke</color> and called for the expansion of allied relations. If we work for the future winner now, we will take a worthy place in the future new hierarchy of the Solar System.

Details: %VICTIM_NAME% conducts operations related to %STATION_NAME%. The object has long been in the hands of %BENEFICIARY_NAME%.

We have recognized the signature of an igvalite emanating from the station. It is a quasimorphic artifact capable of accumulating gavvakh. It seems that %BENEFICIARY_NAME% is using this place to store energy.

We can get here before the attackers and eliminate the infiltration teams of %VICTIM_NAME%. If we do this, the future owners of the Solar System will be extremely generous.

Several infiltration teams from %VICTIM_NAME% have already infiltrated %STATION_NAME%. You need to find them and eliminate them before they take over the igvalite. The quasimorphs are ready to give out a really good reward for this rock.

I hope we chose the right side, Boss.
The meeting with quasimorphs from %BENEFICIARY_NAME% took place. This is a good deal: a rock that is useless to us in exchange for something that actually works.

Boss, %VICTIM_NAME% is attacking %STATION_NAME%, regardless of losses. Looks like the outcasts really need something at this station. %BENEFICIARY_NAME% calls on its loyal servants to help. The quasimorphs would like to keep the station for themselves.

If we respond to the call for help, we will need to provide the attackers with a worthy meeting: hold back their attacks until reinforcements from %BENEFICIARY_NAME% will arrive.
%VICTIM_NAME% throws squad after squad into battle. You need to <color=#FFFEC1>hold out</color> until the forces of %BENEFICIARY_NAME% arrive.
%BENEFICIARY_NAME% retains full control of %STATION_NAME%. Our quasimorphic allies (or masters?) thanked us and sent valuable cargo to Magnum.
When activated, creates an additional random mission in the current system
When starting a mission, automatically scans the station floors starting from the first one
Allows modification of weapon parameters for item chips
Allows modification of armor parameters for item chips
Additional consumables drop after completing missions
Automatically disassembles items into components with 100% chance to drop materials
Allows modification of operative class for class chips
Allows you to modify pacts for pacts
Allows you to navigate the Solar System through bramfaturae
Allows you to summon a capsule to evacuate items from a mission to Magnum
Shuttle gets its own inventory (extra items per mission and evacuation slots)
Allows items to be sold at stations on distant satellites and planets
Allows you to modify operative parameters for operative chips
You can assign a live operative to passively pump perks.
